runners.comment: Minor promise in bumpers and on hurdles debut, improvement needed to feature here
runners.name: Cluain Chormaic
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in bumpers and not a bad run on hurdles debut at Cork last month but will need to improve plenty to feature here.

runners.comment: Fourth in two points, tongue tied for Rules' debut, likely best watched
runners.name: Green Hope
runners.spotlight: Fourth in both point-to-point starts for William Crawford; likely best watched in first-time tongue tie on Rules' debut.

runners.comment: Point winner, may have needed the run latest, this trip should suit, can't discount
runners.name: Jet To Monte Carlo
runners.spotlight: Well-bred sort won a point-to-point in decisive fashion back in March; sent off at 2-1 on Rules' debut for a Navan bumper last month but was beaten 12.5l into sixth of 10; may have needed that and this longer trip should suit on hurdling debut; can't discount.

runners.comment: Westerner gelding, 8l runner up in point to point last month, Kennedy prefers stablemate
runners.name: King Of Westeros
runners.spotlight: One of four for yard; Westerner gelding was an 8l runner up in sole point-to-point start at Damma House for Colin Bowe early last month; in good hands but Kennedy prefers Lazare de Star.

runners.breeder: M Thomas Vigneron, M Mathieu Lochin, M Loic Lochin
runners.comment: Promising rules' debut in a Navan maiden hurdle, preferred by Kennedy, leading claims
runners.name: Lazare De Star
runners.spotlight: One of four for yard; bought for E190,000 after a 1.5l second in a Fairyhouse point-to-point; shaped with promise on his Rules debut when 3.75l behind the well backed Saint Baco in a Navan maiden hurdle (2m, sft-hvy); pulled well clear of the third and is preferred by Kennedy; leading chance.

stable_tour.quote: He kept on well into second in his sole point for Rob James. He's a big horse and hopefully he has a big future too. He's ready to start off in a bumper soon. 26-10-25

runners.breeder: M Xavier Leredde & S C P Ecurie Du Sud
runners.comment: Solid run in defeat behind stablemate at Wexford, step up in trip a plus, hooded
runners.name: Le Moulin Rouge
runners.spotlight: Fell two out when still in contention in sole point-to-point; solid run in defeat when a keeping on 5l third behind stablemate Sageborough at Wexford (16.5f, yielding); this longer trip should suit on that evidence; chance in first-time hood.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten at 22-1 on debut at Punchestown, Lazare de Star looks yard's main hope
runners.name: Llems
runners.spotlight: One of four for yard; 22-1 and failed to land a blow in a Punchestown maiden hurdle on debut last month; in form stable seemingly has better chance with Lazare de Star.

runners.comment: Bumper winner, beaten 13l on hurdles/stable debut, may come on for that, can't discount
runners.name: Midnight Jet
runners.spotlight: Killarney bumper winner in May (2m1f, yielding)  for Sam Curling; beaten 13l into third of 16 when sent off at 6-4 on hurdles and stable debut and seasonal return at Cork; likely to come on for that and not discounted upped in trip.

runners.comment: Runner up behind subsequent Rules' winner in sole point, obvious interest for top yard
runners.name: Mighty Park
runners.spotlight: Finished a 1.5l runner up behind subsequent Exeter novice hurdle winner Harry Lowes in a point-to-point at Quakerstown in April; half-brother to Might Bite is of obvious interest for top yard on Rules' debut.

stable_tour.quote: Went close in a Quakerstown point for Donnchadh Doyle and was nicely clear of the third there. Chasing will be his game down the line, but we'll kick off in bumpers this season. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Fat win here in 2023 for Aidan O'Brien, no joy since, watch on hurdles/stable debut
runners.name: Ocean Of Dreams

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ocean Of Dreams just needed two belts and he was gone. I was very impressed and I think he has Classic potential - Seamie Heffernan, rider

runners.spotlight: Won a heavy ground 1m maiden here in October 2023 for Aidan O'Brien; failed to add to his tally for Archie Watson and likely best watched on first start over hurdles for new yard.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Leopardstown impressively and he's getting ready for the Ballysax. He's working lovely and he's a bit of a baby as he's only had one run. He seems a lovely horse. He has a very good pedigree - he goes back to Urban Sea. I think he's a type for a Derby trial, no doubt about that. 03-04-24

runners.comment: Runner up to smart Oh My Word in Navan bumper, should stay this far, could go well
runners.name: Royal Gladiator
runners.spotlight: Didn't cut much ice in a pair of point-to-points but ran a fine race to finish a 1.25l second on Rules' debut in a Navan bumper (2m, sft-hvy) last month behind the smart prospect Oh My Word; good chance he'll stay this far and could go well on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Modest Flat performer, no impact in two maiden hurdles, unlikely to be the answer
runners.name: Surrey Force
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat performer has failed to land a blow in two maiden hurdles; unlikely to be the answer here.

runners.comment: Promise on debut at Punchestown, needs more to feature here but that's not impossible
runners.name: Therhythmofthenite
runners.spotlight: From a good family and made a promising debut in a Punchestown maiden hurdle (19.5f, sft-hvy) last month, staying on for a 15l fourth of 24; will need to improve to feature here but that is not impossible.

runners.comment: Point winner, beaten fav' on Rules debut in a Limerick bumper, overlooked by Kennedy
runners.name: Tip Of The Wings
runners.spotlight: One of four for yard; won a point-to-point by 4l in March and the runner up has since placed in a maiden hurdle; soundly beaten when the even money favourite on Rules' debut in a Limerick bumper last month; Jack Kennedy prefers Lazare de Star.

stable_tour.quote: He's nice and is ready to run. He won his point nicely and will kick off in a bumper soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: 66-1 and well beaten on hurdles debut at Punchestown, others preferred; tongue tied
runners.name: Foxy Footprints
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and beaten 19.5l on hurdling debut in a Gowran maiden early last month (2m, heavy); now tongue tied; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: E42,000 Order Of St George filly, half-sister to bumper winner, check the market
runners.name: Lunar Majesty
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George filly was a E42,000 3yo; half-sister to bumper winner Linda Moon; unraced dam closely related to winners The Dutchman (smart 2m-3m2f hurdle/chase) and The Pirate's Queen (bumper/useful 2m3f hurdle); check the market.

12:45.race_name: Mercedes Benz South Dublin Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Talented chaser, rated 18lb lower over hurdles but out of form recently, others preferred
runners.name: Hgranca De Thaix

quotes.race: EMS Copiers Novice Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Hgranca De Thaix got the rain and I was delighted to see it. He's been progressing all season and he got in here off a nice weight. His jumping was exceptional. He's only seven and I hope he would be a Munster National or a Paddy Power horse later in the year - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Races On Instagram Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I fancied Hgranca De Thaix with the 10lb turnaround and the step up in trip. He was always staying on over shorter and he loves that ground. He was 121 over hurdles and was given 127 over fences, which I thought was a bit steep, but the handicapper is never too far wrong. If the rain keeps coming, we could probably turn him out again in the next month - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hgranca De Thaix had four runs in handicaps so I was pretty confident coming here that he had the experience under his belt. He did well over the summer and is only a five-year-old. He jumped great apart from one he fiddled down the back. I'd say he'll have no bother jumping a fence in due course. He could end up being a three-mile horse. He's a nice one. There's a 2m4f novice handicap hurdle at Leopardstown at Christmas and whether he runs between now and then, I'm not sure - Barry Connell, trainer/owner

runners.spotlight: Smart chaser finished last season tamely and never looked like exploiting his much lower hurdling mark on his seasonal return at Galway; may come on for that but others appeal more.

runners.comment: H'cap debutant, fair efforts in maidens at 2m-2m4f, may go well in first-time cheekpieces
runners.name: Coyote Spirit
runners.spotlight: Good ground bumper winner; fair efforts in maiden hurdles at 2m-2m4f and looks to be on a fair mark for his handicap debut; could go well in first-time cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: It didn't happen for him at Down Royal but he's better than that. He's been schooling well and we'll find a suitable maiden hurdle for him. 26-10-25

runners.breeder: M Arnaud Chaille-Chaille & M Pascal Magne
runners.comment: Hiked up 6lb for 4l Thurles win last month, more on her plate now in this tougher race
runners.name: Jolie Jewel
runners.spotlight: Hold up sort bounced back to form with a 4l win off 6lb lower at Thurles last month (2m4f, yld-sft); more on her plate now upped in grade and she was beaten 11.5l in this last year off 7lb lower.

runners.comment: Up 16lb for easy Bellewstown win, struggled off revised mark latest, may be on tough mark
runners.name: Garnacho

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We are delighted and it is great that it has worked out. We just go out there and get the horse to do as well as we can and if it works it works, if it doesn't it doesn't. It looks like Garnacho will have a good future over fences too, once he stays sound. We will have a look at Galway and see what's there for him - Mark Fahey, trainer, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.spotlight: Justified strong market support when scoring by 12l on her debut for this yard at Bellewstown (20.5f, good) in July; raised 16lb and well beaten at Galway in August on sole start since; may be on a tough mark for now.

runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mr N Farrell
runners.comment: Excellent second in stronger race than this latest, in the mix again off 4lb higher
runners.name: The Nagger Reidy
runners.owner: It All Started In Belmont Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Niall S Farrell

runners.spotlight: Last won off 20lb lower at Listowel in September 2024; fine efforts in defeat both starts this season and his latest second came in a much deeper race than this at Naas (2m4f, sft-hvy); should be in the mix again off 4lb higher.

runners.comment: Bumper winner, 0-10 over hurdles, has placed in maidens, would prefer softer ground
runners.name: Cut The Rope
runners.owner: Brian P Whelan & Thomas J Quinn

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Anne Coffey & Mrs K Browne

runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; bumper winner is 0-10 over hurdles but has run well in defeat at times in maidens; solid run on the Flat on latest but would probably prefer softer ground than this.

runners.comment: Listed bumper winner, solid maiden form, ground not ideal for h'cap debut, can do better
runners.name: Aruntothequeen
runners.owner: J P Oflaherty & Mark E Phelan

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It's a brilliant result. Aruntothequeen is a big galloper and all she does is stay. She's a lovely filly to look forward to. Definitely when she goes up to three miles it will be her optimum trip. She's a proper good staying type of filly - Harry Swan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Listed bumper winner at Gowran last year (2m, good); decent efforts in maidens at 2m-2m4f and ground may have been too soft for her on handicap debut at Punchestown last month; capable of better and not discounted.

runners.comment: Won off 7lb lower on penultimate, beaten off revised mark latest, bit to prove for now
runners.name: King In Love
runners.spotlight: Gained second handicap win off 7lb lower at Cork (2m, yielding) early last month; well beaten off revised mark at Punchestown last time (2m1f, sft-hvy) and a bit to prove after that.

runners.comment: Close third in this last year off 11lb lower, heavy ground an excuse latest, could rebound
runners.name: Aurea Fortuna
runners.spotlight: Close third in this race last year off 99; won off 101 at Galway in August and added a Punchestown handicap chase in October; heavy ground an excuse when well beaten in a handicap chase at Cheltenham latest; could bounce back.

runners.comment: Handicap debutant, best maiden efforts at around 2m-2m1f, probably best watched
runners.name: Ivybrook
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant is 0-6 over hurdles but he has shown ability on more than one occasion; best efforts have come at around 2m-2m1f though, so probably best watched.

runners.comment: 0-5 over timber, fine effort on h'cap debut last month, big player again off 1lb higher
runners.name: Lambay Island
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over timber but he has run well in defeat, including when beaten 5l into second of 12 on handicap debut at Thurles last month (2m4f, yld-sft); big player again off 1lb higher for yard that won this in 2023.

runners.comment: Won at Galway in October, beaten off revised mark twice since, cheekpieces need to spark
runners.name: Paul Collins
runners.spotlight: Won off 3lb lower at Galway in October (2m6f, yielding) but has struggled off his revised mark twice since; first-time cheekpieces need to spark a revival.

stable_tour.quote: Made a few mistakes on the way to finishing third in a maiden hurdle at Wexford on Sunday. If we can iron out his jumping, he should do okay. He'll improve plenty from that first run. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Beaten fav' in this last year, pulled up sole start since, questions to answer
runners.name: His Nibs
runners.spotlight: Maiden was sent off the 5-1 favourite for this race last year and was beaten 9l into fifth; pulled up on sole start since at Cork last month; questions to answer for now.

runners.comment: Only seen twice since July 2024 win, pulled up on stable bow latest, cheekpieces tried
runners.name: Gone For Tea

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The plan was trying to get Gone For Tea settled, as she was running a bit on her nerves of late, but she settled brilliantly and came home really well. She felt a little bit green in among horses as it was the first time she's been ridden like that. She had some good bumper and maiden hurdle form, so it's nice to get one on her - Sam Ewing, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Bumper and Sligo handicap hurdle winner off 1lb lower for Peter Fahey in July 2024; only seen twice since and was pulled up on debut for this stable at Punchestown last month; cheekpieces now tried.

runners.comment: On long losing run, remains 3lb above last win, needs more to get his head back in front
runners.name: Petit King
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run and remains 3lb above that last success in December 2023; decent runs in defeat both starts this term but needs more to get his head back in front.

runners.comment: 2-12 over timber, pulled up in Thurles h'cap chase latest, best watched back over hurdles
runners.name: Rockstown Girl

quotes.race: Capital Windscreens In Memory Of Aaron Jones EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices Hurdle (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Rockstown Girl was suited by the step up in trip. She had some smart bumper form and we might look to see if there is something for her at Cheltenham's November meeting - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 2-12 over timber; has been chasing recently to no avail and rider reported she stopped quickly when pulled up at Thurles last time; likely best watched now reverting to hurdling.

runners.comment: Won this last year off 2lb lower, okay efforts this term, new headgear combo, considered
runners.name: Giant Haystacks
runners.spotlight: Won this last year off just 2lb lower; okay efforts in defeat at Punchestown and Thurles this term and this has likely been the plan; considered in new headgear combination.

runners.comment: 3-32 over hurdles, remains 5lb above last win, yet to score going left-handed
runners.name: Clonbury Bridge

quotes.race: Book Your Easter Early Bird Tickets Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Clonbury Bridge is a great little horse. He had a lovely run at Navan over 2m last time and this was a lovely race for him. He is what he is - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival 2024 Qualifier Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clonbury Bridge got a nice blow and I was able to fill him up turning in. It probably made the difference. He was good and brave - Donagh Meyler, rider.

quotes.race: C Russell Auto Sales Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Clonbury Bridge got a hard fall at Fairyhouse in his first beginners' chase and lost his way a bit but we got his wind and that done, and now he seems to be back. We'll probably mix in some hurdling too. The bigger fences mightn't suit him because he's not overly big - Philip Dempsey, trainer

quotes.race: Foynes Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Clonbury Bridge had a few nice runs, has been consistent enough without winning and the bit of nicer ground helped - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Six-time winner is 3-32 over hurdles; last scored in this sphere at Cork in March 2024 off 5lb lower; beaten 7l when runner up at Navan on latest (2m4f, sft-hvy) off 2lb lower; more needed off this mark and yet to win going left-handed.

runners.comment: Won three of last five at Sligo, raised 8lb for latest win, easier ground here a query
runners.name: Cornmarket
runners.owner: John J Cullen & Michael C Barrett
runners.spotlight: In fine form since joining this yard and has won three of his last five, all at Sligo at 2m4f-25.5f on good and good to yielding ground; raised 8lb for his latest success in October and easier ground to contend with here; career best needed.

runners.comment: Beaten similar distances in maidens, potential improver on h'cap debut, check market
runners.name: Jury Foreman
runners.spotlight: Beaten similar distances in a trio of maidens at 2m-2m4f; potential improver on handicap debut and worth a market check.

runners.comment: 3-21 over hurdles, okay efforts in defeat in chases last three starts, not discounted
runners.name: Warm In Gorey

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Fanzone "Your Team Your Game" Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Warm In Gorey appreciated being dropped in over the longer trip and he likes good ground. He has been consistent on this ground. The owners would love to go to Galway - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 3-21 over hurdles and went close on last start in this sphere at Cork in August (18.5f, good) off 2lb lower; okay efforts in defeat in chases last three starts and not discounted on return to hurdling.

runners.comment: Maiden winner, improved effort at Wexford latest, Darragh O'Keefe prefers Lambay Island
runners.name: Rockonliam

quotes.race: Kelly Bros Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He loved conditions and going left-handed suited Rockonliam as well. He jumped really well bar the fourth-last and it was a good performance. He will get further and will jump a fence as well, as he is a fine, big, scopey lad - Darragh O'Keeffe, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Killarney maiden hurdle winner in May (2m4f, yielding); improved from modest handicap debut when a 9.75l third of 14 at Wexford in October but Darragh O'Keefe prefers the chances of Lambay Island.

runners.comment: Chase winner, pulled up last run in that sphere at Thurles, blinkers on, others preferred
runners.name: Person Of Interest
runners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan
runners.spotlight: Chase winner is 0-6 over hurdles but he has run well in defeat; disappointing when pulled up in a Thurles handicap chase on latest and blinkers replace usual cheekpieces for return to hurdling; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Point winner, promise in maidens, ground possible excuse first two h'caps, may outrun odds
runners.name: Accustomed
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner showed promise in a couple of maiden hurdles; first two handicap efforts were poor but testing ground may not have suited; underfoot conditions more suitable here and he could go well at a price.

runners.comment: Tailed off on handicap debut upped to 2m5f at Tramore, can only be watched after that
runners.name: Kings Son
runners.spotlight: Solid effort when a 1.25l second in a Wexford maiden hurdle in October (16.5f, yielding); tailed off on handicap debut when upped to 2m5f at Tramore latest; can only be watched after that.

runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner, modest maiden hurdle efforts, could improve for h'caps
runners.name: Lips Freedom
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner in Germany (rated 90) makes his handicap debut after three modest efforts in maiden hurdles; could improve so is worth a market check.

13:20.race_name: Ballymaloe Relish Rising Stars Beginners Chase

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simom Et Al
runners.comment: Peak rating of 135 over timber, midfield on chase debut latest, improvement needed
runners.name: Cest Ta Chance

quotes.race: ClonmelRaces.ie (Q.R.) Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: C'Est Ta Chance had a good first run last year and we think he is better than his latest two runs, so hopefully he will make into a graded horse - Patrick Mullins, rider

runners.spotlight: One of two for top yard; 1-6 over timber, achieving a peak rating of 135 in that sphere; midfield when beaten 20l on chase debut at Fairyhouse on seasonal return last month (15l behind Kiss Will); needs to improve plenty to turn that form around.

stable_tour.quote: A point winner who will go novice hurdling now, he looks more of a stayer than a speed horse to me, so will probably want a trip. 25-11-24

runners.comment: 140 rated hurdler, well beaten both chase starts at Navan, others appeal more
runners.name: Karl Des Tourelles
runners.spotlight: 1-9 over hurdles and rated 140 in that sphere; well beaten in both chase starts at Navan and his official chase rating of 133 may flatter him on that evidence; others preferred.

runners.breeder: S A S Elevage Michel Rivaillon
runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner, promising third on chase debut latest, leading contender
runners.name: Kiss Will

quotes.race: British EBF Gold Castle "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I can't figure out what happened to Kiss Will at Cheltenham. It was too bad to be true, but he travelled really well here and coped with the trip. He could have a bright future. It was a big field and there was depth to the race - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse, Racecourse Of The Year 2024 Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a match from when we jumped off and I had the better of that before the turn in. Kiss Will lengthened well up the straight and showed a little bit more of a turn of foot than I thought he would. He could definitely be an exciting horse going forward - Paul Townend, jockey.

runners.spotlight: One of two for top yard; maiden and Listed novice winner over hurdles last season; finished 3.75l behind Patter Merchant when a 4l third on chasing debut at Fairyhouse (2m4f, heavy) last month; could turn that form around on this better ground.

stable_tour.quote: He was an emphatic winner of a hot Listed hurdle at Perth. He really appreciated the step up to three miles there and should develop into a nice staying novice over fences. I'm looking forward to seeing how he gets on when he goes chasing. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Course maiden hurdle winner, beaten 3l in 3m Gr 2 Novice latest, big chance back in trip
runners.name: Koktail Divin

quotes.race: Leopardstown Members Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Delighted with that. Koktail Divin had a lovely run at Christmas, I probably messed up and we were probably under the weather in January when I dropped back in trip but it was lovely to see him do that today.  We'll aim him at Aintree now - Henry de Bromhead, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Dual French bumper and maiden hurdle winner at this venue (2m4f, yielding) was no match for Romeo Coolio on chase debut at Down Royal in October; beaten 3l by Oscars Brother in a 3m Grade 2 novice at Punchestown last month (sft-hvy); big chance dropped back in trip on this better ground.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Down Royal when second to Romeo Coolio in a beginners' chase - I thought he jumped really nicely. That's what he's built for. I think he needs a step up in trip and we'll aim for a beginners' or a novice chase in the next few weeks. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Rated 126 over timber, well beaten both previous chase starts, h'caps beckon after this
runners.name: Maxi Mac Gold
runners.owner: Mrs K Browne & Mrs Anne Coffey

quotes.race: Racing Again May 21st Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maxi Mac Gold was the horse I fancied today. He is very genuine and he rides a classy sort of horse. His winter form was a class above any of these - Sean Flanagan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 1-9 over hurdles and rated 126; tried twice over fences last season and failed to land a blow; will qualify for handicaps after this run.

runners.breeder: Brittas House Stud And Grenane House
runners.comment: Course bumper winner, touched off last time at Fairyhouse, best form on testing ground
runners.name: Patter Merchant
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner; 1-8 over hurdles and rated 131; well behind Koktail Divin on chase debut at Down Royal before touched off on heavy ground at Fairyhouse last month (Kiss Will 3.75l behind in third); solid form claims but may want softer ground.

stable_tour.quote: This boy is not a bad horse at all. He beat Sounds Victorius when he won his bumper at Leopardstown last Christmas and that form has worked out well. It didn't look a bad maiden hurdle he won at Galway on Sunday and he is well worth a shot at a graded race next. 28-10-24

runners.comment: 2-4 over hurdles, solid chase debut on unsuitable ground last month, interesting
runners.name: Shuffle The Deck

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shuffle The Deck has come on from a good race at Punchestown and that rode like a good race today. I had a good lead all the way round, it was an end-to-end gallop and hopefully he's a good one - Mark Walsh, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: 2-4 over hurdles and rated 140; offered something to build on when a 15l fourth behind subsequent Grade 1 winner Kitzbuhel on chase debut and seasonal return at Punchestown (2m3f, sft-hvy); this ground more suitable and he is an interesting runner.

runners.comment: Bumper and point winner, worth a market check on chase debut for shrewd connections
runners.name: Soldier In Milan

quotes.race: Overlander INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Soldier In Milan is an exciting horse, I always thought a lot of him but he's a big unit, so I was terrified of the ground. He's an exciting horse for next season with a cut in the ground and should have a big future ahead of him. He was a 16-length point-to-point winner and was very impressive on the day. It's great to get that out of the way for this season but I think there could be big things ahead of him next year - Emmet Mullins, trainer

runners.spotlight: Won a strong point-to-point by a wide margin in March and ran out a comfortable winner of a Punchestown bumper in May (2m3f, yielding); interesting that shrewd connections have opted to go down the chasing route straight away and he needs checking in the market.

runners.comment: Classy hurdler, disappointing efforts in first two chases, Walsh prefers Shuffle The Deck
runners.name: The Wallpark

quotes.race: Deacy Gilligan Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Wallpark keeps winning. We will probably go to Cheltenham in October for a Pertemps Qualifier. He has his own way of doing it but he has an engine. If they went faster it would have suited him better - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Wallpark is a very tough horse and he is becoming a real fun horse. I think the ground suited him well. He's a young horse on the way up. I think he'll go further and he could be a horse that we will try and qualify for the Pertemps Final at Cheltenham next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Seamus Mulvaney Bookmaker Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Wallpark did it well. I would say he wants further, he was good and tough out there today - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Very classy hurdler rated 155 in that sphere; disappointing efforts in both starts over the bigger obstacles this season and Mark Walsh prefers the chances of the same owner's Shuffle The Deck.

stable_tour.quote: Made rapid progress in staying hurdles last season. Just came up short in the Grade 1s at Cheltenham and Punchestown, but ran well in both races nonetheless. We're keen to send him over fences and feel he could continue to progress in that sphere. He's a nice horse and should win plenty of races over fences. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Just lost out to Teahupoo on return to hurdling at Fairyhouse, almost sure to be involved
runners.name: Ballyburn

quotes.race: BAR 1 Betting Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Ballyburn felt like a happier horse than he was last season. I thought it was a decent run and it's a good starting point for his season - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Dooley Insurance Group Champion Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul [Townend] rode Ballyburn with different tactics to Cheltenham but he probably didn't jump well enough on the day. The trip is no problem but he's not a natural jumper of fences. We'll put a lot of thought into it, but the feeling is he could go back over hurdles. If he's not able to jump well enough in novices then he'll find it a lot tougher in open company next season. We know he jumps hurdles fantastically and there might be a gap in the staying hurdle division - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ballyburn was gone early and he wasn't travelling in my mind and then he made that bad mistake. The game was over early for him, but we might now go back in trip with him and maybe make more use of him. I don't think he enjoyed being put in the box seat there and they weren't going fast enough for him

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Kempton lit Ballyburn up so he was fairly lit today with Paul [Townend], but he eventually got him settled and he was afraid to move on him then in case he took off again. Paul had just been getting him from A to B over the jumps, but he flew from the last. Kempton was disappointing, but I knew after two or three jumps that he needed to learn very quickly and he didn't. He is bred to get three miles. It was fascinating that he was able to do what he did over two miles. Everyone had him down as a three-miler, but when you look at his page he isn't. He's back on track now. All the schooling we did at home has paid off. He still has a lot to learn about settling in a race and once he does he could be a fair weapon over three miles - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Wayward Lad Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Everything was fast on Ballyburn today. Ultimately, that was disappointing, like [Lossiemouth] yesterday. Win, lose or draw, he was going to learn a lot about racing today and we were going to learn more about him. I think we did both jobs but unfortunately we were second best. If you don't try, you don't find out these things and he wasn't fast enough around here over two miles - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Conway Piling Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Ballyburn did things very well. He took a good blow during the race which means there is plenty of improvement to come. He jumped from fence to fence and we are very happy with that. He has a lovely, low head carriage and usually horses like that are very good jumpers. There's no race for him at Christmas and we won't go Limerick or Leopardstown. We might look at Naas [new Racing Post-sponsored Grade 2 novice chase on January 5] or we could go to England; we'll have a look. We haven't been looking past today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Alanna Homes Champion Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Ballyburn did it well. He just has a huge engine and I'm looking forward to whatever he does next season. The way he got down and raced over the last two furlongs delighted us. Once he learns to settle I think he'll be a super horse - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Gallagher Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ballyburn could be anything. That was a Champion Hurdle performance in my book. You'd love to be going chasing with his pedigree and size and scope, but imagine - there you are, with Lossiemouth for the Champion Hurdle next year. I'll have to have a word with Ronnie [Bartlett] and David Manasseh, who own the horse. I don't know, we might just get on chasing and try to make a Gold Cup horse out of him, I don't know - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Ireland 50th Derby Sale Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Ballyburn met hurdle after hurdle right and was in control the whole way. Paul was very happy with how he did things. He did everything right over the minimum trip which is good - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Pigsback.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballyburn did what we hoped he might do in Fairyhouse. He jumped well and galloped out to the line. He improved hugely from Fairyhouse and I'm hoping there's plenty more improvement to come. Paul said he appears keen but it's just the way he carries his head low. You'd be thinking he's more of a two-and-a-half-mile horse, I don't know if we need to go out to 2m6f for the Dublin Racing Festival, depending on the ground - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: JP & M Doyle (C & G) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Ballyburn pulled very hard once again but once he got his second wind he galloped away. He looks a very nice horse for next season - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Hospitality At Festival 2023 (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: It was a very good performance from Ballyburn. He was too keen the whole way and to produce a run like that after running so keen for a mile-and-three-quarters showed that he has a lot left in the locker. It looked a fair race, in very tough ground. He's a horse that we're really looking forward to going over jumps. He looks a real chaser in the making, however he probably booked a ticket to Cheltenham with that run - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Top novice hurdler the season before last with three Grade 1 wins; 2-5 over fences last term, no match for Sir Gino at Kempton; won Grade 1 at the DRF quite readily despite having raced keenly; flopped in the Brown Advisory; more like it when second at Punchestown; came from an unpromising position to get within a whisker of Teahupoo in the Hatton's Grace; obvious chance.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to probably start him off in the Hatton's Grace at Fairyhouse with a view to training him with the Stayers' Hurdle as his ultimate aim. He just didn't take to fences as well as we would have hoped last season, so I think the right thing to do is go back over hurdles, where he would look like a real live candidate for the Stayers'. He's a hardy horse who gallops with his head down and it's going to be interesting to see what he can do back over hurdles. I'd imagine he will step back up to three miles at Leopardstown over Christmas. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Last season's Stayers' Hurdle hero, will do well to match his second in this last year
runners.name: Bob Olinger

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rachael [Blackmore] was brilliant on Bob Olinger as we said if you're going to get beaten, get beaten for coming too late and we were lucky. Home By The Lee was very unlucky and we got on the right side of that. We're delighted for the horse, he's just incredible. He had such a reputation a few years ago and things didn't work out as well as we thought, but to see him come back and do that is amazing - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Dornan Engineering Relkeel Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bob Olinger came to my place in February and was there until October. He lost his way over fences and lost his confidence and there's been a lot of work from vets and physios and we have him back now, hopefully. That's a very good performance. He'll have an entry in the Champion Hurdle, but taking on Constitution Hill would be unlikely so Aintree would be his big target - Robbie Power, representing the trainer.

quotes.race: Railway Bar Lismullen Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Bob Olinger was brilliant and got a brilliant ride from Rachael. He stayed at it really well and it was lovely to see. Hopefully he is starting to come back. We needed to see him back before we can think about future plans - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't think I'd ever see a horse that would make Bob Olinger look like that. Fair play to Galopin. That was some performance. I was surprised to see him off the bridle so soon. As I say, I never thought I'd see a horse do that to him - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Kildare Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: There was a lot of stomach churning there but I was delighted with Bob Olinger's jumping and really happy with how happy Rachael was with him as well. He seems to just have another gear again and he was good. He jumped fine at Gowran. You could argue he didn't take to it like a duck to water but we've done a lot of schooling - a lot more than we usually would with him - and he's really taken to it well. Rachael has done a fantastic job with him at home and the other day after we schooled we said: 'Yes, that's it." It was nice to see him step forward from Gowran - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Bob Olinger jumped brilliant and travelled great. It's as good a feeling I've ever got on the racetrack. If you want to be critical of him you could say he was a little bit novicey over some of his fences, but it's his first start in a chase and these fences take plenty of jumping. Overall, I thought he jumped very good and he'll come on plenty for today. He has the scope and won a point-to-point for Pat Doyle. We know he has the engine and today was about getting around and seeing how things go. It's unbelievable to get the chance to ride a horse like him - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bob Olinger is a horse we've always liked and he's done very little wrong. He's very exciting. I started the season aiming him at the Supreme but everyone persuaded me, quite rightly, to step up. I was very hopeful but it was a very good race and you never know on the day. He's built like a chaser and jumps like one so we'd normally love going that way but we'll see what everyone wants to do and work from there - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He quickened up well and he seems to tick a lot of boxes - Rachael Blackmore, rider of Bob Olinger.

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bob Olinger jumped well. Ideally Rachael would have preferred a lead or some company but job done. He's entered in the Grade 1 at Naas in a weeks so we'll see how he is - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: "Doc's Bumper" Point-To-Point INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Bob Olinger is an exciting horse. He's entitled to go for a winners bumper. I don't know where or when, today was Plan A. You have Aintree and Punchestown and we'll discuss it with the owners and see what they want to do. I was concerned about the ground being a bit too soft. He has worked well on good ground and up the sand at the Curragh so better ground shouldn't be a problem - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

runners.spotlight: Beaten by Home By The Lee on his first two starts last season; the margin was 6l in this race 12 months ago, when Rocky's Diamond took third place; enhanced his flawless Cheltenham record (4-4) when mastering Teahupoo in the Stayers' Hurdle; could go well, but no horse of his age has won this since Limestone Lad in 2002.

stable_tour.quote: Bob is great and it was amazing to see him come back and win the Stayers' Hurdle last season. He's just back now, having been with Robbie Power for a few weeks, and he's come back looking fantastic. He'll be aimed to start back in the Long Walk Hurdle at Ascot, the Christmas Hurdle at Leopardstown or the Relkeel Hurdle at Cheltenham. The Stayers' Hurdle is the goal again. 11-11-25

I remember going into Cheltenham 12 months ago feeling very hopeful about him in the Ballymore and he did not let us down. This season he has had just the two runs as the plan is to bring him on slowly. He won well at Gowran Park first time out and did what I expected in the Grade 3 Kildare Chase with another smooth success. Everything has been geared to next month and he has options of the Brown Advisory or Turners Novices' Chase. Nothing is set in stone but at the moment I am slightly leaning towards the latter. He is in very good form at home. 23-02-22

runners.comment: Has won this event on two occasions, much more depth to this race than 12 months ago
runners.name: Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Savills Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'd say that was close to a career-best from him. He's been around for a number of years now and will go back to Cheltenham for the Stayers' with an each-way chance - Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Railway Bar Lismullen Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Home By The Lee was a bit better off at the weights this year. He went through the race well and jumped well, Danny was impressed with him. He'll go to Leopardstown now and then to Cheltenham, his programme really plots itself - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: JJ [Slevin] gave Home By The Lee a lovely ride and he galloped on well to the line. I was very proud of his performance. We won't make any plans yet as to what we will do next, but I'm delighted with the performance - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Jack de Bromhead Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'd say Home By The Lee will probably go straight to Cheltenham now for the Stayers. He likes getting into a nice rhythm and wasn't beaten a million miles in it last year. He looks a better horse this year - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Railway Bar Lismullen Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Home By The Lee was a bit wild when he was younger, he went chasing and he didn't take to it. But he's a very decent horse on his day. Staying will be his job. He is lazy but this track suited him and I told JJ if he was on their tails turning in he wouldn't be far away - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power "From The Horse's Mouth" Podcast Novice Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Home By The Lee is a horse that can be very excitable, but JJ managed to get him switched off today and did a lovely job. He jumps and stays and who knows what he'll be in time - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power From The Horses Mouth Podcast EBF Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: He's a hardy horse. It was a big ask having had just one run over fences to step in to Grade 3 company He jumped fairly well but got under one or two. He stays very well and is a lovely horse going forward - JJ Slevin, rider of Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It was a good, tough performance and he's done quite well for his first day over fences. He's a young, hardy horse. I felt he'd went to sleep on me jumping the third last and thought we were in trouble, but once I got stuck into him he took off. He galloped out to the line well. He could be a nice stayer going forward - JJ Slevin, rider of Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Happy New Year From All At Fairyhouse Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's done nothing wrong all the way along and ran a lovely race last time at Naas, which he's come forward from. JJ [Slevin] said he jumped the third last very well and got to the front sooner than he wanted and was waiting a little bit then. At the back of the last he caught a hold of him and he galloped out to the line well. A confined novice could be an option for him, or some kind of Graded race, but we'll take baby steps with him. He's a staying horse for the future and has only just turned five - Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Home By The Lee

runners.spotlight: Won this race in 2022, last of five in the 2023 edition, won it for a second time 12 months ago, beating Bob Olinger and Rocky's Diamond; hampered by a faller and unseated rider mid-race in the Stayers' Hurdle; had an off-day in Grade 1 Aintree contest; never travelling particularly well when sixth behind Teahupoo at Punchestown festival; visor now instead of blinkers.

stable_tour.quote: It was the plan to skip the Lismullen this year. He's going to go straight to Leopardstown for the Savills Hurdle, which he won last year, and we're happy that he's on track for that. He's good fresh, so that's why we've decided to delay his reappearance. The long-term plan is the Stayers' Hurdle. 23-11-25

He knocked on the door a couple of times last season but this term he has really got his act together winning back-to-back races at Navan and Leopardstown. I had him in grand order for the Stayers' Hurdle last month, but he made a very bad mistake on the first circuit which put paid to his chances, and the fact he was still less than four lengths behind the winner is a testament to his battling qualities. He goes for the 3m hurdle on Saturday at Aintree and I'm very happy with how he is right now. 12-04-23

runners.comment: Talented novice the season before last, needs to start rebuilding career after reverses
runners.name: Mystical Power
runners.owner: John P Mcmanus & Mrs John Magnier & Mrs S Ricci

prev_owners.owner: Mrs S Ricci & John P Mcmanus & Mrs John Magnier
John P Mcmanus & Mrs John Magnier & Mrs S Ricci

quotes.race: BetMGM Fighting Fifth Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mystical Power was fine after the race, one hundred percent. He jumped the first very keen and very well and then we tried to settle him in behind Sir Gino and maybe he just didn't enjoy that. Maybe with his pedigree he wants to go much further, he's out of Annie Power by Galileo and maybe he just wants two and a half miles - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking on Racing TV the following day.

quotes.race: KPMG Champion Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Mystical Power has surprised me again. I thought he was done at the second-last and that it was between Jack [Kennedy] and Rachael [Blackmore]. He just squeezed through a gap and Mark kept him going. He said he was flat out approaching the last but he started to pick up again. He measured the last and stayed on. He's maturing all the time and has been improving all season, which is a really good sign. Hopefully he'll improve enough to be a Champion Hurdle horse next year. He outstayed all those horses and you need a stayer in the Champion Hurdle. He could start next season in the Fighting Fifth or the Hatton's Grace at Fairyhouse - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: TrustATrader Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's great for the mare [Annie Power] to have a Grade 1 winner. Mystical Power obviously keeps a lot of his ability for the racetrack, rather than the home gallops. We'll have more confidence in him now, and just get him fit and let him do his own thing. We'll have a think about Punchestown, but he doesn't owe us a thing this year. I was particularly taken with his hurdling today - he barely came off the ground; he just bent his legs like a real professional hurdler, and that's what he looks like. To look at him he doesn't scream chaser - he's not a big, old-fashioned type, but I am sure that he would make a nice novice chaser. Whether he can dine at the top table over two miles is another question. It's a nice problem - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rachael's horse was slow at the last and Mystical Power winged it, but she just outstayed me up the hill. He was very relaxed today and is learning the whole time. It's only his fourth run so I have to be delighted with him - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Galwaybayhotel.com & TheGalmont.com Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was a huge performance when compared to Mystical Power's bumper win. There's a lot of improvement left in his jumping, he made at least three mistakes, maybe four. Hopefully he can be half as good as his mother. We'll continue hurdling with him rather than going back to the Flat, I might do that next year with him. He looks like a horse for maybe the Royal Bond. Mark pulled him out early as he said he was too keen over the first two flights but I thought he had jumped very well over them. Then he said he was idling a bit past the winning post but once he gave him a squeeze and got him back up into the race he just locked on again. Enda Bolger did a lot of schooling with him before he came to us and said he was very good. I wouldn't say he showed us any more at home than he had before Ballinrobe but he's just improving with age and maturity. He sweated a lot last time but today he didn't turn a hair. He's coming together nicely - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Second in the 2024 Supreme Novices' before 2m Grade 1 wins at Aintree and Punchestown; started this season with questions to answer after last season's failures in the Fighting Fifth, a 2m Grade 1 at Leopardstown and an ambitious Stayers' Hurdle bid; beaten when hampered and unseated at the last in the Hatton's Grace.

stable_tour.quote: We headed off down the Champion Hurdle path at the start of last season by running him in the Fighting Fifth. That probably wasn't the shrewdest move and he'll be trained with the Stayers' Hurdle in mind this season. Paul [Townend] was very happy with him in his final run last season before he pulled him up. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Third in this last year when progressive, tough task now that he reverts from chasing
runners.name: Rockys Diamond

quotes.race: Watch Every Irish Race Live On Racing TV Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He's only in nine weeks which is not much. I was worried Rockys Diamond's jumping would be too exuberant as he's very brave. I am glad we've got that out of the way, we were toying with idea of going to Listowel but the fences are a bit bigger there and two are close to the finish so we thought we'd be safer coming here and find his feet. He will have leant a lot, that was the first time he'd jumped a fence on grass. We can chill out a bit now and make a plan for the rest of the season Declan Queally, trainer

quotes.race: John Mulhern Galmoy Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Rocky's Diamond is only five and has a great wind and demeanour. He's very cool and acts like an older horse. He's entered in the Stayers'. I don't know whether this is a good enough trial but we'll probably take our chance. It was trappy but Shane used his head and didn't let it turn into a s print." - Declan Queally, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Third behind Home By The Lee and Bob Olinger in this last season; won Grade 2 even at Gowran before a creditable fourth in the Stayers' Hurdle at Cheltenham; below-par at Punchestown; good start to chasing career, winning a Galway beginners' event and second at Wexford; back over hurdles after a below-par Punchestown run.

stable_tour.quote: The Stayers' is the plan and he's been good since the Galmoy. Dylan Phelan worked him this week and was very happy with him. He'll be good to go after another couple bits of work next week.  20-2-25

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet Et Al
runners.comment: Multiple Grade 1 winner, just held off Ballyburn in the Hatton's Grace, intriguing rematch
runners.name: Teahupoo

quotes.race: BAR 1 Betting Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo is not a two-and-a-half-miler, he's a three-mile horse. He's slow and he's not getting any younger. He's got a heart like a lion and we said we'd take our chance. We wouldn't have wanted another day of drying ground though. He was at the pin of his collar to go with him [leader and stablemate Casheldale Lad], even in that race. Probably [when asked whether the winner will go straight to Cheltenham], but that's not concrete. You mind a horse for a race all season and then get a stone bruise, anything can happen, so we'll see. We're not saying he's going to run again, but we're not ruling it out either. Leopardstown would have to come up very soft for him to run there at Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Stayers Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I was probably off the bridle before a couple of other lads but Teahupoo is just a great stayer and it's brilliant to win on him. He's probably unlucky to be beaten twice this season, running into the horses he did but he's really stamping his authority as a top stayer  - Sam Ewing, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: No excuse, really. Maybe if the ground was a shade slower it would have taken the sting out of the other lad a little bit, but no excuse. I was probably left [in front] a little bit early, but Teahupoo is a genuine horse who would gallop away in front there. I sort of knew Rachael was going fairly well - well, I knew there was something beside be, I didn't know exactly what it was. Bob Olinger is a horse with loads of ability and he's just put it all together today - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Stayers Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Jack [Kennedy, jockey] said he was very happy with Teahupoo the whole way. Paul [Townend, on Asterion Forlonge] had him in a pocket for the first half of the race and he just said he had to get out of it. He's a great horse, we're very lucky to have him. I'd imagine we'd keep him to hurdles as he looks pretty strong in that division at the moment - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was always the plan with Teahupoo. He runs well fresh and so we came straight here. I was a bit anxious at the top of the hill when he missed the second-last, and then he probably got there a bit soon as he [Kennedy] had to give him a squeeze, but I had loads of confidence in Jack as he's a world-class jockey and you don't need to tell him what to do - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: We are going to do things a bit different this year and the plan is to go straight for the Stayers' Hurdle now - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Teahupoo

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Stayers Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo had the ground as quick as he wanted it and Darragh O'Keeffe said he was just flat out the whole way - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: John Mulhern Galmoy Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was good and he is going the right way. The trip is the key to him and it seems to suit him well. Hopefully drying ground won't be a problem to him and he will go straight to Cheltenham - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was very good last year on soft ground and we ran him on good ground a couple of times which was probably a mistake but we are still learning about the horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was just flat out on the ground the whole way - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo hated the ground but he was able to pick up on the better ground in the straight, Robbie said that he sprinted in the straight. I thought it was a good performance. We said we would come here today and see where we were and we will definitely go for the Champion Hurdle now. He's a very deceiving horse, he doesn't do much at home and is very laid back, but I would say he is not a bad horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Fishery Lane Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was very good. I felt I had Autumn Evening covered when he fell and he did it well. He's a lovely horse. I reluctantly had to go forward early on, but he wasn't really going that hard in front. When Rachael went on I was much happier and he picked them up well and stayed galloping. He jumped brilliant. I hadn't ridden him in a race before but I think he's a horse that has improved - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Norman Colfer Winning Fair Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo put up a good performance and he's improving all the time. He's in everything at Cheltenham but I wouldn't be surprised if we came back here at Easter for the Grade 2 instead - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: ITM Virtual Stallion Trail Hurdle
quotes.quote: Teahuptoo is a nice horse. We had a lot of luck on our side today. He's more of a stayer than a 2-miler in time and I loved the way he ran from the last to the line - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a brilliant 2023-24 campaign in which he won Stayers' Hurdle and the Punchestown equivalent; second to Lossiemouth in last year's Hatton's Grace; beaten by Bob Olinger at Cheltenham before signing off with Punchestown win; had just enough in reserve to hold off a strong challenge from Ballyburn in the Hatton's Grace; major player.

stable_tour.quote: If we get enough rain we'll go back to the Hatton's Grace for another go but, if we don't, I'd have no problem at all waiting for the Long Walk at Ascot. We feel he's better with gaps between his races but he was so good at Punchestown for the last two seasons after Cheltenham, so we'll keep him a bit busier this season. He's been a great stayer and there's no reason to think he won't be just as good again. The Stayers' Hurdle is the aim again. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Smart novice last season, needs to raise his game after odds-on defeat at Navan on return
runners.name: The Yellow Clay

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Yellow Clay ran a brilliant race and Jack [Kennedy] has given him a peach of a ride and I couldn't be happier with him. He is a good horse. I thought we got a beautiful run throughout the race and I don't think there were any excuses anywhere. There was no hard luck story. They went a good gallop out there and I would say that race will end up being a proper race. We will get him home and see how he is, but he could easily go to either Aintree or Punchestown - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought the way The Yellow Clay travelled from midway through the race until the second-last was the best he's ever travelled. It was a good performance because I was very worried about the ground. He'll be entered in the two novice hurdles at the Dublin Racing Festival but he's had four runs now and we might just hold fire for Cheltenham. I imagine he'd go for the middle-distance option [the Turners] - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Navan Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: The Yellow Clay got his head in front at the right time which is always a good sign. The second got a good ride and nearly caught us. He'll go the Lawlors at Naas next month - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets & Flooring Monksfield Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The Yellow Clay will even have learned from that. What I loved was the way he was quickly back on the bridle when he made a mistake at the second-last. He's a nice horse with a big future. That was a good performance. I would imagine we will go for the Grade 1 Lawlor's of Naas Novice Hurdle in January. He has a great attitude and a great way of racing - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Yellow Clay put up a good performance. He's a nice horse and he could come back in trip. Sam said he was never out of a hack. He could go to Navan later in the month - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Bookmaker Champion (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I'll speak with Gordon but The Yellow Clay has probably done enough for this season and we'll treat him like a good horse for next season - Jamie Codd, rider.

quotes.race: Ballinteer (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: The Yellow Clay is a nice horse and we think of a good bit of him. He'll probably go to Limerick next for a Listed bumper - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.spotlight: High-class novice last season, completing a four-timer including 2m4f Grade 1 at Naas; also a clear second in 2m5f Turners Novices' at Cheltenham; season ended disappointingly when taking a heavy fall at the last at Punchestown festival, well held in third at the time; needs to raise his game after odds-on defeat in the 2m4f Lismullen Hurdle at Navan on return.

stable_tour.quote: There was a decision to be made about whether to send him straight over fences or keep him over hurdles and we've decided to do the latter. There are plenty of races for him over hurdles. He could go to Down Royal for the Listed hurdle over 2m next Friday or else there's the Lismullen Hurdle at the Navan racing festival next month. I want to step him up to 3m and that'll happen at the Leopardstown Christmas meeting, all being well. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Ran well in three Grade 1 attempts last season, hard to see her winning at this level
runners.name: Jetara

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Yorkshire Rose Mares' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jetara was second to Ballyburn at Punchestown and she had rock-solid form last season. We thought we were going to go to all heights this season, she won a Listed race and she won on the Flat but then she was disappointing at Navan - she was in season after that - and the ground was a bit quick for her at Leopardstown. The step up to three miles and the cheekpieces really helped. Onwards to Cheltenham, she's in the mares' hurdle and the three-miler - Kate Harrington, trainer's daughter.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cailin Alainn Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Jetara switched off then stuck out her head and did what she had to do, and jumped fluently throughout. It's grand to see her settling like that and hopefully she'll come on for it - Donagh Meyler, rider.

quotes.race: BeattheBank.ie Irish EBF Mares Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jetara jumped and settled, and Jack said he couldn't believe how much she picked up. He thought he had got there plenty soon enough and, when he asked her, she picked up well. We're delighted with her. She'll be better on better ground as the whole family want better ground. She's the only one of them who is happy on that soft ground. She'll probably come back here for the two-mile-six novice hurdle at the Dublin Racing Festival. We might as well go as she's still a novice. She jumps very slick and they will have to give her 7lb - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Jetara was good. She had the experience from last year and umnlile most of the family she goes on that heavy ground. She is hardy now and a lot stronger - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer - Join For Just 12 Euros PM For An Entire Year Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jetara relaxed well today. At Down Royal she was like a lunatic. I schooled her over hurdles at the Curragh the other day and it just took the edge off her. She will go the mares route over 2m4f - Jessica Harrington, trainer

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires In Swoop Irish EBF Mares INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It's some family and you can't beat breeding. Jetara is tough and we kind of got it wrong in Gowran where she stayed on really well and we didn't make enough use of her. I was worried about the ground as most of the family like good ground but she's by Walk In The Park and she seems to cope very well with it - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart staying mare; won a 3m Grade 2 Doncaster mares' event in January and ran with credit in three Grade 1 attempts, best of them when third to Teahupoo at Punchestown; back from a spell on the Flat when third behind Colonel Mustard and today's rival The Yellow Clay in the 2m4f Lismullen Hurdle at Navan.

runners.comment: Deserved his win at Thurles last month, up against it now in a race of significant depth
runners.name: Affordale Fury

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Day Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Affordale Fury had been a little unlucky and at Fairyhouse last February he made a bad mistake at the last. Today is only his sixth run over fences and I'll play it by ear now, but his next run could be in the Savills Chase at Leopardstown over Christmas - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Affordale Fury was very good schooling. He would like better ground. He got as little bit tired but not as tired as the others. I would love to be at Leopardstown at Christmas, we might go to the Florida Pearl at Punchestown before then - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Glenlo Abbey Hotel & Estate Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Affordale Fury did everything wrong but still won. The loose horse impacted him as he was running away the whole way. He has an engine and isn't slow. It might come too soon but the Monksfield Novice Hurdle at Navan (on November 27) is an option - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Student Raceday On Monday 31st October INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: I think the softer the ground the better Affordale Fury will be. If I get my way he'll go over hurdles straight away. He's a really nice horse. He stays and jumps well - Noel Meade, trainer

runners.spotlight: In good form this season; runner-up in a Gowran Grade 2 before chasing home Envoi Allen in Down Royal Grade 1; took advantage of a drop in class when scoring at Thurles a month ago; up against it now in a race of significant depth.

runners.comment: Won a 3m1f Grade 1 novice chase, did well over an inadequate trip at Naas on return
runners.name: Champ Kiely

quotes.race: Dooley Insurance Group Champion Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: From halfway down the back I knew I was going to play a big part in the race, from there it was a case of keeping a good jumping rhythm. Champ Kiely put his head down between the last two and a good jump at the last sealed it. It was his first run at that trip and that's probably where you're going to see the best of him - Danny Mulllins, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I was always going to keep it as simple as I could. Champ Kiely loves jumping fences. To be honest, I thought we built up nicely from leaving the back straight and every time he heard the other horse coming he pulled out loads. I was always in control - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Bellshill Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely did everything as it should have been done; he galloped and jumped. Paul [Townend, jockey] was very happy that he was far more relaxed over fences than he had been over hurdles, which will hopefully bring about more improvement. The two miles and five furlongs Grade 1 at the Dublin Racing Festival is a race we will probably look at. He could easily step up in trip now he's much more relaxed - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: The Royal Bond was a bit of a messy race but Champ Kiely was only beaten four-and-a-bit lengths so I believed he had something like that in him - Danny Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Fitzgerald's Woodlands House Hotel Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely was very good, he showed stamina at Galway and he backed that up with speed today. He ticks a lot of boxes and he quickened here off a strong pace. Not many can do that - Danny Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Galway Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was hoping Champ Kiely would win but didn't think he'd do anything like that. He's moved up a few places in our novice hurdlers for this season. That looked very good. He looks a real jumping sort. I know he is only starting his novice hurdle career, but I'm already looking forward to him going over fences. I think there was a lot of confidence behind the favourite, so to come out and beat a 102-rated Flat horse like that was very good. I'll have a chat with Michael [Masterson, owner] and go through all the rest of the horses for the year before making a plan, but he looks a smart type - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Athea INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely is a big boy for a small girl. He was in my hands the whole way but when I went for him it took him a while to quicken up and he's still a bit green. He was doing all the right things at home and please God he is another nice one - Jody Townend, rider.

runners.spotlight: Off for 21 months before winning chase debut in January; struggled in DRF Grade 1 won by Ballyburn; readily landed the odds in a 2m Grade 3 event at Navan; jumped to the left when third in 2m4f Grade 1 at Fairyhouse; career-best when beating Ballyburn in 3m1f Grade 1 at Punchestown; did well over an inadequate trio at Naas on return.

stable_tour.quote: You would have to be delighted with the way he ran at Naas over a trip that would have been tight for him and giving plenty of weight to the winner. He's not going to be the easiest to place this season, but he's in the John Durkan and might go there. I'm sure we'll find something for him around Christmas as well. He won a Grade 1 race over three miles, so he's quite versatile with regard to trip. 17-11-25

He's not done a lot wrong since joining us, with four wins from five. The defeat was when fourth to Marine Nationale in the Royal Bond at Fairyhouse and that was a good run, only weakening after the last. He won his Grade 1 last time out when beating Irish Point to take the Lawlor's of Naas in early January. He's improving with every run and at the moment I think he'll be best suited by the Ballymore. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Has been unable to sustain the early momentum of his chasing career, huge task here
runners.name: Croke Park

quotes.race: Racing Post Long Distance Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: To be completely honest, Croke Park disappointed me so much as a hurdler last year. I expected more from him. We had big expectations for him early on, but he was probably just so big and weak and needed time. He's come back in and gone chasing and has now won two Grade 1s already this season, so I'm delighted for Michael and Eddie [O'Leary]. Maybe he didn't jump as well as he did the last day. Sam [Ewing] said he slipped going into the first, but he won and that's the main thing. He's been busy enough and probably doesn't need to run again before Cheltenham. I don't think he wants real winter-heavy ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Croke Park won an average enough beginners chase here the last day. I didn't know if the form was strong enough for him to run here but he has run a great race. I imagine he will go to Leopardstown now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Croke Park has a lot of improvement in him. It wouldn't be a shock if he was to come back here for the Drinmore - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets & Flooring Monksfield Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Croke Park is a lovely horse. He didn't do much when he got there and he will probably enjoy stepping up to 3m - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Crottys Lake Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Croke Park jumped great. He loved that ground and you'll probably see the best of him when he goes out in trip and over fences in time. He's a massive horse and Kilbeggan wouldn't have suited him well so he didn't run a bad race that day. He was always going to be a winter type on big, galloping tracks. He jumped the two hurdles in the straight to his left the first time around but straightened out afterwards. The stable yard is down around there so he was probably looking at that - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; started last season with three wins, including Grade 1 novice chases at Fairyhouse and this venue; beaten 5l by Ballyburn at the DRF here in February before failing to fire at Aintree; below best on seasonal return at Punchestown and ineffective over a trip short of his optimum at Down Royal.

stable_tour.quote: We thought he might get tired at Punchestown and that's what he did. He'll improve enormously from that and over the next few days we have to decide whether to have a crack at the Grade 1 at Down Royal on Saturday or the Grade 2 for second-season novices instead. His next run will tell us whether he's one for the top staying chases or the big handicaps. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Has shown his best form in dealing with Galopin Des Champs at Punchestown, 0-4 this venue
runners.name: Fastorslow

quotes.race: John Durkan Memorial Punchestown Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Fastorslow travelled well to the third-last when he got upsides the leader, but he just couldn't accelerate on that dead ground. It's the first time we've run him on ground like that but he kept going to the line and we're happy with him. He gave his knee a bit of a bang there, there's a tiny bit of soft tissue swelling but he seems fine and hopefuly he'll be okay - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Punchestown Gold Cup (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Fastorslow turned up in just as good a shape as last year and possibly even better. JJ [Slevin, jockey] said he was running away with him for the first mile - Martin Brassil, trainer

quotes.race: John Durkan Memorial Punchestown Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: We would have been delighted if Fastorslow was in the first three. It was a tactical, steadily run race and he (JJ Slevin) never gave him too much to do and it worked out well - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Punchestown Gold Cup (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Fastorslow was going to be carrying top weight in a lot of those handicaps so we just felt we might as well dip our toe in the water and see how much we find. There were only five runners and the first two in the betting had hard races in the Gold Cup. If there was a bit of a chink in the armour I thought we could hopefully exploit that. I didn't think we'd win but I thought we wouldn't be far away - Martin Brassil, trainer

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're thrilled with the run, Fastorslow was really thrown in the deep end on his first run in a handicap and he really equipped himself well and jumped great. We found out quite a bit about him today, he got the trip well and jumped super. We may have bumped into the Grand National winner there  - Martin Brassil, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winner of the Punchestown Gold Cup twice, beating Galopin Des Champs both times; also had the dual Cheltenham Gold Cup winner among his victims when winning the John Durkan two seasons ago; best of the remainder behind the dominant pair, Gaelic Warrior and Fact To File, on seasonal debut in this year's John Durkan; 0-4 at this venue.

runners.breeder: G A E C Des Champs
runners.comment: Boasts outstanding course record (7-8), bids to win this for a third time, no prep run
runners.name: Galopin Des Champs

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Punchestown Gold Cup (Chase) (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: We all have the horse of a lifetime. Galopin Des Champs is phenomenal. Paul [Townend] showed him off today. He was asking him for every jump and the horse responded every time, he was loving it. To win a race like that, beating that opposition by 22 lengths, I thought was spectacular. I thought some of his performances in Leopardstown were spectacular and in Cheltenham, but that was a hell of a performance to do what he did there. I was worried about the ground but they had put a lot of water on it. They always make a tremendous effort here in Punchestown, that's why we always keep our best horses for Punchestown - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I just thought Galopin Des Champs was never happy until they got to the fourth last. During the race he was too far out of his ground and he wasn't jumping well enough to be in the race. He was uncomfortable. Maybe drying ground might not have helped. I thought we missed all that [when Ahoy Senor] fell and I thought that might wake him up as he was just idle. When he jumped off he was only in seventh. He was jumping too big and he wasn't jumping well enough. I was hoping something would get beside him and make him jump. To me he wasn't racing. The only time he got competitive was when they came around the fourth last at the top of the hill, and it looked alright. I just think he used too much of his powder jumping too big, but a good horse won it - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Galopin Des Champs  just jumped and galloped for three miles and it didn't look like he was stopping coming up to the winning post. He's just a real champion, the best chaser I've trained - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That was some performance. He put in some fantastic jumps. To win the way he did after giving the other horse a lead the whole way was one of the best performances I've ever seen around here - Willie Mullins, trainer of Galopin Des Champs

quotes.race: John Durkan Memorial Punchestown Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought Galopin Des Champs ran some race. He cut out the running and did the donkey work over a trip too sharp for him - the depth of that race was huge. I imagine he will go to Leopardstown at Christmas  - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Since we got beaten in Punchestown in the John Durkan, we've been all forward with Galopin Des Champs. Paul was keen he just rode him like a racehorse and I could see the other way wasn't working last year.
