He was just too free and less mature; now he's way more mature and settled in his races, and much easier to ride, I think. Paul has full confidence in him. He gallops, he jumps, he stays; what more do you need? - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul was very happy with Galopin Des Champs. He set his own pace which is hard to do on soft ground. Paul made sure that he was going to go fast enough and try and suck the energy out of the ones behind, which he did - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a huge performance. Galopin Des Champs put what appeared to be a very good field of horses to bed in the matter of a few strides after doing it the hard way up the front the whole way. Paul (Townend, jockey) wanted to change tactics, jump him out in front and give him plenty of daylight. When I saw his jump the first, I was very happy that Paul had probably made the right decision. We'll probably just let him enjoy himself from now on. There's every chance you could see him in the Irish Gold Cup next and it could make for a fantastic race. It will be a tough race with Fastorslow in there - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Galopin Des Champs has that little bit of class you could run him over two miles, two and a half miles. He has that little bit of speed when you want it. You just have to conserve it. Over those shorter trips he likes to get on with the job and that was to me the whole key today, not to let him get running early on in the race. He would have got too free otherwise and it would have played into the others' hands. There are certain ways you can train them to do that (get them to settle) and eventually they listen. He was not a runaway, he was just keen - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Gold Cup (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I was amazed that the press were doubting the fact that Gallopin Des Champs had never won over three miles over fences. He had won over three miles as a novice over hurdles which is way harder than doing it over fences. To me he can go four miles. What I love about him now is that he's settling, he's not keen and Paul is able to put him wherever he wants him in a race. That's crucial for tactics going forward - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: John Durkan Memorial Punchestown Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I was really happy going past the winning post to see a loop in Paul's reins. That's a big improvement. When Paul wanted Galopin Des Champs to put in a few quick ones in front of the fences he did that, and when Paul really went for it at the third-last he was so slick over that fence. I thought 'wow', this horse has grown up so much and learned so much. Just to change his hands and come away from Fakir D'Oudairies by 13 lengths, a proven two-and-a-half-mile Grade 1 winner, to me that's a big result - Willie Mullins, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Gold Cup Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I reckon Galopin Des Champs is a Gold Cup horse. I have to discuss that with Greg and Audrey (Turley, owners) but he looks a horse for the Gold Cup. He had a hard race at Cheltenham. Any horse that goes at that pace would have a hard race. All his homework suggested he was fine and Paul was happy with him. I was going to wait and go over three miles at Punchestown but then I thought about a Grade 1 race over two and a half miles here and we took our chance today. Paul rode him differently down to the first than he did at Cheltenham and that made a big change. To me it looked an ordinary pace and it looked like the other two elected to challenge him over the last three fences. Once he changed gear between the last two it was over bar jumping the last. He just seemed to be on a wrong stride and Paul let the horse decide. He put down lovely and got over it. He quickened away after the last and he couldn't pull him up going around the bend - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's just one of those things. Galopin Des Champs was doing everything right the whole race. He landed properly and he just slipped after landing - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I wasn't as happy watching Galopin Des Champs jumping at Grade 1 pace as I was at Christmas. My heart was in my mouth going down the back. I thought a few times he was meeting fences on the wrong side and he just stood back at them. By all accounts, it was a much faster pace and Paul didn't want to keep going on with him like he did at Christmas because he felt with softer ground and everything, he had to learn a little bit today, and Paul thought he achieved that - Willie Mullins, trainer.  It was a proper race and we went a proper gallop, and Galopin Des Champs still hit the line well. We know he stays but when he puts up a performance like that over that trip, deciding where to go next is a nice problem to have. He is right up there with any of the novices I've ridden. He is a real natural, so we'll see where he ends up - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Ballymaloe Relish Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Galopin Des Champs was very impressive. I thought he was good but I didn't think he was that good, that was just something else. He was so effortless over all his fences. Paul said he was fantastic early on and at a few that he met short he just danced in front of his fences and took them at his stride. He did everything right and galloped away through the line and beyond it. He looks a very, very exciting horse for the future, especially going over a trip. He's five going six so he's very young. All options are open for him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Martin Pipe Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sean was very cool on Galopin Des Champs. He did everything right. He slotted in and bided his time. When things opened up he still waited and waited and that's a real sign of a good pilot in the making - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Deprived of a third Cheltenham Gold Cup triumph by Inothewayurthinkin following a thoroughly satisfactory preparation in the shape of two C&D wins, following the same pattern as the previous season; back on song when making all to trounce three rivals at Punchestown; boasts an outstanding course record (7-8) and is bidding to win this for a third time

stable_tour.quote: We had a little hold-up with him a few weeks ago, so the John Durkan might come too soon. We'll see how he is over the next little while and then make a call. I don't want to push him to make it and it's no big deal if he doesn't get there. Having one run less in a season is not the end of the world anyway. He could kick off his campaign in the Savills at Leopardstown, or the race at Tramore on New Year's Day would be another option. It did Al Boum Photo no harm. The hold-up was nothing major at all and he's back in good shape, but it just put us on the back foot for a few days. He's about to turn ten, but he seems as good as ever and the way he won the Punchestown Gold Cup was amazing. He's been the most incredible horse and hopefully there are plenty more big days in him. We must enjoy him while he's here because horses like him don't come around too often. 17-11-25

He has had mixed experiences of  Cheltenham as he won the Martin Pipe Hurdle in 2021 but 12 months ago he had the Turners in the bag when falling at the last. Since then he hasn't put a foot wrong with three straight Grade 1 wins. First time out this season he won the John Durkan over 2m4f and under a more restrained ride he won the Irish Gold Cup from Stattler. It was his first try over 3m as a chaser but I was never concerned about him staying and he did everything right. I was very happy with what he did and Paul was also very happy. He felt he had plenty of horse under him passing the line and that's important because there's another two furlongs at Cheltenham. It's all about temperament that a horse learns to settle during a race and he's done just that in his last two runs. Paul feels he can now use him in a race when he wants to. He's the one they all have to beat. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Looked a fine prospect two seasons ago though no match for Galopin Des Champs in this race
runners.name: Gerri Colombe

quotes.race: William Hill Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jack (Kennedy, jockey) said he was never happy with Gerri Colombe the whole way, he said he was slack the whole way, but, look, it shows the goods the horse has. He said he probably ended up in front too soon, but he's a great horse. He only does what he has to do. We're lucky to have him. I actually think he'd be a bit better on better ground, but it will be all systems go for the Gold Cup next year. We'll probably go the same route again and keep dreaming - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe ran a great race and we got a lot closer to the winner this time. The loose horse didn't help us but it didn't make the difference between winning and losing. The winner was very, very good - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: We've no excuses, everything went even more smoothly for Gerri Colombe than it did at Down Royal. He jumped and travelled great, but the winner just picked up and went away. The winner was unreal. The gallop was strong the whole way and I was happy. The winner just picked up and went away from me - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: We were delighted with Gerri Colombe as we knew there would be improvement in him today, his first run in open company. He only came back in on September 19, so there's loads of improvement. We'll have one run now and then the Gold Cup. He showed that he is in the mix now for the Gold Cup, he stays very well and that's what you need. Jack [Kennedy] said he was a bit rusty early, but I thought he was pretty much foot-perfect, apart from one, for a novice stepping into open company. The sky is the limit - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Air Charter Service Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were happy the whole way. Gerri Colombe is a good horse. We were disappointed we got beaten at Cheltenham, I think we were the best horse in the race. That proved it today. He's a horse to look forward to for next year. We'll look to the future now, Cheltenham is over. You have to dream in this game and he looks to have a whole lot of potential - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe has been beaten a short-head in a Grade 1 and a stride over the line he is a neck in front, so of course I retain faith in him - he's top class. However, whether he has another run this season is something that will have to be discussed with the owners as he has definitely had a race there - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Scilly Isles Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: If Gordon Ellliott decides he doesn't want to go to Cheltenham (this season) I'd have no issue with that. Next season Gerri Colombe could be a Gold Cup horse. I'm sure there will be ante-post punters going bananas because I've told you he might not go to the festival but we're looking at next year and the Gold Cup for this horse if we can keep him sound. The only thing that has been ruled out today is the National Hunt Chase, because we can't qualify - Brian Acheson, owner.

quotes.race: Guinness Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe just keeps winning. He doesn't do anything fancy at home and when he got to the front he pulled himself up again. We're lucky to have him. We'll have a look to see where he might run next - I don't know yet. The National Hunt Chase, or something like that, might suit if the ground was soft. He's a lovely horse who wouldn't like the ground very quick. He was a big baby last season and is coming to himself now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Irish National Hunt Steeplechase Committee Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe was good I thought. He was having a good blow afterwards and Jack thinks he'll come on for the run. He might go to Limerick at Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor W.T. O'Grady Memorial Irish EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe won in spite of the track, we ran him here because of the lack of races. He needs more ease in the ground and I imagine he'll go straight to the Albert Bartlett - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe is still very green for a horse who has done so much. He still has a lot to learn. He jumped well and he's a beautiful horse to look forward to. There's a nice bit of class there and he stays well. He's a nice horse - Denis O'Regan, rider.

quotes.race: Paddy Power (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Gerri Colombe is going to be a lovely horse next year for his owners and we're just delighted with that. Next year is the year for him when he goes jumping and anything he does this year is a bonus. He's won two bumpers now and is exciting - Jamie Codd, rider.

quotes.race: Racing Again January 30th (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: I don't think you'll see a whole lot more of Gerri Colombe this season, he might have one more run. He's probably going to be a big chaser more than anything, a big staying horse down the road - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won Down Royal Grade 1 two seasons ago before being trounced by Galopin Des Champs in the 2023 edition of this race; back to form when 3 1/2l runner-up in 2024 Cheltenham Gold Cup; showed no ill-effects from a hard race when beating Ahoy Senor at Aintree; did not appear again last season after Down Royal defeat; faces a tough task against that background.

stable_tour.quote: He's back cantering away but you won't see him this side of Christmas. It's all going to be baby steps with him and we definitely won't be rushing him. He has no Grade 1 penalty anymore, so that opens up a few easier options for him. Something like the race at Tramore on New Year's Day could be an option. We'll decide closer to the time. Whether he's still a Gold Cup horse or we need to be looking at the Grand National for him, only time will tell. He's been an incredible horse over the years and owes us nothing. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Smart staying form last season, should be closer to peak fitness now after John Durkan run
runners.name: Grangeclare West

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was some spin. Grangeclare West jumped for fun and ran the race of his life. He did something a bit similar in the Gold Cup in Ireland, but repeated that here today with eleven stone eight on his back. Going out on the second circuit I knew he was going to run a big race. I gave him a breather and then he started winging fences down the back. I thought he was going to do the business but he just got into the bottom of the last and that cost him momentum - cost him second place - Brian Hayes, rider.

quotes.race: Neville Hotels Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I didn't expect that - I was hoping Grangeclare West would run well but that was a top race. Paul was very worried about him pulling too hard and he had some job there. He'd want to be as fit as he is as he just pulled his arms out for the three miles. To do that in that ground and win like that going away, it was a huge performance. His jumping was excellent. He just came out of Paul's hands at the first fence and from then on he was just trying to settle him back. You can't keep jumping like that over three miles. He got him back jumping normally and then when he needed him over the last few fences, especially at the third-last, he was there. He's just a natural chaser. We were looking at it and asking ourselves is he a Brown Advisory horse? But we nominated Fact To File for that. The winner could go for the Brown Advisory and Fact To File might go to the Turners, but we'll see, it's a nice problem to have. We might come back here for the Dublin Racing Festival first - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Grangeclare West has always promised and I would say chasing might just help him to fulfil his promise now, hopefully we can get a good run with him now. The two fences in the straight being taken out was no help to him. I was using his jumping to fill him up, so if I was going to get beat it was the long run-in which was going to do it but his class got him through - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I have to say Grangeclare West impressed me, considering he was so keen early on and jumped a bit big during the race. Then he settled and Paul got him together and balanced. Once he got down to gallop he impressed me. The obvious race for him would be the Lawlors of Naas Novice Hurdle (January 8). He surprised me in the manner he did it there. As I said to the owner before racing, we could run well here and finish fourth or fifth. It looked a good race - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Second in the Irish Gold Cup over C&D in February and an excellent third behind Nick Rockett in the Grand National, rallying well after a bad mistake at the final fence; signed off with a creditable fifth when shouldering 12 stone in the bet365Gold Cup; never threatened in the John Durkan, should be closer to peak fitness now.

stable_tour.quote: We were kind of looking at the Grand National for him, but I spoke to the owners during the week and I said we're going to Cheltenham. Now the dust has settled I think we'll wait and see what weight he gets before deciding where to go next. 5-2-25

runners.comment: Has excelled at Aintree, tailed off in the John Durkan on reappearance, may struggle again
runners.name: I Am Maximus

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I Am Maximus ran a huge race. He probably took me through the race a bit better last year but he's run with credit again and it's a big result for the team. A bit sickening to get beat though - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I could see all the time that Paul was happy with where he was, just looking for room, looking for daylight, and he eventually got it and set I Am Maximus alight. He made little of his mark, and that means he's going to be a Gold Cup horse. We don't know how good this horse is. Today he showed us that he's better than he has been, anyway. I think he was still just a little bit ahead of the handicapper after what he did in the Bobbyjo Chase and he proved it today. He's quirky, he's immature, but he's learning all the time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote.ie Bobbyjo Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I don't know how good I Am Maximus is, but he's certainly improving with every run. I'd imagine he goes for the Grand National, he would look like a Gold Cup horse in time but I'd imagine Aintree is his objective - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That was a nice bonus on his last day as a novice. I Am Maximus won his maiden in nice circumstances and then to do that on his last day as a novice was good too! He is a total character but he looks a class horse now and not just a handicapper so we might have some different plans for him. We were hoping he might have a chance but it was more in hope, and the fact it was his last run as a novice made us give him his chance. He's clearly improved and showed he has that bit of class when he needs it. We were thinking of the Grand National but maybe we'll stick to Grade 1 races with him, we'll see - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: I must complement Paul for the ride he gave I Am Maximus because if he were listening to me I'd have said pull him up after going a mile. He dug in and stayed very well. It's really special - JP McManus, owner.

quotes.race: Prodec Networks Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I Am Maximus will be a lovely horse and I wouldn't be surprised if we went two and a half miles at some stage. He's quickened up again at the end, but is a strong galloper who learned a lot at Exeter last time - he'd had just one run in his life before then. He was a different horse today and his jumping was deadly. He looks like he's got a very powerful gallop in him. He'll be a fantastic chaser next season and he's a Graded horse; there's no doubt about that - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal Gloucestershire Hussars Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I Am Maximus is lovely and will be very good, but we'll have to discuss plans re another bumper or hurdling - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won the 2023 Irish National and a brilliant winner of the 2024 Grand National; contested two Grade 1 events at this venue before being produced in superb shape (despite having missed his final prep race) at Aintree in April; terrific display under 11-12 to split his stablemates Nick Rockett and Grangeclare West; tailed off in the John Durkan on reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: You don't need me to tell you where we will be aiming him - all roads will lead back to Aintree for the Grand National. He has run two fabulous races in it and we'll stick to the same sort of plan as last season. 17-11-25

He came to us in the autumn and, although he has yet to get his head in front, he has run well in top company, notably last time behind Mighty Potter. There are several options in the Ultima, Brown Advisory, Turners and Plate. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Cheltenham Gold Cup winner, likely to be much sharper than at Punchestown five weeks ago
runners.name: Inothewayurthinkin

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't think we were travelling particularly well as just on that ground Inothewayurthinkin looked to be flat out. He jumped well on the whole, although he made one mistake at the ditch down the back. I knew they went good and hard and that was going to play to our strengths as he stays really well. What can I say? He turned in and jumped the last and galloped out to the line. It was fantastic. He is just an improving horse. He improved through the season last season. He has improved all season this season. He started off over two and a half miles, but the further he has gone the better he has been. I don't know (is the answer to the Grand National). We will get him home from this and I will have a chat with Frank (Berry) and JP (McManus) and we will see. Potentially it wouldn't be out of the question - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Huyton Asphalt Franny Blennerhassett Memorial Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His jumping definitely left a bit to be desired, but Inothewayurthinkin clearly has a big engine. He looked to do plenty wrong but still won, which is always nice to see. Clearly he stays well. I'm delighted with the result, anyway. That's it for the season with him. He's up into big boy company next year and we'll see how that goes. He's going to have to brush up on his jumping, but he could do - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Fulke Walwyn Kim Muir Challenge Cup Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Sponsored By JRL Group) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I thought going past here [mid-race] that it was going to take an awful lot of luck.Inothewayurthinkin was so far back. He was jumping very big and slow and wasn't helping Derek. But he is a cool customer, Derek. I don't think it was too hard to take him back, to be fair - he's a lazy enough type of horse, he got shuffled back very quick, but Derek didn't panic. [His jumping was] big and slow, he wasn't very economical. He has quality and scope, but I would just like to see him jump a little bit slicker - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: PRL Group Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Inothewayurthinkin improved from Cork and he did his job a bit better today - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Inothewayurthinkin did that well. He was a bit green but he's a lovely horse. He handled the ground well. I had the momentum at the second last and he kept galloping - Mark Walsh, rider

runners.spotlight: Last season's Cheltenham Gold Cup winner; failed to test Galopin Des Champs in two C&D clashes before justifying his supplementary entry by denying the Mullins-trained star a Gold Cup hat-trick; powerful stayer is likely to be much sharper than at Punchestown five weeks ago.

stable_tour.quote: What he achieved last season was incredible. He learned a lot through the season and it was great to see him put it together in the Gold Cup. Keith [Donoghue] did a huge job with his jumping and helping him to build his confidence. He seems in good shape now and although there's nothing set in stone yet, he has an entry in the John Durkan and that is the plan at the moment. He started off there last season before running twice at Leopardstown before Cheltenham and could go that route again but, as I said, nothing is set in stone. 04-11-25

He was very good when winning the Kim Muir last season and and improved again to win in Grade 1 company at Aintree. He's a lovely horse who stays well but it's going to be a big ask for him to step into senior company now. He'll have to improve in the jumping department and get a bit slicker. We're happy with him and potentially he could go to the John Durkan. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Won all three completed starts as a novice, John Durkan trip was too short for him
runners.name: Lecky Watson

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: All season Lecky Watson has improved. We just said to Sean [O'Keeffe] maybe go a little bit wider and keep out of trouble. Sean kept it very simple and it was an excellent ride. Was it the plan to have not gone over three miles this season, no, it was a case of getting them ready and running in them in whatever race possible. I hadn't been planning to go the Gold Cup route with this one, but we have to go that way now - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet, For The Fans Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Lecky Watson has a good engine and settled it very quickly. He's probably more mature this season and his jumping is something we can work on - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing '100% Acca Boost On Self Service Terminals' Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He was good. Lecky Watson enjoys being in front, he jumped like a buck, took his breathers when I wanted him to, flew the last and opened up well when asked - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: The third, Lecky Watson, was unlucky too, he was just too keen the whole way - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lecky Watson loves jumping. He was fresh and gassy through the race, so to pull out again and hold off the second horse was a good performance for one of ours at this time of the year. He can only improve - Paul Townend, rider

runners.spotlight: A leading novice chaser last season when unbeaten in three completed starts; took advantage of Ballyburn's failure to beat Stellar Story in the Brown Advisory at Cheltenham; fell at the fifth in a 3m1f Grade 1 event won by Champ Kiely at the Punchestown festival; never involved in the John Durkan on reappearance; return to longer trip should help

stable_tour.quote: Another who has an entry in the John Durkan at Punchestown, and he could start off in that. He won the Brown Advisory last season, so he's entitled to go down the Gold Cup route on the back of that. If he's not up to that level, the Grand National could also be an option. He just keeps on improving and I have a feeling he'll keep progressing this season. He jumps and gallops, and fences have been the making of him. He's a strong stayer over three miles. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Chase record is an off-putting 1-9, can perform well at a high level, faces huge task
runners.name: Montys Star

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: In fairness (that mistake) and having to avoid the horse that fell might have cost Monty's Star a place, but that is it. I like that ground for him I must say. He goes on any ground, but I thought it would help him today, but maybe it didn't. We are delighted and he ran a blinder. We will get our lad home now and see how he is before making any plans - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The New Tote App Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Monty's Star's jumping is his greatest asset. It is tough ground to be jumping out of but he did it well. He stayed and galloped to the line and improved from the last day - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

quotes.race: Surehaul Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Monty's Star is a big, big horse and has taken a long time. He ran really well in a maiden hurdle at Navan where he was a bit green, but I'm delighted with him today. The lads just wanted to see would he stay, and he duly did. He is in the Albert Bartlett and I imagine that is where he will go next - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

runners.spotlight: Chase record is an off-putting 1-9; can perform respectably at a high level; second in Grade 1s as a novice, fourth behind Inothwayurthinkin in last season's Cheltenham Gold Cup; laboured under a big weight burden in the Coral Gold Cup.

stable_tour.quote: He was probably a little bit disappointing last season. He had a setback last summer and we could never really get a clear run with him. He seems good now and is entered in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury, so that's a possibility. I'm not sure about the Gold Cup for him this season. He'll probably need to step forward on his form, but we'll see. 11-11-25

He made his hurdling debut in January when a good second to a smart rival. I expected him to come on for that, so we ran him in a Grade 3 at Clonmel for his second race. We had the odds-on favourite, Hiddenvalley Lake, but despite the difference in prices I didn't think there was that much between them as he was in receipt of 6lb, so when he swept in late to win it wasn't a surprise. He's a big horse and has taken a long time, but it has been worth the wait. That Clonmel race was the perfect springboard for Minella Indo, who finished second to Allaho in 2019 before going to Cheltenham and winning the Albert Bartlett. Hopefully lightning can strike twice as Monty's Star now heads for Cheltenham and the more testing the ground, the better his chance. 01-03-23

runners.comment: Talented novice last term, not enough in his form to suggest he can play a featuring part
runners.name: Stellar Story

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stellar Story's jumping is really starting to come together. That was a great performance by him. Hopefully there are better days ahead with him - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I was thrilled with Stellar Story. If we could get him just to jump a bit better there is a big day in him. He wasn't as guessy at his fences today, and he could go for the Brown Advisory too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Florida Pearl Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Stellar Story didn't want to be in front and the two of them chopped and change. He didn't have the benefit of a run and took a couple of chances. He will probably head for Leopardstown at Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We didn't think Stellar Story was a 33-1 chance to be honest, but we only made the call at ten to ten on Wednesday to run him. He was going to go to Aintree but another horse had a niggle and I couldn't run him. They went no gallop and Sam was in the right position. He's a quality horse. He's gorgeous and a chaser for next season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Pub & Kitchen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stellar Story is a nice horse. Jack said he'd come on from it too as he had a bit of a blow. I was a bit worried in the back straight when the other horse was going with us but he said he'd come on plenty from it and we're delighted. He was bought to be a big staying chaser - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Nursery Of Champions (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Stellar Story learned a lot from his run last day. All he does is stay. He roamed around a lot last day but was good and straight today and he is a nice horse for the future - Harry Swan, rider

runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice chase at Punchestown (3m, soft) last season and 4l second to Lecky Watson in the Brown Advisory at the Cheltenham; looks well held by Champ Kiely on running at the Punchestown festival; made little impression in the Betfair Chase at Haydock on return.

stable_tour.quote: If it's a wet week, he could reappear in the Grade 1 at Down Royal on Saturday. On soft ground, I think he's a proper Grade 1 staying chaser in the making and he ran really well at the top level in novice chases last season. The other option is the Charlie Hall at Wetherby. That's a race that could suit him. He's done well over the summer and looks terrific. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Reverted from chasing/Flat to run in a similar race last time, tailed off then, no appeal
runners.name: Olympic Man
runners.spotlight: Reverted from chasing/Flat to run in a similar race last time, tailed off then; makes no appeal in a race in which his trainer has more attractive candidates.

runners.comment: Last season's Kim Muir winner, decent hurdles form, may need this on seasonal debut
runners.name: Daily Present

quotes.race: Fulke Walwyn Kim Muir Challenge Cup Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Spon By Thames Materials) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Daily Present is a stayer, but he was too free in the race last year. The ride that chap gave him was great as he never left the inside. He just had to try and keep on filling him. He was brilliant on him. I definitely thought Johnnywho was coming back, but I knew my lad would stay, however when I saw Derek (O'Connor) rallying I thought we were done. In fairness to this lad the last race he won at Down Royal he looked like he was going to be fourth, but he stayed on as if he wanted four miles. We are just so delighted. That was the lad's first ride in England. He is a super rider that is loaded with talent, and what a pair of hands he has. I just thought he was super on him - Paul Nolan, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Daily Present looks a fair horse, Sean thinks he's a proper one and I hope he's right. We'll take a look at Fairyhouse and Punchestown. He's only five and strengthening, and he'll probably get one more run - Paul Nolan, trainer

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Supporting Treo Eile Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Daily Present had a lovely run at Naas where he galloped through the line. Sean said he had loads left today. He's a light-framed horse so we won't run too often. He'll have to step up now - Paul Nolan, trainer

runners.spotlight: Last season's Kim Muir winner; has decent hurdles form and the trip will not be an issue; however, he may need this on his seasonal debut.

runners.comment: Smart 150-rated chaser, 18lb lower over hurdles, should be better for a Fairyhouse outing
runners.name: Jordans

quotes.race: Guinness 00 Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That was a great run. We didn't go quick and it developed into a bit of a sprint, but Jordans came home well. I thought I had a chance at the second-last but he was just beaten by a very good horse - Richie Deegan, jockey.

quotes.race: BetVictor Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I thought Jordans would go away and win at the second-last, but he just pricked his ears a bit in front. I was in front a bit soon. He popped the last and it just gave the other horse a chance to come back to us, but I never felt like I was going to be headed. He jumped well and will improve again - Richard Deegan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 150-rated chaser with two Grade 1 seconds to his name, beaten by Impaire Et Passe at Limerick and by Caldwell Potter at Aintree; 16lb lower over hurdles; should be better for a Fairyhouse outing; has to reverse form with fifth-placed Timeless Treaty.

stable_tour.quote: I'm not totally sure where he's going to start off yet, but it will be in a staying chase somewhere and it will be interesting to see where he eventually fits in. He could potentially run in the Grand National, but there's a good bit to happen between then and now. He's a staying chaser and he's in that rating zone. 23-11-25

runners.comment: Maintained her rate of progress with second in a similar race on latest, good 7lb claimer
runners.name: Millstream Lady
runners.owner: Eamon Leahy & Seamus Oriordan & Edward Hayes

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cailin Alainn Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Millstream Lady stays real well. She's only handy but she has some engine. Her mother was a decent mare and the line is still going, so to win a Listed race with her is invaluable really - Eric McNamara, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Mr. Binman Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Millstream Lady put up a great performance to win under that weight. She has been very consistent and is still improving. She can go up in grade and in trip - Eric McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival 2024 Qualifier Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Millstream Lady is not overly big but she has plenty of guts. She stays further and did this well. We might just keep her for the final of this series now - Eric McNamara, trainer.

runners.spotlight: In-form mare; won a 2m6f Killarney handicap in August before finishing third over 2m4f at the Listowel festival; stayed well when landing a five-runner Listed mares' event at Limerick; maintained her rate of progress with second in a similar race (Intent Approach, beaten favourite) on latest; good 7lb claimer

runners.comment: Showed he is in good shape with a Punchestown cross-country win, an adaptable sort
runners.name: Desertmore House
runners.owner: O B P Carroll & Anthony Vaughan

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Risk Of Thunder Chase
quotes.quote: Desertmore House loves this game now. It was his first cross-country run here in the La Touche in the spring and he was good in that. We had him here the other day just for a pop around and he was looking for the next bank. He was just attacking the whole thing, and I thought he'd run a big race. We'll probably aim for Cheltenham in the spring, and I'd say he'll love it around there too - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness Kerry National Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Ricky gave him a fantastic ride. He was always in a good position, knowing that Desertmore House would not quicken for you in a hurry but stays very well. His jumping is very sound for a novice and it couldn't have gone any better. He's a lovely horse. He was bought originally by John Reddington for him to ride in bumpers, and John had a couple of great spins on him. But I always felt he would be at his best when he started going further and jumping fences. The Grand National might well end up being the long-term aim for him, we would have to start thinking about those sorts of races. I ran him in this for the experience, hoping he'd run well. He's passed a couple of tests out there today - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Ulster Carpets Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Desertmore House has a lot of bumper experience and he had plenty of schooling. He's a very laid-back horse and was jumping left the whole way and hopefully he can improve for that. He's a three-mile chaser down the line - Ricky Doyle, rider.

runners.spotlight: Career highlight in winning the 2023 Kerry National; mixed form since then; showed he is in good shape with a Punchestown cross-country win; an adaptable sort but may find a few of his younger rivals too lively here.

runners.comment: Had plenty to spare when scoring on his handicap debut, should have no trouble with trip
runners.name: Son Of Anarchy
runners.spotlight: Point winner; maiden form included a second to Sysko at Punchestown in June; had plenty to spare when scoring on his handicap debut over an extended 2m3f at Punchestown; should have no trouble with this trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's been disappointing. We expected more from him last season but he's back in training now and seems to have got stronger so, fingers crossed, he can start producing what we think he's capable of. 26-10-25

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Luy
runners.comment: Has made the frame in both handicap attempts at 2m4f. fair chance of staying this far
runners.name: Sysko
runners.spotlight: 2m maiden winner on Flat in France at three; ran only once in 2024; won a 2m3f Punchestown maiden in June (gd-yld); came up short when last of seven in a Listed hurdle at Galway; has made the frame in both handicap attempts at 2m4f; fair chance of staying this far.

runners.comment: Has run only five times, less exposed than most here, hard to assess, Paul Townend aboard
runners.name: Eclipse Chaser
runners.spotlight: Second on hurdles debut at Kilbeggan (2m3f, gd-yld) after a point-to-point fall and two modest bumper efforts; took another step in the right direction when winning a 2m5f Navan maiden in September; beaten favourite at same venue last time; less exposed than most here; hard to assess, Paul Townend aboard.

stable_tour.quote: I'd say we might lower his sights a little after his run in the Grade 3 at Navan on Sunday. He just got a bit tired. He'll be more at home on nicer ground, too. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Looked ready for a step up to a trip such as this when keeping on for fifth at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Timeless Treaty

quotes.race: Ballygowan Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Timeless Treaty had worked well at home and I'm delighted to win on him. He jumped and travelled nicely and the more you got after him, the better he went. I thought Fairbanks had the better of us but we hit the line pretty strongly - Paddy Cleary, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut in 2m2f Down Royal maiden in May; backed that up with 2m1f Punchestown novice win following month; made a few little errors at Galway; unseated two out on handicap debut at Bellewstown; looked ready for a step up to a trip such as this when keeping on for fifth at Fairyhouse.

stable_tour.quote: A nice young horse who could do well when he goes chasing. He impressed me with the way he won a novice hurdle at Punchestown over the summer. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner, relatively unexposed, found 2m1f inadequate on latest
runners.name: Cameletta Vega
runners.spotlight: Galway bumper winner; made winning hurdles debut in 2m3f Cork mares maiden in May; beaten favourite in two of her three subsequent races; found 2m1f inadequate on latest; relatively unexposed.

runners.comment: Won over 3m at Listowel despite an untidy round of jumping, poor at Punchestown in October
runners.name: Duke Silver
runners.spotlight: Won over 3m at Listowel despite an untidy round of jumping; poor at Punchestown in October, leaving others with much more obvious claims.

runners.comment: Useful staying handicap chaser though hard to win with, potentially well handicapped here
runners.name: Yeah Man

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. Yeah Man deserves that after a couple of defeats at Ascot. We weren't sure about the ground, but he got through it well. I'd say we'll go for the Irish National now. He wouldn't have got into it off his current mark but he will get in now - that's the target. I think we'll skip Cheltenham - he may have an entry in the Kim Muir but I'd say he's most likely to go for the Irish National - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won the 2024 Grand National Trial at Haydock; fine effort in third behind Stuzzikini in last season's Troytown and went one place better in this year's edition of the big Navan handicap chase; 143-rated chaser competes from a tempting 118 here, with Eoin Staples claiming a very valuable 7lb; has run only three times over hurdles; potentially well handicapped.

stable_tour.quote: He's been consistent in those staying handicap chases in recent seasons and won the Grand National Trial at Haydock last year. He returned in the Munster National last month but stopped quickly and we have no obvious excuse. He has an entry in the Troytown and those type of handicap chases will be on the agenda. Hopefully he can get his form back and be competitive. 04-11-25

He travelled well in the Irish National but I'd say a long season took its toll on him late on as he just didn't get home. He was ready to start back in the Munster National but was taken out as the ground was a bit too lively for him. He's in the Troytown and he'll be entered in all those staying handicaps. 13-11-24

runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Scea Bissons, Mr
runners.comment: Failed to run to expectations over 2m at Navan last time, hard to be sure trip will suit
runners.name: Colonia Victoria

quotes.race: O'Flynn Motors Mallow Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Colonia Victoria had a nice run first time out in Leopardstown. There was no great pace early on and I thought we were going to get done for speed. She jumped great down the straight and that sort of sealed it then. We'll see what sort of a mark she'll get now. I'm thankful to get a win on the board and see where we go from here. We thought the ground here would even be a little bit softer, that's why I wasn't as concerned about the trip. I'd say it is not as soft as it looks and is not riding like winter ground or anything like that. She was sourced by Tom Malone and she wasn't over expensive. She's value going forward and she has a lovely pedigree - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France; maiden hurdle win was gained over 2m3f; failed to run to expectations over 2m at Navan last time; hard to be sure this trip will suit.

runners.comment: Not much mileage on the clock and stays well but this company may prove too demanding
runners.name: Promontory
runners.spotlight: Not much mileage on the clock; stays well as he showed when winning a 3m maiden at Limerick in April; this company may prove too demanding.

runners.comment: Two runs over fences since down the field behind Duke Silver at Listowel, up against it
runners.name: Savante

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Savante is a nice filly and you'd have to be delighted with that. Conor [Stone-Walsh, jockey] said she was still green and it was only her third run. The Grade 3 race at Down Royal is probably the plan for her now. We'll see how she is after this - Colm Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Savante has worked like a nice filly from day one. I'm delighted with what she's done there today. We might put her away as she's a filly that will go on winter ground - Colm Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two runs over fences since down the field behind Duke Silver at Listowel; up against it unless the addition of a tongue-tie makes a big difference.

runners.comment: Possibly too high in the ratings since a Wexford win, soundly beaten twice this term
runners.name: Rue Taylor
runners.spotlight: Has won twice over hurdles at Wexford, notably final start last term in 3m novice in April (yielding), relishing stamina test; soundly beaten twice this term; new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Plenty to prove after flop in the Punchestown qualifier, Millstream Lady was second then
runners.name: Intent Approach
runners.spotlight: Off for a long spell after winning a 2m6f novice handicap hurdle at Down Royal 19 months ago; well enough placed before fading from the last on his return at Listowel; tendency to make mistakes resurfaced when third over 3m at Clonmel; plenty to prove after flop when favourite for the Punchestown qualifier; Millstream Lady second then.

runners.comment: Ended last season with a good run, held by Timeless Treaty but could go well at a price
runners.name: Must Go Now
runners.spotlight: Ran a fine race when fifth in a 25-runner handicap at last season's Punchestown festival; has a bit to find with Timeless Treaty and Jordans on Navan running; fitness likely to be more advanced; could go well at a decent price.

runners.comment: Winner of four of his five races for this stable, gets in here on a nice weight, respected
runners.name: Small Town Hero

quotes.race: Roscommon Herald Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We had a long list at Doncaster, Small Town Hero was the last on the list and the only one we could afford so he's worked out lucky. I was in Farmaclaffley the day he won his point-to-point and he was gutsy. I rang Eoin Mahon who rode him and was told don't run him under 2m4f and don't run him on rattling ground, so it worked out well. Hopefully we'll buy a bit of time now and he'll go through the winter, he wants a bit of soft ground, we got away with it today - Ian Donoghue, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.spotlight: Failed to prosper in Britain; won his first four races for this stable and ran well again when fourth in a handicap chase at Punchestown before regaining the winning thread at Haydock; gets in here on a handy weight, respected.

runners.comment: Has won only once from 20 starts over hurdles, no encouragement from his 2025 form
runners.name: Heliko Conti
runners.spotlight: Has won only once from 20 starts over hurdles; no encouragement from his 2025 form.

runners.comment: Half-brother to the useful Party Central, third in a point, useful addition to top yard
runners.name: Bentraghhill
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-brother by Getaway to five winners, including Party Central (two bumpers, two Flat, four over hurdles) and Craigneiche (useful bumper and hurdles); dam bumper winner; E150,000 purchase at Tattersalls Ireland May sale after finishing third in a point-to-point at Fairyhouse; holds an obvious chance.

runners.comment: Likely candidate for improvement after an introductory run over hurdles at Navan
runners.name: City Of Cork
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam bumper/2m hurdle winner, sister to the stable's high-class staying hurdler Home By The Lee; reached a challenging position before fading from the last to finish around 30l seventh in a 25-runner maiden hurdle at Navan; likely candidate for improvement.

runners.comment: Never showed with a chance first time out at Fairyhouse, not an obvious contender
runners.name: Figero
runners.spotlight: Never showed with a chance first time out at Fairyhouse; not an obvious contender.

runners.comment: Disappointing at Galway last time after a promising third at the same venue
runners.name: Jet Renegade
runners.spotlight: Modest form in point-to-points; more promising effort when third behind two subsequent maiden hurdle winners in a bumper at Galway in October; failed to match that form at the same venue later that month; hooded now.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De La Tour
runners.comment: Expensive buy after 8l point win, needs to improve from Navan run, every chance he will
runners.name: Lemmy Caution
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to a point winner; dam unraced half-sister to useful French hurdle/chase winner Mysoko; purchased for 250,000GBP following 8l point-to-point debut win for champion handler Colin Bowe; failed to quicken when an unplaced favourite on bumper debut at Navan; likely to be capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: He looked the part when he won his four-year-old maiden point for Colin Bowe. He's been showing up well at home and will start off in a bumper soon. Hopefully he's nice. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Sixth foal; half-brother to a winner, plenty of stamina in the family, in good hands
runners.name: Nine Toes Tim
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to a hurdle winner; dam unraced half-sister to bumper/hurdle/chase winner Killultagh Queen, out of point winning sister to smart hurdle/chase winner Killultagh Storm; plenty of stamina in the family; in good hands.

runners.comment: Dam has produced two winners, an experienced point-to-point rider claims a valuable 7lb
runners.name: Regno
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; brother to 2m hurdle winner Reinado, half-brother to 2m3f/2m4f chase winner Atreides; dam point winner.

runners.comment: Ninth foal, half-brother to winners including the versatile Mr Boss Man, good 5lb claimer
runners.name: The Bossman About
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-brother to winners including the versatile Mr Boss Man (bumper/hurdle/chase/ AW Flat), Al Shahir (bumper/2m hurdle) and Fiery Brown (2m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to smart staying jumper Measureofmydreams.

runners.comment: Betrayed inexperience first time out at Wexford, likely to be capable of improvement
runners.name: Tinto De Verano
runners.spotlight: Betrayed inexperience first time out at Wexford, likely to be capable of improvement; good 7lb claimer rides.

runners.comment: Fourth foal, half-brother to a hurdle winner, likely to need the experience of a first run
runners.name: Yanure
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Vairue; dam unraced half-sister to winners Boynagh Joy (1m AW Listed), Welcome Ben (hurdle/chase) and Bobby Bow (hurdle); from a small stable; best watched.

runners.comment: Half-sister to winning jumper Thelasthighking, fair Flat pedigree, from a small stable
runners.name: Any News For Me
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to useful 2m chase/2m3f hurdle winner Thelasthighking; dam 9.4f-2m Flat (inc AW; RPR 99) and 2m hurdle winner, sister to 7f-1m2f Flat and useful 2m hurdle winner Indian Pace.

runners.comment: Mare makes a belated debut at almost eight, unlikely to be good enough in this company
runners.name: Ri Ra
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-sister to a point/chase winner; dam unraced, out of unraced half-sister to useful hurdle/chase winner Big Strand; makes a belated debut at almost eight, unlikely to be good enough in this company; hooded.

runners.comment: Not a bad run at Roscommon in September, failed to build on that at Clonmel last time
runners.name: Rush Slowly
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in a bumper at Roscommon in September; beaten over 25l in fourth, having lost momentum when clipping heels over two furlongs down; towards the rear at Clonmel in November.

runners.comment: Bumper winner here; better on second hurdles start when placed at Navan; may want farther
runners.name: I Started A Joke
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner here over 2m2f last Christmas and respectable runs at Graded level afterwards; better on second hurdles start when placed at Navan; ground will be fine and should contend, although will probably want longer trip in time.

runners.comment: Trained by Willie Mullins when beating some useful types in Fairyhouse bumper in February
runners.name: Kaiser Ball

quotes.race: Ian Smith Memorial (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Ferny Hollow won this race a few years ago and went on to win the bumper at Cheltenham and Kaiser Ball could go to Cheltenham as well. We'll have a word with his connections and see what they want to do - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Trained by Willie Mullins when beating some useful types in Fairyhouse bumper (2m, soft) in February; related to hurdle winners and should do well over obstacles.

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Third in Champion Bumper at Cheltenham, very disappointing in first two hurdle runs
runners.name: Shuttle Diplomacy

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Bookmaker Champion (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shuttle Diplomacy is a proper horse. Bryan (Cooper) rode him in work on Tuesday and he was awesome. He was able to quicken a third time, he's just very good. He was very green at Naas. He was bought very cheap and I've had him since he was a two-year-old. He'll go to Punchestown now. He's a fine horse and has so many gears - Thomas Cooper, trainer.

quotes.race: Fifty Stars "What About Those First Foals" (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Shuttle Diplomacy has only been away a couple of times, but he was very green. He hung but it was only greenness that caused it and but for that he would have won very easily. We'll stay at home I would say and he'll probably end up at Punchestown - Tom Cooper, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner and third in Champion Bumper at Cheltenham but has been very disappointing in first two starts over hurdles; tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Dual 1m4f winner in Britain; after long layoff, pulled up on hurdling debut in October
runners.name: Stonking

prev_owners.owner: Paul G Jacobs And Wetumpka Racing

runners.spotlight: Dual 1m4f winner in Britain; after a long layoff, was pulled up on hurdling debut in October; tried in headgear combination.

runners.breeder: M Jean-Charles Haimet, Mme Elza Petit & Mme Hannah Petit
runners.comment: Point winner rallied well to win 6-runner Fairyhouse bumper last month; hurdling debut
runners.name: Unflinching
runners.spotlight: Point winner for Colin Bowe; having looked beaten, rallied well to land 6-runner Fairyhouse bumper (2m, heavy) last month; hurdling debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely grey horse who won a maiden point at Dromahane for Colin Bowe. Everybody seems to like him here and he's working well. He'll appear in a bumper soon and we're looking forward to that. He could be one of our nicer young horses. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Not beaten far in latest point start; rules debut
runners.name: Bohemian Bay
runners.spotlight: Made 38,000euros as 3yo, 18,500euros at Goresbridge Sales early this month; dam 2m6f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Holerday Ridge (bumper and 2m2f hurdle/2m3f chase) and Early Retirement (2m4f hurdle), out of 2m/2m1f hurdle winner; not beaten far in latest point start; rules debut.

runners.breeder: M Jean Arthur Contou-Carrere & M Yves Broca
runners.comment: Much better effort on seasonal debut, and second hurdle run, when third to Sortudo at Cork
runners.name: Bokamsin
runners.spotlight: Much better effort on seasonal debut, and second start over hurdles, when third to Sortudo at Cork with 118-rated rival a place behind him.

runners.comment: McManus homebred was tailed off on debut at Kilbeggan in June
runners.name: Eye On The Ball
runners.spotlight: McManus homebred was tailed off on debut at Kilbeggan in June.

runners.comment: Unbeaten in two points;  well held in third when 5-4 fav for ordinary Clonmel maiden
runners.name: Justatan
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in two points for Michael Goff; well held in third when 5-4 fav for ordinary Clonmel maiden on second hurdles start; this is much harder.

runners.breeder: S A R L Mm Stud
runners.comment: Expensive store has run well in Punchestown festival bumpers a year apart; hurdling debut
runners.name: King Rasko Grey
runners.spotlight: Expensive store has run well in Punchestown festival bumpers a year apart, showing good reserves of stamina when second over 2m3f in May; probably would prefer farther than this trip; hurdling debut.

stable_tour.quote: I always thought he was well up to winning a bumper but it just didn't happen for one reason or another. That said, he ran well in both his bumpers at Punchestown. He's a very nice horse who should do really well once he switches to hurdles. You definitely haven't seen the best of him yet. 17-11-25

runners.breeder: E A Bourke M R C V S
runners.comment: Modest form so far; will get a mark after this outing.
runners.name: Mister Rockefeller
runners.spotlight: Modest form so far; will get a mark after this outing.

runners.breeder: M Olivier Varin & Mme Severine Humbert
runners.comment: Runner-up in three bumpers; only okay form in two hurdle starts and been off over a year
runners.name: Olympy De Cerisy
runners.spotlight: Point winner and runner-up in three bumpers; only okay form in two hurdle starts and has been off over a year.

runners.comment: Placed in a couple of points; 80s, well beaten on rules debut in Galway maiden
runners.name: Shoe Shinner
runners.spotlight: Placed in a couple of points; 80s, well beaten on rules debut in Galway maiden.

runners.comment: Tailed off in Punchestown maiden last month
runners.name: The Shanty Field
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in Punchestown maiden last month.

runners.comment: Second to a recent hurdles winner in a point; remote sixth on hurdling debut at Cork.
runners.name: Ballingurteen
runners.spotlight: Second to a recent hurdles winner in a point; remote sixth on hurdling debut at Cork.

runners.comment: Weak form in points and was 200-1 when tailed off on hurdling debut at Cork
runners.name: Barrowline
runners.spotlight: Weak form in points and was 200-1 when tailed off on hurdling debut at Cork.

runners.comment: Beaten 33l in a bumper and jumping issues in first two starts over hurdles
runners.name: Fervida
runners.spotlight: Beaten 33l in a bumper and jumping issues in first two starts over hurdles.

runners.breeder: M Erick Bec De La Motte & M Francois-Marie Cottin
runners.comment: Point winner two years ago; respectable run on hurdling debut, tailed off last time
runners.name: Madame Masque
runners.spotlight: Point winner two years ago; respectable run on hurdling debut at Gowran but was tailed off last time.

runners.comment: Nice pedigree but has been pulled up in all four points; rules debut; reserve.
runners.name: Clonsast
runners.spotlight: Reserve; cost 50,000 euros as 3yo; half-brother to winners Feronily (smart 2m3f hurdle/3m chase), Ava Rose (2m hurdle) and Top Of The List (point); dam placed in point, half-sister to bumper and smart 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Watson Lake; pulled up in all four points; rules debut.

runners.comment: Two bumper wins on good ground; encouraging fourth on heavy at Clonmel latest
runners.name: Minella Emperor
runners.spotlight: His two bumper wins came on good ground but it was heavy when a 6l fourth of 18 in a 2m3f maiden at Clonmel earlier this month; that form brings him strongly into the equation.

runners.breeder: Miss A Gibson Fleming & Selwood B/Stock
runners.comment: Well beaten into second in last bumper but this longer trip looks sure to benefit
runners.name: Panjandrum

prev_owners.owner: Selwood Bloodstock & Mrs A Gibson Flemin

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Panjandrum has always been a nice horse, he shapes nicely at home and I think the ease in the ground helped as I think he'll be a nice winter horse. Harry [Swan] was delighted with him and gave him a nice ride. The likes of Navan and winter ground would be right up his street and we'll see what Gordon thinks, but I'd say he could go up in distance. He won his point to point in England for Gina and Tom Ellis, he came with a nice reputation and hopefully he can build on this - Lisa O'Neill, trainer's representative.

runners.spotlight: Point and bumper winner on soft ground; no match for the winner in a small-field Listed bumper at Navan but this longer trip looks sure to benefit on hurdling debut.

stable_tour.quote: He won a British point-to-point for Gina Andrews. He's a nice prospect and looks to have plenty of ability. You'll see him turn up in a bumper on soft ground. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Beaten 17l when third in his point; makes hurdling debut after a mammoth absence
runners.name: Battle With Time
runners.spotlight: Beaten 17l when third in his point; makes hurdling debut after a mammoth absence.

runners.comment: First foal; dam placed French 2m2f hurdle, half-sister to the useful jumper Karl Philippe
runners.name: Classic Tuxedo
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam placed French 2m2f hurdle, half-sister to the useful jumper Karl Philippe; tongue-tie fitted for debut; limited appeal unless backed.

runners.comment: Won a point in May 2024; bled from the nose when tailed off in this maiden 12 months ago
runners.name: Freddies Back
runners.spotlight: Won a point in May 2024; bled from the nose when tailed off in this maiden 12 months ago (7-1); now has tongue tied.

runners.comment: Second in a point and his 22l sixth in a Clonmel maiden wasn't devoid of promise
runners.name: Kaiser De Chanay
runners.spotlight: Second in a point and his 22l sixth in a Clonmel maiden wasn't devoid of promise (first-time tongue-tie); can improve.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Tonnencourt
runners.comment: Beaten favourite at Tramore but didn't run at all badly; may need more here
runners.name: Khmer
runners.spotlight: Every chance when falling at the last in a maiden hurdle at Fairyhouse in November (2m, soft to heavy); beaten favourite at Tramore but didn't run at all badly; may need more here.

runners.comment: Third in a Grade 2 at Cheltenham and should be hard to beat with a repeat of that effort
runners.name: Kings Bucks
runners.spotlight: Point winner; shaped well on hurdling debut at Galway (2m) and then showed much improved form to finish third behind the exciting No Drama This End in a Grade 2 at Cheltenham (2m5f, soft); should be difficult to beat with a repeat of that effort.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a nice race at Galway when fourth in a maiden hurdle and had a good run in a bumper last season. I feel he needs to step up in trip and he could potentially go to Cheltenham on Friday for the 2m5f Grade 2 novice hurdle. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Now 0-5 over hurdles and he'll be outclassed by the best of these
runners.name: Luck Between Us
runners.spotlight: Now 0-5 over hurdles and he'll be outclassed by the best of these.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a bumper here and a 2m3f maiden at Kilbeggan
runners.name: Moorish Castle
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a bumper here and a 2m3f maiden at Kilbeggan.

runners.breeder: S C E A Hamel Stud
runners.comment: Beaten 16l and 61l in two maidens for this yard; handicaps will be more like it
runners.name: Rony Has
runners.spotlight: Went close in a Worcester bumper for previous yard; beaten 16l and 61l in two maidens for this one; handicaps will be more like it.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecuries Babsen Courses
runners.comment: Second in a point but beaten 15l in a Fairyhouse bumper 13 months ago after racing freely
runners.name: You Proof
runners.spotlight: Second in a point but beaten 15l in a Fairyhouse bumper 13 months ago after racing freely (went off 11-4); principally respected due to his connections and the Mullins yard won this last year with Final Demand.

runners.comment: Has no form claims after heavy defeats in two bumpers and as many maidens
runners.name: Nothing Da Now
runners.spotlight: Has no form claims after heavy defeats in two bumpers and as many maidens; entered here on Saturday (1.05).

runners.comment: First foal; dam well held in bumper but related to winning jumpers; best watched on debut
runners.name: Queen Odroad
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam well held in bumper but related to winning jumpers; best watched on debut.

runners.comment: Leading novice hurdler made fine start over fences when winning at Navan
runners.name: Final Demand

quotes.race: Race And Stay Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Final Demand was just so natural, meeting every fence on the right stride. When he got over the third-last Paul just gave him a squeeze and a shake and he started opening up again. His jumping was just fantastic. It looks like he's the real deal. There is still plenty of improvement in him. I wouldn't have had him tuned up at all for that Navan race, so we'll roll onto Christmas with him now, maybe Limerick, and then the Dublin Racing Festival and hopefully the Brown Advisory - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Alanna Homes Champion Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul [Townend, jockey] thought he didn't go fast enough at Cheltenham but we wanted to show Final Demand off today. I wasn't that happy over the first few hurdles but then he was just electric. For a big chaser to jump the way he did, he was getting lengths at hurdles when it mattered. I thought he was going to tire but he kept taking a length out of the horse behind him. If he can jump fences like that he's one to look forward to - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Final Demand ran a really good race, but he was just not good enough on the day. The New Lion was a very good winner, but we look forward to going chasing with our lad next season. I don't think his jump at the last had any impact. You could see coming to the last that unless we had a day like yesterday he wasn't going to win. I just felt I didn't want to go the trip in the Albert Bartlett at this stage of his career. He will probably end up going three miles next season, but not now. I imagine we will go to Punchestown with him at the end of the season - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: When Paul [Townend, jockey] started to niggle turning for home I was wondering what Final Demand might have in the tank. I never thought he would have that much and he was probably going better passing the post than at any other stage of the race. To do what he did there on only his second run over hurdles was a huge achievement. What he did from the last to the line sets him apart from other horses. He's a specimen and I believe he was one of the most expensive store purchases of his generation, which doesn't always work out, but it has with this fellow. I would not mind going back in trip with him, and it makes me think about whether this race should be over two and a half miles instead of two miles and six furlongs - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: CUBE Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Final Demand was good and straightforward. He is a massive horse and hopefully he has the potential to match. He's classy and he could come back in trip - Danny Mullins, rider.

runners.spotlight: Won his sole point; only defeat in four races over hurdles, including a maiden victory here, came when outpaced over 2m5f on good to soft at Cheltenham in March; fairly bolted up under more positive tactics on either side of that, in Grade 1s at Leopardstown (2m6f, soft) and Punchestown (2m4f, yielding); fine start over fences when winning over just shy of this trip at Navan last month and he's a short-priced favourite for the 3m novice chase at Cheltenham in March.

stable_tour.quote: He was just so natural at Navan, meeting every fence on the right stride. When he got over the third-last Paul just gave him a squeeze and a shake and he started opening up again. His jumping was just fantastic. It looks like he's the real deal. There is still plenty of improvement in him. I wouldn't have had him tuned up at all for that Navan race, so we'll roll on to Christmas with him now, maybe Limerick, and then the Dublin Racing Festival and hopefully the Brown Advisory. 17-11-25

runners.breeder: Scea De Maulepaire & M C De Saint Seine
runners.comment: After a hat-trick of chase wins, he was no match for Romeo Coolio in the Drinmore
runners.name: Gold Dancer

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Mrs Lynne Maclennan, Ecurie Herve Guerin Et Al

quotes.race: ODS Engineering Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Gold Dancer is improving, he'll have tougher tasks ahead, but he's entitled to go up in grade again - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Guinness Open Gate Brewery Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Of my runners, I thought Westport Cove would win but Gold Dancer is by Doctor Dino, who is a horse we like, and Sean gave him a lovely cute ride. He left Paul (Townend) do all the donkey work, had one crack at him and it all worked out. We'll go down the novice chase route with him now at the big festivals and hopefully he is good enough to go on to the Drinmore Chase in December - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Expensive French recruit; failed to live up to price tag over hurdles and flopped on his only chase start last season; hit form in the summer with a hat-trick of chase wins including a pair of Grade 3 contests; no match for Romeo Coolio when beaten 8l in the Drinmore at Fairyhouse but 152-rated performer still merits plenty of respect.

stable_tour.quote: He is three from three over fences and is a rapid improver. We've given him an entry in the Drinmore at Fairyhouse at the end of the month, and that would look a logical place to take him next. He's done absolutely nothing wrong since going chasing and did everything right at Tipperary last time. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Coral Cup winner in March; impressive on chase debut at Fairyhouse last month
runners.name: Jimmy Du Seuil

quotes.race: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Jimmy Du Seuil jumped brilliantly, and it looks like he might even be a better chaser than he was a hurdler. He beat them easily. Nick Rockett and I Am Maximus got beat in this beginners' chase and Impaire Et Passe won it. We always thought this lad was a Grade 1 horse and hopefully he can make into one - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Cup Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jimmy Du Seuil probably had a setback during the season, I can't really remember, and then we said we have to come here. We got him ready at home and Danny gave him a super ride. We felt it was worth taking a chance as this is one of the hardest races to win. You need so much luck and you need a good horse - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Gallagher Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The winner is a very good horse but Jimmy Du Seuil took a nice step forward. He's only learning all of the time and he'll improve again - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

runners.spotlight: Well-beaten second to Ballyburn in 2m5f novice hurdle at last year's Cheltenham festival and gave 5lb and a 3l beating to Impose Toi in the Coral Cup back there in March; impressive on chase debut at Fairyhouse last month (extended 2m5f, yielding to soft) where he beat smart mare The Big Westerner; remote third won decent beginners' next time; has won on heavy and lots of potential as a chaser.

stable_tour.quote: He's entered in the Hatton's Grace, but I'd say we'll go chasing with him. He likes Cheltenham, and that's not a bad place to like! He chased home Ballyburn a few seasons ago and won the Coral Cup there last season. He should get three miles no problem. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Useful handicap hurdler; fourth in 2m7f beginners' at Punchestown; will be a big outsider
runners.name: Western Walk
runners.spotlight: Useful handicap hurdler at up to 3m (rated 132); early exit on chase debut behind Final Demand when he was 50-1 chance; ran well when fourth in 2m7f beginners' at Punchestown but likely to be outclassed here.

14:15.race_name: Campion Insurance Tim Duggan Memorial Handicap Chase (Listed Race)

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De La Perelle
runners.comment: Won useful Punchestown h'cap on seasonal debut; Millar on board so effectively only up 3lb
runners.name: Dee Capo

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Jack [Kennedy] said Dee Capo has grown up a lot, and he was very straightforward.He jumps really well and handled that ground very well. He was entitled to do something like that and hopefully he can build on it going forward into the season ahead - Lisa O'Neill, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymaloe Relish Rising Stars Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Dee Capo is a nice horse and was running a good race the last day at Navan when he made the mistake and fell two out. He can go out in trip and showed a good attitude galloping out to the line - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dee Capo got a nice ride from Danny. He had a couple of quick runs and we decided to freshen him up and have him right for the spring. He'll go to Fairyhouse or Aintree. He's a good horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Dee Capo did it well and jumped great. He had a little bit of a look in front but you'd forgive him that. I'd say whatever he does over hurdles will be a bonus, he's a chaser in the making. He loved that ground and in a better race, he'll be a better horse again. He's a nice one going forward - Jack Kennedy, jockey

runners.spotlight: Very smart on his day, including when winning strong beginners' chase at Leopardstown last Christmas and, after eight months off, a useful Punchestown handicap on seasonal debut; both those wins came over 2m5f and he's adaptable as regards ground; got 8lb hike but Millar's claim lightens the load.

stable_tour.quote: He's still relatively unexposed as a chaser and I'd like to think there might be a nice handicap chase in him this season. He seems best at around 2m4f. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Assessor is giving veteran a chance but younger legs will likely have his measure
runners.name: Rebel Gold
runners.owner: R Kennedy & Michael Odowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan

prev_owners.owner: Michael Odowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
T H Stanley & Michael Odowd & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
Michael Odowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
T H Stanley & Michael Odowd & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy

quotes.race: Newlands Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Rebel Gold didn't have to make all the running today which was a big help to him. I would have been more confident had the ground been soft, but he was fine on it and we will probably head now for the Grade 2 at Fairyhouse - Pat Foley, trainer

quotes.race: Dan & Joan Moore Memorial Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: That was great. Rebel Gold jumps and travels and any jockey that rides him comes back with a smile on their face. They get such a thrill from him. He's a pleasure to train because he's the most straightforward horse you'll come across. We went for the Leopardstown Chase last year and really thought he'd get the trip, as it turned out he didn't really. We might go back for it though, ride him differently and try to creep into it. He deserved to win a big one.  I'm delighted for the horse and delighted for the owners - Pat Foley, trainer.

quotes.race: Daly Farrell Chartered Accountants Beginners Chase
