quotes.quote: Rebel Gold is a fantastic jumper, is 132 over fences already and we'll see what the handicapper does with him now but there'll be a nice handicap in him. The Shamrock Handicap Chase back here in March will probably be his next race. He's not really ground dependent so we will keep him going over the summer - Pat Foley, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Exhibit A Displays Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The other horse was a bit slow at the last and that helped me. My lad hadn't run since Galway so it was a good performance as he needed the run. He'll be a nice horse for chasing. I'd say that could be his limit over hurdles now. I'd say more than likely his next run will be in a chase. He's a big horse and ran in point-to-points so I'd say that's his game - Paddy Kennedy, rider of Rebel Gold

quotes.race: Well Done To All Frontline Staff From Limerick Racecourse Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: It's my first winner for Tom [Foley]. The horse was very free early on but they've done a great job settling him in his work. He loves the ground and should improve as well. He's nice and there might be a novice for him at Galway, he'll stay further -they went a good gallop. It probably wasn't the strongest race in the world but you can only beat what's put in front of you. It was a nice performance - Paddy Kennedy, rider of Rebel Gold

runners.spotlight: Grand veteran was second in this three years ago and still running to a fair level; well held latest two handicap starts but the assessor is giving him a chance; younger legs will likely have his measure, though.

runners.comment: Placed in useful mares' contests last term; can jump left but could be on a nice mark
runners.name: Karia Des Blaises
runners.spotlight: It didn't really happen for her over hurdles but fared much better over fences last term, placed in useful mares' contests including after a 190-day layoff at Cork last December; jumped left on latest two starts at right-handed tracks, so that's a worry, but she could be on a nice mark and no ground concerns.

stable_tour.quote: She won her only start in France for Emmanuel Clayeux and looks a nice juvenile filly who should do well over hurdles. 13-11-23

runners.comment: Course winner is 4-8 in handicap chases but this trip looks too short
runners.name: Bushmans Pass

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Handicap Chase Final (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with Bushmans Pass. It was a good battle. I love a good battle when I win it, but I wouldn't like to be second in a battle like that! If the ground was soft at Punchestown there is a 3m6f race and he'd definitely go there. We're delighted with that. He's coming along, the handicapper wasn't easy on him early on - Oliver McKiernan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Course winner is 4-8 in handicap chases and won Leinster National over 3m1f at Naas in March; last seen when not getting home in Irish Grand National having been on the sharp end; this trip looks too short and he's probably high enough in the ratings now.

runners.comment: Two good runs at Cheltenham this year and second over C&D in October; should be bang there
runners.name: Conyers Hill

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Conyers Hill is a hold-up horse and tends not to find too much. He was sticky enough at a few of his fences, but he had to battle today and held the second to the line. He might head on to Cheltenham for the novice handicap chase - Paul Nolan, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power How Many Days 'Til Christmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Conyers Hill jumped slick and well but he certainly doesn't do much when he gets to the front. He got a bit of confidence from Clonmel the last day. He came there travelling well and I thought he was going to get caught at the line but he battled on well - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer can sometimes find less than expected but two good runs at Cheltenham this year, including Paddy Power in November (strong form), and creditable second over C&D on his seasonal debut the previous month; this looks a good spot for him and should be bang there.

stable_tour.quote: He's ultra consistent. He travels so well but then doesn't seem to find off the bridle. At the same time, he seemed to plug on at Cheltenham [fourth in the Paddy Power Gold Cup]. He's settling better now, so maybe we can try to ride him a little bit more prominently next time and try to ride a handy waiting race. 23-11-25

runners.comment: Trainer mentioned this race as possible target after his win in 2m5f beginners' at Cork
runners.name: Nowwhatdoyouthink

quotes.race: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: That's a bit more like what Nowwhatdoyouthink is capable of. He gave him a great ride. He held onto him great and didn't really go for him. He has a big engine and it's just getting it all out of him. We'll take today and see what he does after that. I was thinking of a handicap in Limerick before the race, but we might look at something else now - Ray Hackett, trainer.

quotes.race: ThurlesRaces.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He has sound point-to-point form and Nowwhatdoyouthink's Cork bumper win is working out well. He got a bang in Listowel so you would forgive him that but we couldn't believe how bad he was at Punchestown and we found he had an issue with his wind so we got that tidied up and that was obviously a big help today. You see how lairy he was at the finish. Hopefully better races, where he'd be running at horses would suit. We were dreaming big at one stage but we're starting small again here and working our way back up - Ray Hackett, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Woodlands House Hotel Adare (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Nowwhatdoyouthink is still a big baby and if he had a lead for longer it would have been better. It wouldn't make sense to jump hurdles now so he'll either go to Punchestown for a winners' bumper or go out to grass - Ray Hackett, trainer

runners.spotlight: Point/bumper/maiden hurdle winner; trainer mentioned this race as a possible target after his smooth win in 2m5f beginners' at Cork last month for which he got a 6lb hike; has a nice bit of experience for a novice.

runners.comment: Made all to win last year's renewal by 6l; lack of a recent run may leave him vulnerable
runners.name: Dancing Jeremy

quotes.race: Campion Insurance Tim Duggan Memorial Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't expect Dancing Jeremy to do it as well as that. He was in at Fairyhouse over hurdles earlier in the month but I took him out because I thought the ground was a bit too tight. This race was always the plan but I would have liked to have got a run into him. We might get a bit adventurous now and try and qualify for that Albert Bartlett Triple Crown Series Hurdle at Punchestown, but we'll leave our options open. Today was the day. He loves that trip and the ground was grand for him - James Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were hoping Dancing Jeremy would do something like that at Listowel but it was game over after the first. It was his first run over fences in a while and he probably just took a chance at it. He wants soft ground so hopefully he will kick on now over the winter and give a good account. His main aim will probably be back chasing - James Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilmolash (Q.R.) Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dancing Jeremy is not a natural hurdler but he was probably thrown in. His future lies over fences and we will find a novice handicap chase - Tom Cooper, trainer

quotes.race: AIB Merchant Services Pay By Link Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Dancing Jeremy was suited by this race. He travelled like a good horse. He was winging fences and he was like a handicapper in a beginners. Hopefully he can go forward - Tom Cooper, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Front-runner put in a fine display of jumping when landing last year's renewal by 6l; now 8lb higher and not seen since falling over hurdles in February; lack of a recent run might leave him vulnerable to closers in the home straight this time.

runners.comment: 0-10 in chases but getting her act together over fences; can contend off a light weight
runners.name: Ballybawn Belter

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballybawn Belter has been amazing. She was narrow and skinny when Frank (Berry) bought her but she's done well physically. She seems to stay reasonably well but physically she's done very well in the last six to eight months as she wasn't imposing last year. I was contemplating going over fences with her as she jumps a fence really well, but Frank twisted my arm to stay over hurdles. She's a pleasure to train. I'm looking forward to running her over fences - Liz Doyle, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Series Final Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballybawn Belter was suited by the trip and got a lovely clean ride on quickish ground. She might get a bit of a break now and maybe come back for Galway - Liz Doyle, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Paddy Mullins Mares Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Ballybawn Belter won her bumper here. I thought the good gallop would help her because it's a bit short for her. She jumps very well now. It's a hard race to win - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Did well over hurdles but has been a slow-burner over fences (0-10); comes here in good form, though, after a narrow defeat at Galway (extended 2m6f) and a creditable sixth in the Troytown where 3m might have just stretched her; could well contend off a light weight.

runners.comment: Fair form in first three beginners' chases; best runs on good/yielding; handicap debut
runners.name: Uncle Pat
runners.owner: Patrick Corbett & Michael Corbett & J J Corbett & W Clancy

quotes.race: Dairygold Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Uncle Pat is progressing away. He jumps great and he's maturing away. I think he'll keep improving - Paul Townend, rider.

runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner; fair form in first three beginners' chases including fourth in useful 2m6f contest at Listowel; tailed off on testing ground last time and best runs have come on good/yielding; handicap debut; 1lb wrong.

runners.comment: Two wins in summer; good run in strong novice handicap at Cheltenham last time; 3lb wrong
runners.name: El Champo

quotes.race: Charlie Chute Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: El Champo's jumping was brilliant and Tiernan over a fence is scary because he's so positive and accurate. It's very special and the owners have been unbelievable for me - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Race In Pink Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: El Champo was back in trip here which was ideal as he was able to roll on in front. That race was made for him. He was let dictate and that really suits around here. He might go chasing now - Philip Rothwell, trainer

quotes.race: Tom Lynam Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: El Champo is a lovely horse. He had run well in a couple of maidens that worked out well and I hoped he could be competitive. He could go straight to a beginners chase now - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles and came good over fences in late summer this year, winning twice including 2m6f handicap at Listowel; Limerick hasn't been his track so far and was beaten favourite when fifth here in October; good run in strong novice handicap at Cheltenham last time; been ridden prominently of late; 3lb wrong.

runners.comment: 3lb out of the weights when beaten about 12l in a stronger handicap at Navan
runners.name: Grimaud

prev_owners.owner: Riviera Equine Sarl, Haras Detreham Et Al

quotes.race: Golf Classics At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Grimaud had the form and would have wanted to be winning that so it's nice for him to get off the mark. He wouldn't mind the ground a bit better. It's very testing and he did well to get through it - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner who has won a maiden over hurdles; beaten 2l and 12l in his last two handicaps, the latest a strong race at Navan in which he was 3lb out of the weights; likely to go well with Carl Millar taking off 5lb.

stable_tour.quote: We'll find the right handicap hurdle for him when the rain comes and the ground gets a bit softer. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Came from a long way off the pace to keep Quest With Speed honest at Navan
runners.name: Collaborative
runners.spotlight: 17lb higher than for his previous handicap win but he came from a long way off the pace to keep Quest With Speed honest at Navan; tries 3m for the first time and it could suit.

runners.comment: Recent Navan winner and essentially off the same mark with Paddy Hanlon claiming his 7lb
runners.name: Quest With Speed
runners.spotlight: Likes testing ground and dug deep to fend off Collaborative over Navan's 2m4f; essentially off the same mark with Paddy Hanlon claiming his 7lb; raced prominently last time.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Domaine De Baune
runners.comment: Recent Clonmel winner; he's up the weights here and can be inconsistent
runners.name: Jeriko De Baune
runners.owner: Crohane Town & Country Syndicate/Mrs E A Lawlor

prev_owners.owner: Mrs E A Lawlor/Crohane Town & Country Syndicate

quotes.race: Clonmel Oil Service Station Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Being 2lb out of the handicap wasn't ideal but I was glad that Gordon [Elliott] didn't declare his top weight which would have put us 7lb out, and we probably wouldn't have run. Jeriko De Baune likes heavy ground and while it wasn't as heavy as he'd like it, he stuck at it well. Who knows where he ends up going but he has a handicap mark over fences as well. Normally he'd be flat out and lose his place before staying on again. Niall [Moore] took the bull by the horns and rode him positively, so it was a great ride - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 2lb out of the weights when winning at Clonmel last time (3m, soft); has more on his plate on these terms and can be inconsistent.

runners.breeder: Mme Anne - Charlotte Andre, Mme Clotilde Nicolazo De Barmon
runners.comment: C&D winner; last run too bad to be true and remains unexposed
runners.name: Kir
runners.spotlight: Made a successful handicap debut over C&D (soft) and unlikely he gave his true running at Navan (2m5f, heavy) after a 9lb hit; remains unexposed.

runners.comment: A 22l fourth at Punchestown but that wasn't a bad run at all after 331 days away
runners.name: Sarah Beara
runners.spotlight: 1-17 over hurdles; never dangerous when a 22l fourth at Punchestown but that wasn't a bad run at all after 331 days away.

runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner; tailed off/fell in two runs over fences after a long absence
runners.name: Joyau De Thaix

quotes.race: Signsplus Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Joyau De Thaix has improved a ton since Gowran and Sean thinks he's a good horse. He's a likeable horse that jumps like a buck and has a great attitude - James Nolan, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner in 2023 and ran quite well in a Listed race on his handicap debut; sent over fences after a long absence and was tailed off the first time before falling midrace a month ago; not easy to assess right now.

runners.comment: His third in a Thurles handicap chase last week was a return to form
runners.name: The Gradual Slope

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mark [McDonagh, jockey] gave The Gradual Slope a cool ride the whole way round, he just got him to switch off halfway down the back because he was over-travelling. It was a great way for him to lose his claim. This fellow has been really running well in beginners' chases where you meet the top novices off level weights. He's only small, but coming in here off a nice weight he had a big chance - Sean O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Gradual Slope did that very well. We kept it simple. He's probably not the quickest horse and riding him handy here made all the difference. He's versatile and perhaps we will got for a novice handicap down the line - Sean O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Stays further than this and his third in a Thurles handicap chase last week was a return to form; has won twice over hurdles.

runners.comment: Raced prominently but weakened when sixth behind Quest With Speed at Navan
runners.name: From The Ashes
runners.spotlight: 1-14 over fences and 0-13 as a hurdler; raced prominently but weakened when sixth behind Quest With Speed at Navan.

runners.comment: 13-2 for handicap debut at Cork last time but never threatened to take a hand
runners.name: The Night Agent
runners.spotlight: Placed in a bumper and a maiden hurdle; only 13-2 for handicap debut three weeks ago at Cork (2m4f, soft to heavy) but never threatened to take a hand.

runners.comment: Placed in one of his maiden hurdles; tailed off over fences the last twice
runners.name: Mighty Berkshire
runners.spotlight: Placed in one of his maiden hurdles; tailed off over fences the last twice and has enough to prove in his first handicap; tongue-tie tried.

runners.comment: Yet to offer much in handicaps and fell on his chase debut when last seen in May
runners.name: Thegraveyardbookie

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Thegraveyardbookie's jumping was very poor early on, I was almost embarrassed! Conor was a lot further back than he wanted to be, but he has a bit of an engine and there's huge improvement in him. There's no doubt he was lucky today, but if he jumped better he would have been in a much more competitive position. He's a very raw, weak horse, and I think he could be a nice horse in time. We'll probably give him maybe one more run this season in a couple of months and then put him out to grass - Emmet McNamara, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a heavy-ground maiden hurdle at this fixture two years ago; yet to offer much in handicaps and fell on his chase debut when last seen in May.

runners.comment: 2m maiden winner here; has stamina to prove over this far and tries headgear
runners.name: Siege Ofjadotville
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m handicap here in March; about 12l down when unseating late on at Cork 21 days ago; has stamina to prove over this far and tries headgear.

runners.comment: Blinkers added after a poor last run but he has the form to feature
runners.name: Meehall

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Meehall likes the track, the trip and gets through that softer ground. He is very versatile, that's his second win of the summer and we'll look for something similar over either fences or hurdles in the next few weeks - Conor McNamara, assistant trainer

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Meehall got a lovely ride from Conor, he kept it simple and was nice and handy the whole way. He kept him to the best of the ground. He jumped well. He has come of age a little. He has been running away during the summer and we will give him a chance now - Eric McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Owens McCarthy Claims Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Meehall was straightforward out in front and galloped all the way to the line. He got in tight to the last two fences but was clever out over them - Cathal Landers, rider.

runners.spotlight: Blinkers added after a poor last run, but he has the form to feature should the new headgear work.

runners.comment: Chase career hasn't gone to plan and was also well beaten over hurdles on his reappearance
runners.name: Duffys Getaway

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffys Getaway won very well the last day and we'll go easy on him now and probably aim at Fairyhouse on New Year's Day or something in the New Year. Hopefully he'll come out of this okay - Philip Rothwell, trainer

runners.spotlight: Progressive 3m handicap hurdler in 2023/24 season on soft/heavy; chasing career hasn't gone to plan and was also well beaten over hurdles on his reappearance.

runners.comment: Lightly raced and stuck to his guns for second over C&D last month
runners.name: Roc My Haarth
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and stuck to his guns for second over C&D last month; was also placed on his previous run here so likes the track.

runners.comment: Stamina queries but did run on late for third over 2m4f last time at Navan
runners.name: Midleton Rare
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 1-11 over hurdles; has yet to shine over this sort of trip but did run on late for third over 2m4f last time at Navan.

runners.comment: 2m4f handicap winner; beaten just under 10l after an absence at Punchestown (3m)
runners.name: Warmer Days Ahead
runners.spotlight: 2m4f handicap winner; beaten just under 10l after an absence at Punchestown (3m, heavy) and should strip fitter here.

runners.comment: C&D winner in October; the ground was yielding and he's not encountered anything softer
runners.name: Rhythmic Tune
runners.spotlight: A C&D winner in October and that was only his seventh career start and a first over this trip; the ground was yielding and he's not encountered anything softer; up 7lb.

runners.comment: Well backed to exploit a good mark at Clonmel and he delivered by half a length; up 5lb
runners.name: Great Island

quotes.race: Joe Bollard Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Great Island must be one of the unluckiest horses in training. Last year he was involved in a melee at the first at Downpatrick and he ended up with six fractured ribs so was off for a while. Then he got jarred up on his first run back at Tramore so was off for the summer - Eoin Griffin, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well backed to exploit a good mark at Clonmel (2m3f, heavy) and he delivered by half a length; a 5lb rise shouldn't be too damaging.

runners.comment: Some maiden promise but has offered little in handicaps; absent since January
runners.name: Aines Lad
runners.spotlight: Some maiden promise but has offered little in handicaps; absent since January.

runners.comment: Well held on handicap debut; he's unexposed at this trip and he should stay
runners.name: Opposite Ends
runners.spotlight: Never threatened when 25-1 for his first handicap at Thurles (2m, good to yielding); he's unexposed at this trip and he should stay.

runners.breeder: M Guillaume Chatelus & M Dr V Philippe Chatelus
runners.comment: Latest race here wasn't run to suit; consistent gelding who should be involved
runners.name: Gaelic Des Chastys
runners.owner: Wise Guys Syndicate/E Munro/Thomas Fitzsimons/Manorplace Ltd

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Play "1-2-Free" Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Gaelic De Chastys is a new horse to the yard and has been doing everything really nicely since we got him. I think the secret to him is a bit of nice ground. He's a real good actioned horse and I'd like to think there is a bit of improvement in him - Eric McNamara, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Consistent gelding over fences and hurdles; over the smaller obstacles the last twice, going down by only 2l over C&D before a 22l defeat last time when unable to land a blow from off the pace; remains of interest.

runners.comment: Record of 0-10 over hurdles and she's not progressing in handicaps over varying distances
runners.name: Cooltubrid Eva
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-10 over hurdles and she's not progressing in handicaps over varying distances; more required.

runners.comment: This trip should be a better fit than 2m last time but others have more compelling claims
runners.name: Drumcliff Bay
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way after a break over 2m at Thurles a month ago; this trip should be a better fit but others have more compelling claims.

runners.comment: First run for this yard when third of 16 from an unpromising position at Clonmel
runners.name: Wakey Wakey Man
runners.spotlight: Low mileage and first run for this yard when third of 16 from an unpromising position at Clonmel (2m3f, heavy); the potential is there to raise his game.

runners.comment: Absent since beaten 25l into sixth at Fairyhouse in February; will need more
runners.name: Brown Boots
runners.spotlight: Absent since beaten 25l into sixth at Fairyhouse in February; will need more and the absence is not ideal.

runners.comment: Hard to trust having been tailed off at Clonmel after a year off
runners.name: Danesfort Mayfly
runners.spotlight: Tramore winner over this trip in November 2024 (soft to heavy) but was tailed off after a year out at Clonmel.

runners.comment: Both wins have been over fences and he's rated much lower over hurdles for a reason
runners.name: One Horse Army

quotes.race: Early Bird For Easter Festival @Fairyhouse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: One Horse Army just gallops and stays. Soft ground and a trip is what he wants - Paudie Roche, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Could strip fitter for his hurdle run at Clonmel but he'll need to and both his wins have been over fences; rated much lower over hurdles for a reason.

runners.comment: Mostly well beaten in all races and that includes his handicap debut when sent to Taunton
runners.name: Something Simple
runners.owner: Something Simple Syndicate/J C Hurley Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Something Simple Syndicate/J C Hurley Et Al

runners.spotlight: Mostly well beaten in all his races and that includes his handicap debut when sent to Taunton (3m, good to firm); only previous run on slow ground was a good one on his bumper debut.

runners.comment: Weak form in maidens and again on handicap debut (2m4f) when unfancied at 40-1
runners.name: Clever Court
runners.spotlight: Weak form in maidens and again on handicap debut (2m4f) when unfancied at 40-1.

runners.comment: Has shown no worthwhile form in her maidens so lots to prove on this handicap debut
runners.name: Annie Button
runners.spotlight: Has shown no worthwhile form in her maidens so lots to prove on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Tailed off and pulled up in her two handicaps, on heavy over 2m5f/3m; hard to make a case
runners.name: Fortunate Outcome
runners.spotlight: Tailed off and pulled up in her two handicaps, on heavy over 2m5f and 3m; hard to make a case.

runners.comment: Exposed 18-race maiden over hurdles who was behind Wakey Wakey Man at Clonmel
runners.name: Winter Carnival
runners.spotlight: Exposed 18-race maiden over hurdles who was behind Wakey Wakey Man at Clonmel.

runners.comment: Has struggled over fences since winning at Tramore in August; 0-29 over hurdles
runners.name: Likable Chancer
runners.spotlight: Has struggled over fences since winning at Tramore in August and he's a 29-race maiden over hurdles.

runners.comment: First reserve; won a point last month but offered nothing back hurdling at Cork (2m4f)
runners.name: Connemara Shore
runners.spotlight: First reserve; won a point last month but offered nothing back hurdling at Cork (2m4f).

runners.comment: Second reserve; back to form when finishing strongly for fourth at Cork (2m4f)
runners.name: Dalmatic
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; back to form when finishing strongly for fourth at Cork (2m4f, soft to heavy); that was in first-time cheekpieces and now goes in blinkers; could feature if getting in.

runners.comment: Third reserve; has fared best in bumpers; finished a long way behind in two handicaps
runners.name: Ardera Gun
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; has fared best in bumpers; finished a long way behind in two handicaps.

runners.comment: Nice introduction over hurdles at Listowel and placed in bumpers at Galway and Naas
runners.name: Burning Ability
runners.spotlight: Nice introduction over hurdles at Listowel and placed in bumpers at Galway and Naas; unlikely to be far away.

runners.comment: Point winner in April for Colin Bowe; nice pedigree and makes obvious appeal for top yard.
runners.name: Detroit Maverick
runners.spotlight: Flemensfirth 5yo cost 48,000euros as a foal and 82,000euros as a 3yo; dam maiden half-sister to 2m3f/2m5f hurdle winner Last Of The Bunch (dam of Champion Bumper winner Relegate), family of smart staying jumper Better Times Ahead; successful at third attempt in point-to-points for Colin Bowe in Ballyknock maiden in April (good-to-yielding); obvious appeal from top yard.

stable_tour.quote: He won a point for Colin Bowe and worked nicely last week at Navan. He's got ability. We'll try to find a bumper for him soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Brother to point winner Fortunes Hill out of a bumper winner; second runner for Elliott
runners.name: Haveanothertry
runners.spotlight: Brother to point winner Fortunes Hill; dam bumper winner, half-sister to bumper/useful 2m-2m1f hurdle winner Santia and useful 7f-1m2f winner Port Moresby; second runner for Elliott.

runners.comment: Bought for small money as a yearling; dam modest maiden, out of 7f/1m2f winner
runners.name: Home By The Sea
runners.spotlight: Bought for small money as a yearling; fifth foal; dam maiden from 5f-1m1f (RPR 48), out of 7f/1m2f winner.

runners.comment: Well bred but big price and beaten a long way on last month's debut at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Line Speed
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winners inc Toe The Line (bumper, 1m4f-2m Flat inc Listed, RPR 106; 2m hurdle), Line Out (2m Flat, 92; useful 2m-2m7f hurdle/chase) and Calagogo (2m4f-2m7f hurdle); dam 1m4f Flat winner (56)/placed 2m hurdles; big price and well beaten on last month's debut at Fairyhouse.

runners.comment: Muhtathir gelding is half-brother to yard's bumper/useful 2m hurdle winner Sortudo
runners.name: Looking For Eight
runners.spotlight: Muhtathir gelding is half-brother to bumper/useful 2m hurdle winner Sortudo; dam unraced half-sister to winners Monsieur Arkadin (3m1f hurdle), Quaker (French 2m1f hurdle) and Montmartoise (French 2m1f hurdle), out of French 2m2f/2m3f Listed hurdle/chase winner.

runners.comment: Half-brother to point winner Snow Punt; grandam is tough 2m-3m1f chase winner Propunt
runners.name: Puntabeg Lad
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to point winner Snow Punt; dam point winner/no form under rules, half-sister to 2m2f chase winner Tareis An Phunt, out of tough 2m-3m1f chase winner Propunt.

runners.comment: Two good runs at Punchestown; beaten only 1/2l by previous bumper winner Ballyfad latest
runners.name: Rojuco Mac
runners.spotlight: Two good runs in Punchestown bumpers on testing ground; third on debut in February; beaten only 1/2l by previous bumper winner Ballyfad who impressed over hurdles at Leopardstown this week; third and fourth have run reasonably well since; step up in trip likely to suit.

runners.comment: Brother to bumper/hurdle winner Feddans; family of smart 2m chaser Ashley Brook
runners.name: Tazman Dan
runners.spotlight: Homebred is brother to bumper/2m3f hurdle winner Feddans; dam placed in bumpers, half-sister to point winner Money Point, out of 1m6f/2m winning half-sister to dam of high-class 2m chaser Ashley Brook.

runners.comment: Mahler gelding won a three-runner soft-ground point almost two years ago; rules debut
runners.name: Timesareachanging
runners.owner: Times Are A Changing Racing Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Mahler gelding is closely related to 2m1f-3m2f hurdle winner Major Fortune; dam unraced half-sister to winners Festive Affair (useful 2m chase) and Aint Dunne Yet (2m hurdle/2m5f chase); won a three-runner soft-ground point almost two years ago; rules debut.

12:05.race_name: Coors, Refreshing, Crisp Lager Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Bangor winner; needs more here under a penalty but he's going the right way
runners.name: Orderoftheday
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who was second in his two bumpers; odds-on when a workmanlike winner at Bangor (2m novice, soft); will need more here to defy a penalty but he's going the right way.

runners.breeder: S D Knipe And S Davies
runners.comment: French maiden who was well beaten on stable debut in a 2m4f maiden at Ffos Las
runners.name: Bardenas
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability on debut in a French hurdle but was comfortably held in three chases there and again on stable debut in a 2m4f maiden at Ffos Las.

runners.comment: 300-1 when pulled up in a good maiden hurdle at Warwick; now has tongue tied
runners.name: Geordie Bay
runners.spotlight: 300-1 when pulled up in a good maiden hurdle at Warwick; now has tongue tied.

runners.comment: No worthwhile form in his first three races and readily opposed
runners.name: Ifan Full Pelt
runners.spotlight: No worthwhile form in his first three races and readily opposed.

runners.breeder: M Jean-Charles Haimet & M Olivier Tricot
runners.comment: Also hooded for Lingfield debut and showed precious little
runners.name: Out Of It
runners.owner: Mrs C S Wilson And Miss C Lees-Jones
runners.spotlight: Also hooded for Lingfield debut and showed precious little.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Fontwell bumper winner and ran to a fair level there on his hurdling debut in November
runners.name: Roi Du Risk
runners.spotlight: Fontwell bumper winner (soft) and ran to a fair level there on his hurdling debut in November; that form sets the standard.

runners.comment: Lightly raced on the Flat this year and hasn't been running well
runners.name: Three Dons
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner on the Flat and stayed 1m6f; however, lightly raced this year and hasn't been running well.

stable_tour.quote: He's been in great form, having won his last three races, going up from 46 to 61 in the ratings. He's entered in the 1m2f handicap at Brighton on Wednesday, and won over two furlongs further at the track last time. However, he is ground dependent - he'd like nice going and if it got very quick there we might have to think about whether he runs or not. He's a lovely horse. 07-08-24

12:37.race_name: Alpacalypse Session IPA Novices' Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Dual point winner; 0-4 over fences for previous yard but this 7yo retains potential
runners.name: Ballymackie
runners.spotlight: Bought for £160,000 after winning two Irish points; went 0-4 over fences for Laura Morgan but ran against some smart horses and he's better than he showed on handicap debut when last seen a year ago; retains potential now with Olly Murphy (same owners).

runners.comment: Showed nothing over hurdles but could be a better chaser given old Irish exploits
runners.name: Pulse Of Camelot
runners.spotlight: Placed in points and third in hunter chase at Clonmel (2m5f, heavy) when based in Ireland; showed nothing over hurdles but could be a better chaser; handicap debut.

runners.comment: No wins in 11 but ran well behind an improver at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft)
runners.name: Dj Pete
runners.spotlight: No wins in 11 but ran well behind an improver at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) and won't be far away with a repeat of that.

runners.comment: Successful chase debut and probably ran to a similar level when third at Lingfield
runners.name: Moor End
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Aj Mutch & Mrs Ej Bishop
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to win on chase debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) and probably ran to a similar level when third at Lingfield; unlikely to be far away.

runners.comment: Not overly convincing claims despite form figures and cheekpieces are added
runners.name: Kitsilano
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles in Ireland; when second at Plumpton he was hammered by the winner and he was last to finish back there two weeks ago; not overly convincing claims and cheekpieces are added.

runners.comment: First run since May when runner-up to the favourite at Market Rasen
runners.name: Kapamazov
runners.spotlight: First run since May when runner-up to the favourite at Market Rasen (2m5f, good to soft) and he was clear of the rest; the return of cheekpieces is no bad thing.

runners.comment: Became disappointing for Donald McCain but went on to win three points
runners.name: Ffree Pedro
runners.spotlight: Became disappointing for Donald McCain but went on to win three points for Bradley Gibbs; off since June 2024 so others are safer.

runners.comment: Well beaten on both outings this season and now 0-9 over fences
runners.name: Great Ballinboris
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Carlisle in April but well beaten on both outings this season and now 0-9 over fences.

13:12.race_name: Carling The UK's Number One Lager Selling Hurdle

runners.comment: Won two soft-ground handicaps last winter and he's a standout at these terms
runners.name: Casa Loupi

quotes.race: Racegoers Club, British Horseracings Fan Club Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Casa Loupi was entitled to win like that but I'm glad for the horse he's got his win - Jamie Moore, rider.

runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Class 3 handicap at Windsor a month ago after 212 days away but he won two soft-ground handicaps last winter and he's a standout at these terms; the tongue-tie is new.

runners.comment: Performed quite well on occasions this year and should be a player at this level
runners.name: Gavin
runners.spotlight: Below best the last twice but has performed quite well on occasions this year and should be a player at this level; entered at Chepstow on Saturday (12.30).

runners.comment: Disappointing debut for this yard in a Taunton handicap after 200 days off
runners.name: Bigz Belief

quotes.race: Knocknarea Opportunity Claiming Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief seems to enjoy it out in front and letting him dictate. He jumped brilliant and galloped all the way to the line - James Smith, rider

quotes.race: Join The Business Club At Naas Racecourse Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief toughed it out well when they came to him. I expected him to run well. He came on from his last start when running a cracker at Punchestown. Sam said that when he went into pop hurdles he made mistakes, when he saw a horse he needed to make his mind up for him, and I thought when they came to him he'd be caught. Thankfully he pulled it out all the way to the line. We'll look for something similar next - Matthew Smith, trainer

quotes.race: Racing Again On 27th May Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief did it well and got a lovely run around, I was able to control it wherever I went. When I got stuck into him up the straight he picked up well. The ground was a little worry as I thought he might have needed a cut, but he was fourth in his maiden on good ground. He won over two miles on heavy ground over hurdles and seems top enjoy it out in front - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief got a grand ride, I told him to go out in front. We were a bit worried about the ground. His jumping was a lot better today - Matt Smith, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Had a lot of racing under both codes; twice runner-up over hurdles in Jersey earlier this year; disappointing debut for this yard in a Taunton handicap after 200 days off so hard to know what to expect.

runners.breeder: P De Maleissye Melun & T Amos
runners.comment: In fair form in points earlier this year and returns to rules action at a realistic level
runners.name: Carpe Diem
runners.spotlight: In fair form in points earlier this year and returns to rules action at a realistic level; others are still preferred.

runners.comment: 0-4 for this yard, last time beaten about 12l in a C&D handicap
runners.name: Upthereforthinking
runners.spotlight: Failed to win for Gavin Cromwell and 0-4 for this yard, last time beaten about 12l in a C&D handicap; should be competitive in this bad a race.

runners.comment: Won an Irish point; second in a Fontwell bumper when last seen in September 2024
runners.name: Borna Gem
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point in early 2024 and was second in a Fontwell bumper when last seen the following September; goes straight into a seller for hurdling debut after a lengthy absence; market helpful.

runners.comment: Latest fourth in a Catterick handicap was remote and she's looking regressive
runners.name: Dance In The Park

prev_owners.owner: H J Jarvis & Mrs P Jarvis

runners.spotlight: Latest fourth in a Catterick handicap was remote and she's looking regressive; these terms aren't easy.

runners.comment: Doesn't look on that good a mark unless able to improve for fences, which is feasible
runners.name: Sun Art
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field novice hurdle at Ludlow in March but comfortably beaten in two runs when penalised; doesn't look on that good a mark unless able to improve for fences, which is feasible.

runners.comment: Pulled up on either side of his October win and he's very in and out
runners.name: Moodofthemoment

quotes.race: Sunshine Radio Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was probably a career-best performance from Moodofthemoment. Stan is very strong from the last to the line - there aren't many people who beat Sam Twiston-Davies. We picked him up for 5,500GBP and that's my baseline sort of market. I've only got about 12 in, so to have had five winners this season is pretty good - Matt Sheppard, trainer.

runners.spotlight: His fourth chase win when prevailing in a smal field at Newcastle (2m4f, good) but pulled up on either side of that and he's very in and out.

stable_tour.quote: He's going to Taunton on Thursday for a 0-120 novice handicap chase. He's been very consistent, winning his last two races, and finishing second the three times before that. Although he's gone up to 106 from a mark of 92 in August, he's definitely got more improvement in him. He's been an absolute bargain. He came out of Ireland with a big reputation - I know David Pipe thought a bit of him, but he didn't cut the mustard there - and I'm excited that he's still unexposed. I'm stepping him up in trip to 2m7f on Thursday because it's an ideal race for him. I'm not sure if he's a true three-miler but he might be okay on a sharp track. I think he'll go on any ground. 28-11-24

runners.breeder: A Blin, Mme A Blin, Et Al
runners.comment: Second at Sedgefield before a remote finish at Aintree; doesn't arrive here in flying form
runners.name: Flamelco
runners.spotlight: Exposed three-time chase winner; only three ran when second at Sedgefield before a remote finish at Aintree, so doesn't arrive here in flying form.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner; this ground will be more favourable than at Plumpton last time
runners.name: Jackpot Cash
runners.spotlight: Four wins split between hurdles and fences; last success was in this discipline but in a match at Sedgefield (2m5f, good) in May; has to get himself back on track, though this ground will be more favourable than at Plumpton last time.

stable_tour.quote: He's won two over fences and two over hurdles since joining us in January. He'd just begun to make some headway when unseating Sean Bowen on his comeback at Huntingdon and, while he's a bit of a handful, I think he's still on the up. He's bred to want soft ground and there should be more to come. 24-10-25

runners.comment: Would have won at Bangor had he not fallen; failed to back that up at Warwick
runners.name: Rodney
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over hurdles for Kerry Lee towards end of last season and looked set to make winning chase debut before last-fence fall at Bangor (2m1f, good) in October; wasn't in the same form at Warwick (after 5lb rise) and confidence could have been an issue.

stable_tour.quote: This is a horse we really like and you haven't seen the best of him yet. He definitely has a future and you could see him out in a bumper over Christmas. 27-11-23

runners.comment: Made it 6-14 over fences when making all at Wetherby; bled last time
runners.name: Pep Talking

quotes.race: Position Payout At bet365 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pep Talking is absolutely amazing, he loves good ground. He bounced off it in front - Billy Aprahamian, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Southwell Golf Club Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Pep Talking has been a fantastic horse for us and has become a bit of a handicapper's nightmare as he only just does enough. He loves his jumping and hopefully has more to come next season. That will be him for this campaign - Billy Aprahamian, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made it 6-14 over fences when making all at Wetherby (2m3f) and reported to have bled from the nose last time; seems to need good ground.

runners.breeder: J R Lavelle & Dr Mark Scott
runners.comment: Still a maiden but consistent and has performed well in both his chases
runners.name: Two To Tango

prev_owners.owner: J R Lavelle And Paul G Jacobs

runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but consistent and has performed well in both his chases, last time beaten by the favourite here; looks a matter of time before he gets his head in front.

stable_tour.quote: Showed plenty in his bumpers last season but just struggled to get to the line. He's done some very good bits of work and I think he could win a novice hurdle. He'll start over two miles but will get two and a half in time. 22-11-23

How frustrating is he? He's been placed nine times in only 13 runs, but I was delighted with his jumping when he schooled over fences the other day. That's the route we're going and there are handicaps for him at Taunton and Wincanon, both places where you get better ground. He runs his best races when he carries condition - when he looks ready to rock and roll he may be over the top. 05-11-25

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Grand Courgeon
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but often placed and has had wind surgery ahead of this chase debut
runners.name: Plantaroma
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but often placed and has had wind surgery ahead of this chase debut; not on too bad a mark.

14:22.race_name: Rekorderlig Premium Swedish Cider Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Denki
runners.comment: Second run for this yard when winning by 10l at Lingfield; escapes a penalty
runners.name: Jhentong Enki
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; ran below market expectations on stable debut but put that right last week with a comfortable 10l success at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) for which he has no penalty; his claims are clear.

runners.comment: Only his second run in a handicap when runner-up over shorter here four weeks ago
runners.name: Dinofromberlais
runners.spotlight: Picked up a weak maiden at Fakenham; only his second run in a handicap when runner-up over 1m7f here four weeks ago (soft; keeping on); 2lb higher and has races in him off this mark.

runners.comment: Uttoxeter winner in February but he's been well below that level both starts since
runners.name: Tarbuck
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at Uttoxeter (2m4f) in February but he's been well below that level both starts since, coming in last of nine at Wetherby (2m4f) on his return; he has something to prove now.

runners.comment: Well beaten by Stamina Chope here last time but she has an appealing pull in the weights
runners.name: Smile Back
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner in 2024; runner-up on handicap debut over C&D but was no match for Stamina Chope; has an appealing pull in the weights on the winner and that should make it interesting.

runners.comment: Only 1-11 over hurdles and was pulled up at Ffos Las after a lengthy break
runners.name: Walkinthecotswolds
runners.spotlight: Won from the front at Chepstow (2m3f, heavy; first run after wind surgery) in January; fell over fences in February and not seen again until pulled up back hurdling at Ffos Las in November.

runners.comment: Raised 7lb for recent easy win here and they also claimed 5lb; still respected
runners.name: Olivia Kate
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late David M Richards
runners.spotlight: Did it comfortably over 1m7f here (soft) this month but she's gone up 7lb and they also claimed 5lb last time, so these terms are appreciably tougher; still respected.

stable_tour.quote: I know she was beaten quite a long way but she finally put in a good run when fifth of 17 at Chepstow the run before last. Three miles was probably plenty far enough for her, so we dropped her to Ludlow in a mares-only race over 2m5f on Monday and she duly won by 18 lengths. 28-11-24

runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who was pulled up on his handicap debut at Exeter when an 18-1 chance
runners.name: Pougie
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who was pulled up on his handicap debut at Exeter when an 18-1 chance (first-time cheekpieces); questions to answer.

runners.comment: Second at Bangor last month and the following day she went one better over C&D; up 8lb
runners.name: Stamina Chope

prev_owners.owner: Mr Paul L Drinkwater/Dr R D P Newland

runners.spotlight: Second at Bangor last month and the following day she went one better over C&D (soft); that was by over 4l and she's now 8lb higher, but in the mix.

runners.comment: Best run was in a bumper and he's struggled to find a foothold over hurdles
runners.name: Strong As Steel
runners.spotlight: Best run was in a bumper and he's struggled to find a foothold over hurdles; beaten 17l on yard debut at Doncaster.

runners.comment: Twice disappointing since her successful stable debut in September; had wind operation
runners.name: Ruler Of The River
runners.spotlight: Twice disappointing since her successful stable debut at Plumpton in September (2m4f, good) but she could turn things around after a wind operation.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: She's been a consistent filly for us and has placed three times over hurdles. Jonathan: She was in the process of running her best race for us until she made a mistake at the last in a Listed fillies' hurdle at Doncaster and I hope she'll pick up a juvenile maiden. She should run well through the summer, and could go back on the Flat too. 08-02-24

14:57.race_name: Aspall Cyder Leicestershire Silver Fox Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Ground was perhaps too soft last time but others might be better handicapped
runners.name: Hecouldbetheone
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner who is 2-7 over fences; probably found the ground too soft last time but others might be better handicapped.

runners.breeder: Dr V Bernard Stoffel & Mr Vincent Leroy
runners.comment: Impressed on chase/handicap debut at Southwell; might well cope with the 8lb rise
runners.name: The Bluesman
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper and a maiden hurdle for Paul Nicholls; did it easily on chase/handicap debut (also new tongue-tie) at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) to earn this 8lb higher mark which might not be beyond him.

stable_tour.quote: He's one I like. A gorgeous individual with bags of scope, he's done well physically over the summer and I hope he'll step up markedly on his bumper form now he goes over hurdles. He'd run green on his debut for us, then won easily at Chepstow despite being a bit of a boy beforehand. He's ready to roll and could end up one of our better novices. 04-11-24

runners.comment: Five-time winner in France; beaten 16l and 12l in his two runs for this yard
runners.name: Miralago
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner in France; beaten 16l and 12l in his two runs for this yard, latterly over too short a trip (2m); others appeal more.

runners.breeder: O Triboire & S C E A Ecurie Des Jap
runners.comment: Rated way higher back in the day but made a quiet stable debut after 277 days away
runners.name: Stratagem

quotes.race: Lloyds Animal Feeds Open Hunters' Chase (For The Ludlow Gold Cup)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse, a proper horse. I couldn't understand it when Stratagem pulled up at Hereford, he didn't jump or travel. He beat Solo at Auteuil and goes well at home. That was more like it today - David Maxwell, jockey.

quotes.race: Terry Frame Joiners Juvenile Hurdle (Northern Lights Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Stratagem probably needed the race first time and he made a bit of a noise so he'll probably need a wind operation in the summer. This is probably a very nice horse, we may put him away and he'll go chasing next season - owner/jockey David Maxwell.

runners.spotlight: Rated way higher back in the day but made a quiet stable debut after 277 days away; this is no easy race in which to bounce back.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he'd put up a big performance at Cheltenham in October but he was run off his feet. He's only a four-year-old but I think he's now ready for fences, so he's due to run in a novice chase over 2m3f or 2m4f. I'm sure he's a nice horse. 16-11-20

runners.comment: Warwick winner last December but under a 7lb claimer and he's 12lb higher now
runners.name: Noche Negra

quotes.race: Every Race Live On RacingTV Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Turning into the straight, I just wanted to fill Noche Negra up as I thought the two front-runners would come back to me. I wanted to have one late lunge on the other horse because my horse doesn't do a lot in front. I think we got the trip slightly wrong last time over three miles because he wants two and a half miles, and on good ground he'd be a different beast again - Lewis Dobb, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won twice for previous yard before losing his way; off since last New Year's Eve when comfortably making a winning debut for current stable at Warwick (2m4f, soft); that was under a 7lb claimer and he's 12lb higher, so will need to be firing on all cylinders.

runners.comment: Won over fences in France but beaten big distances in two handicaps for this yard
runners.name: Lylian
runners.owner: T Jacobs And Mrs E Avery
runners.spotlight: Won over fences in France but beaten big distances in two handicaps for this yard; best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: Already a winner this season over fences in France and he'll stay over fences as a novice this term. He's been working and schooling nicely and could start off at Ascot on Saturday. We're still learning about him but he looks like he might prefer the better ground. 28-10-25

runners.comment: Runner-up in two of his three chases, last time here left behind by the winner
runners.name: Moonshine Man
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler off 4lb lower; runner-up in two of his three chases, last time here left behind by the winner; might be vulnerable.

runners.comment: Very nearly 4-4 for this yard and the front two were clear when he won at Hexham
runners.name: Heeztheboy

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.spotlight: Very nearly 4-4 for this yard and the front two were clear when he won at Hexham (2m4f, heavy); has a bit to prove under drier conditions (has won on good to soft) but he's on a roll; 7lb higher than last time.

15:32.race_name: Salt Jute IPA Leicestershire Bronze Fox Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Qualifier)

runners.comment: Made it 2-2 over hurdles when beating Boxing Day Kempton winner Klub De Reve this month
runners.name: Gentleman Toboot

quotes.race: JCB Fastrac British Stallion Studs EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gentleman Toboot will have to go up in class now with the penalties mounting up, but We've always thought a bit of him and he'll make a smashing chaser one day. He'll be kept at 2m for the time being and to galloping tracks. David Pipe, trainer talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: South West Rail Solutions Ltd. Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely performance. We've got to sharpen up Gentleman Toboot's jumping a bit but it was a good performance first time out. He's strengthened up from last year and he'll be better again next year. Newton Abbot was tight enough for him, but everyone's going somewhere where you've got some half-decent ground at the moment as the weather's not playing ball - David Pipe, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner who made it 2-2 over hurdles when beating Boxing Day Kempton winner Klub De Reve under a penalty at Exeter (2m, good to soft); makes handicap debut in a race lacking depth; good chance.

runners.comment: Won at Aintree two years ago off 5lb higher (2m4f, soft) and now in a new yard
runners.name: Bingoo

prev_owners.owner: Kevin & Anne Glastonbury And Neil Bibby
Kevin & Anne Glastonbury And Neil Bibby

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Bingoo would improve for the step up in trip. He runs well fresh and this was his Derby. He wants some cut in the ground to be at his best - Jimmy Moffatt, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Bingoo isn't the fastest horse in the world and he stays two and a half miles, and Charlotte [Jones, jockey] was flat out. He probably needs more schooling and it was probably two weeks early today. He's got a bit of jumping to brush up on - James Moffatt, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won at Aintree two years ago off 5lb higher (2m4f, soft) so could be interesting if new trainer can revive his fortunes.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a revelation for his owner-breeders Kevin and Anne Glastonbury, winning four of his six runs over hurdles and landing a decent handicap at Aintree on Boxing Day. He's versatile tripwise, he's so genuine and he's improving. We're likely to enter him at the Cheltenham Festival. I'd like to see him in the Coral Cup but he might not get in, and there's also the Martin Pipe. The day after the festival there's a £100,000 race at Uttoxeter we wouldn't mind having a crack at either. I'd like to see him carrying a low weight as he's not the biggest. We'll keep his options open but soft ground is a must and we'll be influenced by that. After one of those races, he's likely to go on to Aintree. 14-02-24

runners.comment: Progressive handicapper with a good strike-rate and was a rallying second at Wetherby
runners.name: Double Oban

quotes.race: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Double Oban got a bad bump and it cost him winning. The best horse won. He wants to go up in trip - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Leicester City FC EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Double Oban is a big horse and he will be able to step up a furlong or two in time. He has a very relaxed way of going but he was very tough when the runner-up came to him - Ross Coakley, rider.

runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper with a good strike-rate and was a rallying second at Wetherby (2m, soft; new cheekpieces); raised another 3lb for that but looks sure to go well.

runners.comment: Back hurdling after a lengthy break at Wetherby and was well behind Double Oban
runners.name: Justus

prev_owners.owner: Lnj Foxwoods, Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier

quotes.race: Jamaican Flight Handicap (Round 1 Of The Pontefract Stayers' Championship 2024)
quotes.quote: Staying won the day and this ground is the key to him. Justus did well over hurdles and he stayed on well after getting outpaced here -  Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has won four times on the Flat and a small-field novice hurdle nearly two years ago; back hurdling after a lengthy break at Wetherby and was well behind Double Oban; tongue-tie joins regular cheekpieces.

13:00.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: One to keep an eye on but maybe once handicapping after today; market useful
runners.name: Fight Your Corner
runners.spotlight: Trainer always respected here; this gelding has shown enough in two starts (neither race run to suit; raced off a steady pace first time, pulled hard latest) to suggest he's one to keep an eye on but maybe once handicapping after today; market useful.

runners.comment: Turned over on 13 occasions already this year, 11 times at 5-1 or shorter; fully exposed
runners.name: Forest Caper
runners.spotlight: Turned over on 13 occasions this year, 11 times at 5-1 or shorter, including behind Cerelia at Newcastle; again ran below par on his first crack at sprinting nine days ago and it wouldn't say much for the rest were he able to take this.

runners.comment: Entitled to need this and would want to see good support before considering him
runners.name: Cy Twombly
runners.spotlight: Went backwards for the Crisford yard in three runs as a 2yo before being sold last March for 4,800gns; has since been gelded and undergone wind surgery; entitled to need this and would want to see good support before considering him.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs for Sir Mark Prescott as a 2yo; handicaps over further maybe next
runners.name: Hobgoblin
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs for Sir Mark Prescott as a juvenile and hasn't been seen in well over a year; may come into his own once handicapping over further.

runners.comment: Clear second to his main market rival over C&D latest; open to further improvement
runners.name: Nicator
runners.spotlight: Bit of promise at a big price in a warm Doncaster novice in the summer and started much shorter over C&D a month ago back from a break; finished a clear second to his main market rival that day and remains open to further improvement.

runners.comment: More on turf latest (first-time cheekpieces; off here); that boosted by the winner since
runners.name: Pulsar Star
runners.spotlight: Nothing went right from a wide stall on his Polytrack debut for James Tate in late summer and fared much better on turf latest (first-time cheekpieces; off here); that's been boosted by the winner taking a handicap since; needs more again for his new yard (changed hands for 15,000gns).

runners.breeder: B & A Kennedy & Irish National Stud
runners.comment: Not seen (been gelded) since well beaten in one run for Craig Lidster well over a year ago
runners.name: Teggy Lasso
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Wendy Oleary
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winners out of a 1m4f French AW winner; went for £50,000 at the spring breeze-ups as a 2yo; not seen (been gelded) since well beaten in one run for Craig Lidster well over a year ago.

runners.comment: Not seen it out in one bumper and two Tapeta runs over further; hard to recommend
runners.name: Your Babys Eyes
runners.spotlight: Not seen it out in one bumper and two Tapeta runs over further; drops back from 1m4f today and will need to improve dramatically for the different test.

runners.comment: 410,000euros yearling; solid debut when clear second over 7f at Newcastle; leading claims
runners.name: Cerelia
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 7.5f winner in France, herself from a good family; made a solid debut when a clear second over 7f at Newcastle this month (Forest Caper well held in third) and holds obvious claims.

runners.comment: Started 66-1 for her recent debut; needs a big chunk of improvement if she's to win this
runners.name: Machali
runners.spotlight: Started 66-1 for her recent Chelmsford debut, when inclined to pull hard after getting squeezed out early; finished a long way back and will need a big chunk of improvement to win this.

13:35.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Five-time course winner; might just need this at his age after five months off
runners.name: Eligible

quotes.race: Yorkshire Equine Practice Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a great ride.The instructions were to drop Eligible in and fill him with confidence, he loves passing horses - David Easterby, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner, four at this time of year, who goes well for Joanna Mason and is often found plying his trade in better company; plenty in his favour but might just need this at his age after five months off (wins all came after a recent run).

runners.comment: Progressive in Kempton 7f handicaps since having wind surgery; open to more improvement
runners.name: Im Workin On It
runners.spotlight: Progressive in Kempton 7f handicaps since undergoing wind surgery; was 11-4 for a similar race prior to getting upset at the stalls and being withdrawn there this month (1m); remains open to further improvement on his Tapeta debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely, big horse with a bright future. He was a big, backward two-year-old last year, when he had three runs. When he came back in the spring, he'd grown into a really nice horse, but unfortunately he was making a hell of a noise. I've had very few horses with wind operations since I've been training but he's one and it's been a great success as he won his first race back, before finishing fourth at Kempton last week, when he was restless in the stalls and had to be steadied before making late progress. He's potentially nicely handicapped and is my dark horse. 27-08-25

runners.comment: Sold for 30,000gns in July; interesting to see how he goes in the market on Tapeta debut
runners.name: Ashen
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for Marcus Tregoning (6f-1m), latterly in two forms of headgear, prior to being sold for 30,000gns in July; interesting to see how he goes in the market on his Tapeta debut back from six months off.

runners.comment: Solid effort over 6f here a month ago and won't mind going back up in trip; each-way shout
runners.name: Ziggys Angel
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning off 4lb lower on his handicap debut at Newcastle in September; solid effort over 6f here a month ago and won't mind going back up in trip, so holds each-way claims.

runners.comment: Beaten at 5-1 or shorter on nine occasions but no obvious reason he won't give his running
runners.name: King David
runners.spotlight: Very consistent, including in two runs for his new yard, but has won only once and been turned over at 5-1 or shorter on nine occasions; no obvious reason he won't give his running once more, in cheekpieces for a third time, though.

runners.comment: Inconsistent of late; fine on Polytrack, so recent Lingfield effort will need overlooking
runners.name: Enpassant
runners.spotlight: Knows how to win but there's not much margin for error off this mark and he's proved inconsistent of late; fine on Polytrack, so his recent Lingfield effort will need overlooking.

runners.comment: Boasts a nose second and a win (off 3lb lower) in two runs over C&D this year; player
runners.name: Onemorenomore

quotes.race: Thank You To Doncaster Annual Members Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Onemorenomore is a jockey's dream, he's very straightforward - just switch him off early and try not to get there too soon - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought Onemorenomore was too far back, I thought he was never going to get there. But he did exactly the same thing here last year, just getting there on the nod in the last 20 yards. He's that type of horse, we ride him behind at home and he always finishes off his gallops. The way he ran, he'll probably get a mile. He's declared for Southwell on Sunday and there's no reason why he shouldn't run. He takes his galloping well, he's a nice big horse -  Philip McBride, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Boasts a nose second (off 5lb higher) and a win (off 3lb lower) in two runs over C&D this year; the return here can only look in his favour and he's on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Goes well round here and there was nothing wrong with his latest third; considered
runners.name: Wilde And Dandy

prev_owners.owner: D Fravigar, S Jones And Partner

runners.spotlight: Goes well round here and there was nothing wrong with his latest Newcastle third off today's mark, which came in a race that didn't set up ideally; holds decent claims.

runners.comment: Blinkers did the job latest (C&D); whether he repeats the dose off 6lb higher the question
runners.name: A Pint Of Bear
runners.owner: Homecroft Wealth, Paul J Dixon & Partners

quotes.race: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: A Pint Of Bear is not the world's best racehorse, but he wants to be a racehorse. He loves it, and he tries his heart out. If he's ever in a position where he's telling us he's had enough we'll call it quits, but it was nice to see him win. Some horses know they've won more than others, and he looked as pleased as punch with himself in the winner's enclosure. My four-year-old daughter was with me a few days ago feeding him carrots, and I was telling her how he's one of my favourites - Scott Dixon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Lacks consistency now; first-time blinkers did the job when he popped up for Simon Walker in an amateurs' handicap over C&D ten days ago but whether he repeats the dose off a 6lb higher mark is the question.

14:10.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Likely there's better to come and he has strong claims now handicapping back up in trip
runners.name: Lake Como

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg & Mrs Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith

runners.spotlight: Better with each run for this yard, having made his debut for Aidan O'Brien, and he won with a good bit in hand in a 7f novice at Newcastle last time; it's likely there's more to come from him and he has strong claims now handicapping back up in trip (pedigree a mix of stamina and speed).

runners.comment: Done well since gelded; a 7lb higher mark demands more but he remains unexposed
runners.name: Raging Raj
runners.spotlight: Has done well since gelded and switched to nurseries, overcoming trouble at Kempton before winning with something in hand down to 7f here a month ago; a 7lb higher mark demands more but he remains unexposed.

runners.comment: Couple of fair efforts since gelded and fitted with headgear; starting to look exposed now
runners.name: Phantom Watch
runners.spotlight: Couple of fair efforts since gelded and fitted with headgear, and had no problem with the extended 1m at Wolverhampton last time; starting to look exposed now, however, and needs to find more.

runners.comment: String of consistent efforts in the blinkers; will need a career-best effort to take this
runners.name: Emmas Letter

quotes.race: British EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB/GBBPlus Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Emma's Letter was reluctant to go into the stalls, and she didn't show anything the first time [at Wolverhampton] when she bucked coming out of them. We put some blinkers on her and I think all credit goes to Jack for getting hold of her. In another stride or two, she probably would have won. She's shown a lot more this time, which is good-  Ed Dunlop, trainer.

runners.spotlight: String of consistent efforts in the blinkers and may have bumped into one when a clear second over C&D nine days ago; she's been nudged up 3lb, though, and will need a career-best effort against a couple of progressive rivals.

14:45.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well backed and coming away with one other last time; may well improve further
runners.name: Bowfell
runners.spotlight: Gelded after one run in the spring and fared much better at Newcastle this month, when well backed and coming away with Cerelia (due to run in the 1.00); needs more under a penalty but remains lightly raced and could well be up to it.

runners.comment: Regressive, ex-Irish maiden who's been beaten very often at short prices; has the ability
runners.name: Hostility

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Bstock Ltd/D Howden/China Horse Club/Ballylinch Stud

runners.spotlight: Regressive, ex-Irish maiden who's been beaten at 2-1 or shorter on eight of his last nine starts; has the ability and it will be interesting to see how he goes in the market against Thequietman for his much in-form yard.

runners.comment: Withdrawn from his intended debut a fortnight ago; this looks potentially a bit stronger
runners.name: Splinterwood
runners.spotlight: Third foal of a 5f winner, herself from a useful sprinting family; spread a plate and was withdrawn from his intended debut at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago (the maiden for which Hostility started a short price); this looks potentially a bit stronger.

runners.comment: Short prices a few times for Joseph O'Brien as a 2yo; claims on the pick of his Irish work
runners.name: Thequietman
runners.spotlight: Started short prices a few times for Joseph O'Brien as a 2yo, when having excuses each time, prior to being picked up at the sales for 50,000gns; not seen in well over a year but the pick of his Irish work would give him leading claims in a first-time hood.

stable_tour.quote: An expensive breeze-up horse who showed some form in Ireland without winning, including when second in a decent Leopardstown race. He has a tendency to be a bit keen, so he'll need to overcome that. We'll probably start him off over a mile on easy ground. 14-04-25

runners.comment: Some way off the front pair on her Newcastle debut but is entitled to improve; player
runners.name: All Moonshine
runners.spotlight: First foal of a half-sister to two useful winners; made a satisfactory debut at Newcastle a month ago; finished some way off the front pair that night (runner-up since below par) but is entitled to improve.

runners.comment: Went for 78,000gns as a foal but then for just 2,000gns last year; likely best watched
runners.name: Divine Wish
runners.spotlight: Daughter of a useful sprinter; went for 78,000gns as a foal but then for just 2,000gns last year; yard not noted for 3yos, especially on the AW, and she's probably best watched.

runners.comment: 23,000euros 2yo; may be best to look elsewhere unless there's good support
runners.name: Highfield Jewel
runners.spotlight: 23,000euros 2yo; dam is a half-sister to a couple of winners, including the useful Nuno Tristan; may be best to look elsewhere unless there's good support.

runners.comment: Little immediate promise when last of eight on her debut a month ago; steps up from 5f
runners.name: Natural Rhythm
runners.spotlight: Started a big price and offered little immediate promise when last of eight on her Wolverhampton debut a month ago; steps up from 5f today.

15:20.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: This is easier down another 2lb and it wouldn't be a shock were he to bounce back
runners.name: Fiscal Policy
runners.owner: S Thompson, Mrs R Carr & G Shields

prev_owners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr

runners.spotlight: Three-time Tapeta winner who's been below par in a few starts back from a short break; this is easier however, down another 2lb, and it wouldn't be a shock were he to bounce back.

stable_tour.quote: He's another to have had a winter's break and he's not quite ready to come back yet - he's about a month away. He won't find things so easy when he returns because he's only 1lb below his highest ever mark, but that's the price of success because he won two races in the autumn. He's a straightforward sprinter, though, and always gives his best. 09-04-25

runners.comment: On quite a losing run but boasts a decent record here; can't be left out of calculations
runners.name: True Promise
runners.spotlight: On quite a losing run but boasts a decent record here and has been in fair form; will need to improve on two previous efforts in cheekpieces but this mark is within range and he can't be left out of calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He was just a bit immature last year and we had to mind him a little bit. He progressed after winning on his debut at Newcastle in January and followed up under a penalty, but the handicapper hasn't missed him. He's very laid-back and not until we run him will we know if he can keep progressing off that mark, but we're hopeful he can and looking forward to getting him on turf. 04-04-24

runners.comment: C&D novice winner; beaten favourite last time and has to prove this mark within range
runners.name: Your Love
runners.spotlight: Found a weak C&D novice when off the mark early last month and was handed a 5lb rise for it; suffered interference when a beaten favourite last time (said to have not travelled thereafter) but now has to prove this mark within range.

runners.comment: Two wins in small-field turf handicaps during the summer; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Em Four

quotes.race: Tony McMullan 80th Birthday Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I dreamed about Em Four being in the winner's enclosure at Epsom but not for a 0-72 handicap on a bank holiday Monday. Right now, I'll take that. He won a very bad race at Chepstow three runs back and the handicapper gave him 8lb, which I argued about. He's come down to 72 and this was the lowest grade of race I could get him in. He's quite a handy little horse and quite well balanced, so I thought he might cope with this course. I was hopeful without having any degree of confidence - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two wins in small-field turf handicaps during the summer, latterly off a 1lb lower mark; not been at the same level since and needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Been nudged up 2lb and the first-time headgear will need to be a difference maker
runners.name: Hunky Dory
runners.spotlight: Doesn't look to do a lot wrong but remains a maiden and has been turned over as favourite on four of his last six starts; been nudged up 2lb and the first-time headgear will need to be a difference maker.

runners.comment: Heavy going may have been behind his latest showing but is some way down the pecking order
runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.spotlight: Lost his way since a Lingfield win off 4lb higher in the spring; heavy ground may have been behind his latest showing but he's some way down the pecking order.

runners.comment: Winner off 2lb lower last time; harder they go the better for him from the outside stall
runners.name: Yaaser
runners.owner: Michele Craig And David D Smith

quotes.race: Musselburgh Windsor FC Celebrating 70 Years Handicap
quotes.quote: The race didn't set up the way we thought as Joe (Fanning) got to the front and slowed up a bit but Yaaser did it well, he ran as straight as a gun-barrel up the straight. The last time here we probably played too early and we've learnt from that, the more you take him back the more he comes back on the bit. I think you could even play him later as he has a good turn of foot - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Done most of his winning over 7f, including here, and doesn't often runs in sprints; overcame being hampered early when going in off 2lb lower last time and the harder they go the better for him from the outside stall.

stable_tour.quote: He looks to be back to his best and his best is very good. He had a good year last year but not quite where we'd had him before. He looked really well in the paddock before he won and showed his wellbeing in the race. He's won some nice races. He likes a strong pace to run at over 7f and I think that's possibly his optimum, but he ran well in the Carlisle Bell over a stiff mile. We've won it before but that race is on our bucket list, but it may be a bit sharp for him at the moment. We'll have a look at York for him because he ran well there last year and a big field over 7f would suit him. 07-05-25

runners.comment: Won't mind going back up to 6f under a penalty; respected if turned out again
runners.name: El Bufalo
runners.spotlight: In good nick for his new yard, latterly when winning at Wolverhampton on Boxing day; won't mind going back up to 6f under a penalty and would have to be respected if turned out again.

runners.comment: Popped up at a big price over C&D off a 2lb lower mark last month; others stronger
runners.name: Orbital Chime
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing, Cassie And Wilson

prev_owners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott
