runners.spotlight: Popped up at a big price over C&D off a 2lb lower mark last month but has been below that level in two runs since; others make more obvious appeal.

stable_tour.quote: We got him from the online sales in February. We know the jockey PJ McDonald quite well and he's ridden him previously. He was bad debt in his last yard which is why he was for sale. It's taken us a few runs to get to know him. In his last run, at Ayr last week, he was fifth but it was a very hot race and I really think he's ready to kick on and win in his next few runs. 17-07-25

15:50.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.breeder: C&S B/S Ltd, C Younghusband, K Mcgivern
runners.comment: Weighted to his best but is ultra-consistent and will be dangerous if allowed his own way
runners.name: Sax Appeal
runners.spotlight: Six wins this year, mainly from the front, and boasts a course record reading 121823; weighted to his best now but is ultra-consistent and will be dangerous again, especially if allowed his own way.

runners.comment: Only been beyond 1m6f once and has something to prove back from an absence
runners.name: Traila
runners.owner: Katy Jane Reed And Edward J Ware
runners.spotlight: Missed a chunk of his career and hasn't been seen in five months having finished lame at Sandown in the summer; won his novice on Tapeta, so has that in his favour, but has only been beyond 1m6f once and has something to prove.

runners.comment: Couple of fair efforts from the front since returning from a break; each-way claims
runners.name: Zoran
runners.spotlight: Dual Kempton winner who's turned in a couple of fair efforts from the front since returning from a break, including over C&D last month; may not get his own way with Sax Appeal in here, though, and only holds each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: A scopey, athletic colt who did well on the Flat, improving throughout the year. We'll geld him and then get him over hurdles after Christmas. 16-11-20

He's a massive favourite because he loves going to the races, whether you put him in front of a hurdle or a fence or run him on the Flat. He gives his best every time. He's a better Flat horse than he is a jumper but as long as the ground isn't too soft, he'll still pay his way over jumps. We'll mix and match, depending on where the races are. I wouldn't be surprised if he got further than 2m4f over jumps. 29-01-25

runners.comment: Good season on turf; well beaten off his career-high mark back on Tapeta last time
runners.name: Trojan Sun

quotes.race: Catherine & Charlotte Roche Handicap
quotes.quote: It was good from Lauren [Young], who gave Trojan Sun a positive ride and just kept him going. He likes it here. He hasn't got a lot of gears and is better suited being up there in front - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Musselburgh specialist who enjoyed a good season on turf, closing out with an easy win on heavy ground; got punished for that with a 6lb rise and duly finished well beaten off his career-high mark back on Tapeta last time.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Musselburgh over 2m2f in late August and has finished third the last twice- at Chester and Ayr on Tuesday. He's probably going to have another couple of runs this autumn as he seems to handle soft ground. He's a young horse who's improving. He ran on good ground at Ayr on Tuesday and it would be good if we can get another run with him on soft ground before the end of the season. I doubt we'll run him on the all-weather this winter and we'll probably wait until next year with him. 02-10-24

runners.comment: Signs of life in three runs back from a summer break for his current yard; possibilities
runners.name: Pleasant Man

quotes.race: Follow @AtTheRaces On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Adam Kirby gave Pleasant Man a great ride and rode exactly to instructions. He is quite a lazy type and I don't think any other jockey would have won on him - Grant Pritchard-Gordon, representing owners Brook Farm Bloodstock.

runners.spotlight: Not as good as in his younger years but has shown signs of life in three runs back from a summer break for his current yard and is 3lb lower than when winning here (1m6f) in January; chance if he's on a going day.

stable_tour.quote: Formerly a good staying handicapper on the Flat, he was found to have bled when pulled up in the Adonis Hurdle at Kempton and had a breathing operation straight afterwards. He's a good horse and will leave that form well behind when resuming over hurdles in five or six weeks. 31-10-22

runners.comment: Won this last year; 11lb higher this time round and will need to get it spot on
runners.name: Dance Time

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late L R Owen

runners.spotlight: Won this last year (when it was a 0-75) and arrives in flying form again as she looks for a third course win; she's 11lb higher this time, though, having paid the price for last month's easy Wolverhampton win with a 7lb rise, so will need to get it spot on.

stable_tour.quote: She's done extremely well, putting on a serious amount of weight. I think she's put on 85kg since last season. She's a bull of a filly. How she did as well as she did at two and three is amazing really - she's a bit of an enigma. She has a super attitude. She's probably two or three weeks away from a run and I think we'll have some fun with her as she's very well-handicapped off 67. 30-05-24

runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Reproduction of his latest Kempton third would give him a chance but lacks consistency now
runners.name: Bashful Boy

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Bashful Boy showed a good turn of foot and saw out the trip well after running a cracker here last time. He was genuine and hit the line well - John Feane, trainer.

runners.spotlight: More than two years since he won a race and he lacks consistency these days, unsurprisingly given his age; he's on a fair mark now, though, and a reproduction of his latest Kempton third (Dance Time just behind) would give him every chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a good summer on the Flat and over hurdles and he ran above expectations on soft ground when fourth in the Cesarewitch. However, the ground was probably too bad for him at Cheltenham on Saturday, when he was pulled up. I'd been hoping that stepping up in trip would eke out a little more improvement and I'd like to try three miles again when we can. 31-10-23

runners.comment: Hard to get excited by his opening effort for this yard and has never been this far
runners.name: Promethean
runners.spotlight: Sole win for David Menuisier came in a French maiden in the summer and he's proven regressive otherwise; never been this far and it's hard to get excited by his opening effort for this yard this month (Trojan Sun behind).

runners.comment: No explanation offered latest; should be competitive off this mark if the headgear helps
runners.name: Aajej
runners.spotlight: Maiden who promised to be suited by the step up to this trip last time, only to disappoint (no explanation offered); yard been among the winners and he should be competitive off this mark if the first-time headgear helps.

16:20.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Resurgent 8yo; far from disgraced at Wolverhampton last week; unlikely to be far away
runners.name: Alligator Alley
runners.owner: R J H Limited And Ruth Carr

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: It was very easy. I think five furlongs is going to be the key to him, I don't think he stays six really. We've bounced and done things right. I'm not sure if it was much of a maiden but he gave me a nice feel today. He was behind some proper horses in maidens. Even though he wasn't getting near to them it was proper, nearly top-class, form in the book - Donnacha O'Brien, rider

runners.spotlight: Resurgent 8yo who completed a hat-trick at Wolverhampton two weeks ago and was far from disgraced when third there last week; successful three times over C&D and unlikely to be far away despite a rising mark.

stable_tour.quote: Won a couple of times last year including at the Racing League. He wants five furlongs in fast conditions and there's a nice race for him at York in May before the Epsom Dash in June. He's capable of popping up in those types of races. 19-04-24

He had a long career with David O'Meara before coming here and I'm pleased to have him because he's a lovely looking sort. He had his first race for us at Newcastle last month, running without any headgear and coming fourth of eight. Headgear will be an option next time he runs. 09-04-25

runners.comment: Shaped quite well when third at Kempton; thrown in on best form; Billy Loughnane rides
runners.name: Twilight Jet

prev_owners.owner: Michael Iavarone & Julia Iavarone & Michael Ocallaghan

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Abergwaun Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It's a very sharp five at Tipperary, hence the headgear, but it kept Twilight Jet concentrated. We'd lots of dreams and aspirations after he won the Lacken but  he was very sick after Ascot, then had colic surgery since and later slipped on a hard surface so needed surgery on his hock. This year was race to race so and he had a good blow afterwards. The headgear may stay on. He could go to Newbury or further afield in the coming months and may stay in training - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Lacken Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Twilight Jet doesn't know when to stop. He's a very good horse. He's as tough. He got better and quicker with every run. He went to the Breeders Cup and that might have been one race too many for him. He's come back bigger and stronger this year and even quicker I think. He's the real deal - Leigh Roche, jockey.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The plan was to make the running but we got a nice lead into it and the race couldn't have gone any better. Twilight Jet has plenty of speed and handled the drop back to five. He liked this ground but is quite versatile in that regard - Leigh Roche, rider.

runners.spotlight: On a long losing run and 0-3 on AW but he shaped quite well when third of ten over 6f at Kempton at the start of this month and may well be suited by the drop back in distance; thrown in on his best form and the booking of Billy Loughnane catches the eye.

runners.comment: 6f stretched his stamina last time and he shaped well; major player back at 5f
runners.name: Hiya Maite

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Hiya Maite was unlucky last time that Jeans Maite was in the race and she was in form. On her day there are not many that can beat her round here, it was quite a competitive race as well - Lewis Edmunds, rider.

runners.spotlight: All his wins have come at 5f so it was no surprise that he faded into sixth of 13 over 6f here at the end of October; has a good record on the straight course here and he's lower in the weights on the AW than for quite some time; might be the answer.

runners.comment: Posted personal best to win easily over C&D; 10lb rise demands even more improvement
runners.name: Ziggys Triton
runners.spotlight: Strong in the market and posted a personal best to win over C&D ten days ago in convincing style; a 10lb rise demands even more improvement but he's clearly in top form.

runners.comment: Four 5f wins last winter; may well have needed latest outing; better expected today
runners.name: Master Of My Fate
runners.owner: Ms Janelle Cao, Ross Harmon & Partner

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Master Of My Fate jumped really well and the more he's racing the more he's improving. I'd like to think when he gets back on turf he will do the same - Jason Hart, jockey.

quotes.race: Trevor Woods Memorial British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C & D) Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Master Of My Fate been training well at home. I'm very pleased with how he did it. You can only beat what's put in front of you, but we've always liked him and I was delighted to see him win - John Quinn, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Progressive on the AW last winter, winning four times over 5f, twice here; may well have needed the run after five months off when last of seven to Alligator Alley at Wolverhampton 13 days ago; dropped 2lb as a result and likely to make more of an impact now.

stable_tour.quote: He beat very little when winning at Pontefract on his debut but he beat them very well and also ran well in a novice at Lingfield, even though he wasn't in love with that track. Then it didn't look like he stayed 6f at Newcastle. I'd imagine we'll drop him back to 5f and he could be one for decent sprint handicaps. He's been gelded and I think that will help him. 20-03-24

runners.comment: Raced too freely when last of nine on latest start; the hood goes on now
runners.name: Monks Dream

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: They weren't the tactics we really wanted to employ but Monks Dream did the same thing the last day, he just rushed the gates before they opened. In a race like that over five furlongs when you miss the beat you're going to be held up. The way the race worked out, perhaps if he was handy he might not have finished as well as he did. Now let's see if he can transfer that form to grass - Sean Kirrane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Has registered all three wins at Newcastle, the most recent in March, but he finished last of nine there on latest start; raced too freely that day and the hood goes on now.

stable_tour.quote: He won't run early as he's been very backward. It was the same last year, but he progressed well when he came out and is a tough horse. He's one for six-furlong races in mid-season. 23-04-24

runners.comment: Third to Alligator Alley over C&D last time and much better off today; big player
runners.name: Star Chorus
runners.spotlight: Goes well at Southwell and he was third to Alligator Alley over C&D four weeks ago on his first outing for Mike Murphy; meets the winner on more favourable terms today and he's high on the list.

runners.comment: Bubbling under for current yard, not beaten far last time; interesting with cheekpieces on
runners.name: Solvency
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Alice Haynes as 2yo; yet to strike in three runs for current yard but there have been clear signs of promise and he wasn't beaten far when sixth to Alligator Alley at Chelmsford earlier this month; interesting back over the same C&D as his most recent win and with cheekpieces fitted.

runners.comment: Three 5f wins in 2025 including at Newcastle recently; makes Southwell debut today
runners.name: Jm Jhingree
runners.spotlight: Three 5f wins in 2025 including at Newcastle at the start of this month; creditable fourth there two weeks ago; makes Southwell debut today.

runners.comment: Thoroughly reliable; better than ever when winning at Lingfield; should go well again
runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly reliable and better than ever of late, coming from the rear when winning over 5f at Lingfield 25 days ago; placed on both her previous runs here and a 6lb rise should not stop her being competitive.

runners.comment: Knocking at the door, third over C&D two weeks ago; in the mix off an unchanged mark
runners.name: The Fixer

prev_owners.owner: Stamford Bloodstock, Comte Guillaume De Saint-Seine Et Al

runners.spotlight: Has dropped a long way in the weights for current stable and he's now knocking at the door, in front for a long way when third of 13 over C&D two weeks ago; in the mix off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Won at Yarmouth and Wolverhampton and has remained in reasonable form; in the mix
runners.name: Stipulation
runners.owner: Horn And Trumpet Lads & S & A Mares
runners.spotlight: Won at Yarmouth (1m2f) in August and Wolverhampton (9.4f) in September and has remained in reasonable form since; not proven over this far but shapes as if he'll stay; in the mix.

runners.comment: 0-15 in handicaps but knocking at the door and likely to be in the thick of things again
runners.name: King Chaos
runners.spotlight: 0-15 in handicaps but he's knocking at the door, typically finishing well when close second of 11 at Newcastle (1m2f) last week; likely to be in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: Third over 1m4f here 16 days ago; 2lb below his last winning mark and high on the list
runners.name: Spec Of Light
runners.owner: R G Robinson & R D Robinson
runners.spotlight: Saw out the longer trip well enough when third over 1m4f here 16 days ago, but returning to 1m3f will not inconvenience him in the slightest; 2lb below his last winning mark and high on the list.

runners.comment: Arrives in top form; nudged up 2lb for recent Wolverhampton second; commands major respect
runners.name: Mr Nugget
runners.spotlight: Fine efforts over 9.4f at Wolverhampton of late, winning in November and going down by a neck eight days ago, and he's just as effective over this C&D; nudged up 2lb but commands major respect once more.

runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.comment: Returns from over three months off and his best efforts are over shorter distances
runners.name: Berkshire Phantom

prev_owners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub

runners.spotlight: In decent heart when last seen in September but he now returns from over three months off; has winning form here but his best efforts are over shorter distances; others preferred.

runners.comment: 0-17; never a threat on stable debut at Lingfield 11 days ago; has a bit to prove
runners.name: Extrication
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who was never the slightest threat when sixth of eight on stable debut at Lingfield 11 days ago; has a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Off the mark at Wolverhampton and 1m6f might have stretched him next time; possibilities
runners.name: Top Of Pleinmont
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at Wolverhampton (1m4f) in October and 1m6f might have stretched his stamina next time; has possibilities back down in trip.

runners.comment: Last four runs have been over 7f/1m; ran poorly two weeks ago and probably best watched
runners.name: Bizarre Law
runners.spotlight: Campaigned over a wide variety of distances and his last four runs have been over 7f/1m; ran poorly at Wolverhampton two weeks ago and probably best watched now stepped back up half a mile.

runners.comment: Shaped nicely on last two outings, sixth at Newcastle on latest; might be ready to strike
runners.name: Whatacracker

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P A Johnson & C H Stephenson

quotes.race: Lake District Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Ryan (jockey) did a great job and it's just a horse that's taken us a little while to figure him out. We started Whatacracker over seven because he shows lots of speed at home and we've gradually stepped him up. We thought he'd win at Newmarket last time and he disappointed us a bit but what we see at home is what we've seen on the track today - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Sole win from 25 starts came on turf in July 2023 but he has shaped nicely on AW on his last two outings, coming from a long way back when sixth of 12 at Newcastle (1m4f) on latest; slipping in the weights and might be ready to strike.

runners.comment: 0-24 but running creditably at present; should be thereabouts on Southwell debut
runners.name: Knight Of Magic
runners.spotlight: 0-24 but he's running creditably at present, fifth of 11 at Lingfield 13 days ago; should be thereabouts on Southwell debut.

runners.comment: Well treated on best form but increasingly unreliable and was reluctant to race last time
runners.name: Broadstone
runners.spotlight: Well treated on best form but is becoming increasingly unreliable and was reluctant to race last time; probably best watched.

runners.comment: Veteran; not beaten far at Wolverhampton last time and has each-way possibilities
runners.name: Busby
runners.spotlight: Veteran; below par in three runs after a summer break, although he wasn't beaten far at Wolverhampton on latest; won on this course at this time last year and has each-way possibilities.

runners.comment: Poor maiden who was well held when last seen in August; difficult to recommend
runners.name: Stoneacre
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who was well held when last seen in August; difficult to recommend.

12:18.race_name: Philip And Tommy Lifelong Racing Fans Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase

runners.breeder: Mrs Mossie Hayes & Mr Tom Hayes
runners.comment: Best effort 12 days ago when second over C&D (good to soft) in the first-time cheekpieces
runners.name: Bridge Court
runners.spotlight: 6yo maiden whose best effort came 12 days ago on first visit to this track, when second of seven over C&D (good to soft) in the first-time cheekpieces on chase debut and he was miles clear of the third; up 3lb but should be open to further progress; a leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who's going to be a lovely novice chaser next season. He was very disappointing at Wetherby last time but before that ran a really nice race at Carlisle over a 2m1f trip that was too short for him. He's a lovely, big horse and maybe that Carlisle race took a bit more out of him than we thought, so he's having a bit of a break. 22-01-25

runners.comment: Second favourite on handicap debut latest (3m); major improvement is needed; chase debut
runners.name: Grandads Cap
runners.spotlight: Fell in his only point-to-point and unseated rider in one of his four starts over hurdles; soundly beaten on handicap debut (hooded first time) on latest and while it's eyecatching that he was second favourite that day and he may have been stretched by 3m, major overall improvement is nevertheless needed; chase debut gives him a bit more to prove.

runners.comment: Solid sequence; two wins in October; probably thereabouts but needs extra to win this
runners.name: Couldbeaweapon
runners.spotlight: While not in the sort of form he used to be capable of, he's clocked up an extremely solid sequence in the last six months or so, including two wins in October; probably thereabouts again but needs extra to win this.

stable_tour.quote: He was a decent buy at £5,500 as he's won twice, at Southwell and Sedgefield, so it's job done really. They were bad races, so we won't get carried away, but he'll skip round places like Catterick in the winter. He doesn't like going up and down - it was a poor contest at Sedgefield and he was left in front when the clear leader fell. Tom Midgley thought he'd have caught him - I wasn't so sure, but we have enough bad luck so we'll take it. He runs on Thursday. 29-10-25

runners.comment: This switch from cheekpieces to visor needs a positive response; another career-low mark
runners.name: Mutual Respect
runners.spotlight: Won twice over fences in autumn 2024; not so good this season, collecting third prize on all three occasions and today's switch from cheekpieces to visor needs a positive response but he also has another career-low mark.

runners.comment: Chasing on last three outings, winning by a nose in first-time cheekpieces on latest
runners.name: Uncle Al

quotes.race: The Prodrive Shopfitting Ltd Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: All Uncle Al has done is improve since we switched him to fences, and it's really helped his concentration too. After being hampered he had plenty of time to get back into it, and Aaron [Anderson] gave him such a patient ride. He battled so well to the line and we're all really happy with him - Jessica Bedi, trainer.

runners.spotlight: His debut was in April; sent chasing on last three outings and raised his game to win by a nose at Sedgefield (2m5f, first run on soft) on latest, leading in the final strides in first-time cheekpieces; 2lb higher today on what's likely to be very different ground but he should have more to give.

runners.comment: Inconsistent but won twice over fences last season and went in again on his latest start
runners.name: Bravethewaves
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but won twice over fences last season and went in again when always front rank at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) on latest outing; back up 3lb but he'll have a big shout if this is another of his good days.

runners.comment: 8yo who is 2-36 over fences; hasn't fired on his last four starts; career-low mark
runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.spotlight: 8yo who is 2-36 as a chaser, so not easy to win with; it last happened over C&D on New Year's Day but he was evens in that four-runner race and hasn't fired on his last four starts; career-low mark does not greatly persuade.

12:53.race_name: Sky Bet For The Fans Maiden Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Irish point second who has been 2nd in a bumper and 3rd on both hurdle starts; contender
runners.name: Ballyeaston
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish point in March (3m, soft); subsequently second in a bumper at Stratford (2m, good) and third on both starts over hurdles (2m1f/2m4f, good to soft); a possible.

runners.comment: £160,000 buy after close 2nd in Irish point; interesting on stable/hurdles debut
runners.name: Kakas Cousin
runners.spotlight: Bought for £160,000 after finishing short-head second in an Irish point in December 2024 (3m, yielding); winner has since won two bumpers, latest over 1m7f here for Willie Mullins; interesting on stable/hurdles debut.

stable_tour.quote: He was just touched off in his second point-to-point and the winner has gone on to win a bumper at Cork for Emmet Mullins and Paul Byrne. He's a nice type who we like at home and he'll be running over two and a half miles when we get some soft ground. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Some promise in bumpers but tailed off last of 12 on only completed start over hurdles
runners.name: King Kodiak
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in bumpers, but hard to fancy having finished tailed off last of 12 on only completed start over hurdles.

runners.breeder: Hoguenet, C Guy, Nbb Racing, C German
runners.comment: Well beaten in 2 Irish points, a bumper and, after a wind op, a maiden hurdle; more needed
runners.name: Siege Of Acres
runners.spotlight: Well beaten fourth in two Irish points; ordinary form in a bumper and a maiden hurdle (both over 2m1f), last time when returning after a wind op; improvement needed.

runners.comment: 42,000 euros buy; ran out in a UK point in March; no easy task on rules debut
runners.name: Annie Mcgrath
runners.spotlight: Bought for 42,000 euros in June 2023; ran out at the third on only start pointing in March; has no easy task on rules debut.

runners.comment: Second in two bumpers and placed in all 3 hurdle runs; 2m3f should suit; worth considering
runners.name: Centurions Sister
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two bumpers; placed on all three starts over hurdles, last time finishing second at Musselburgh; should be suited by this step up in trip; worth considering.

13:28.race_name: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Won claiming hurdle in France; sound third on chase debut at Wetherby latest; a possible
runners.name: Galidam
runners.spotlight: Won a claiming hurdle in France (2m1f, soft) in September 2024; didn't show a great deal over hurdles for this yard, but more encouraging effort when third on chase debut at Wetherby last time (1m7f, soft); worth considering.

runners.comment: Won at Ludlow on 2nd chase start (first run after wind op); a possible despite 7lb rise
runners.name: Supreme George
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on second start over fences when winning a similar event by 6l at Ludlow at 20-1 this month (2m, good to soft; made all, first run after wind surgery); stiffer task off this 7lb higher mark; interesting.

runners.comment: Improved on hurdles form when winning at Kelso on chase debut; up 6lb; strong contender
runners.name: Classical Sting
runners.spotlight: Improved on his hurdles form when getting off the mark on chase debut at Kelso last month (2m1f, soft); has gone up 6lb but that form looks solid and he's a strong contender.

runners.comment: Carlisle hurdles winner; off the mark on second chase start; up 7lb; should go well again
runners.name: Powerofjet
runners.spotlight: Carlisle hurdles winner; off the mark on second chase start at Newcastle last time (2m, good to soft); up 7lb; should go well again.

runners.comment: Hexham winner in June; fair fourth next time, but below his best last twice; bit to prove
runners.name: Conquer The Breeze
runners.owner: Miss Hazel Crichton And M Barnes
runners.spotlight: Won a Hexham handicap in June (1m7f, good to soft); fair fourth at Perth next time, but wasn't at his best following a break on last two starts; bit to prove.

14:03.race_name: Sky Bet Super Sub Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 2-2 this season after wins at Hereford and Hexham; can go well, despite 12lb penalty
runners.name: Ninna Collina
runners.spotlight: Scored on seasonal debut at Hereford (2m, good) in October and bettered that form when following up at Hexham (2m, good to soft) last month; has 12lb penalty to shoulder here but can still play a major role.

runners.comment: Useful Flat racer; won heavy-ground hurdle this month; today's quicker surface will suit
runners.name: Azahara Palace

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We were disappointed when Azahara Palace got beat at Catterick, but I think the course caught her out. She's quite difficult to train, and was still learning here, but hopefully she'll keep progressing - Hughie Morrison, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Fairly useful Flat racer who built upon her very encouraging stable/hurdle debut when winning five-runner Hexham novice (2m, heavy) this month; penalised in a deeper race here but her Flat form suggests she'll be at least as good on the faster ground.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think she's a miler and I think she'll get 1m4f now. She ran last time at Newbury behind Burrito but the ground was too firm. The winner is a Group horse and I thought beforehand he was the one we all had to beat. She's got races in her and, although she'll run on fast going, she basically needs the speed to be taken out of the ground for her to be at her most effective. She could even run up to a mark of 90 on the right surface. 29-05-25

runners.comment: Scored on hurdle debut at Worcester in October, form that has been franked by the second
runners.name: No Tricks At All
runners.owner: M V Magnier, Mrs P Shanahan & Dash Grange Stud
runners.spotlight: Just a respectable fourth on bumper debut in the spring but improved to cause 18-1 surprise on hurdle debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October, form that has been boosted by the runner-up since; likely contender.

runners.comment: Made low-key debut when well-held fifth in heavy-ground Ayr bumper this month
runners.name: Berwick Law
runners.spotlight: Made low-key debut when well-held fifth in heavy-ground Ayr bumper this month (hooded); needs the quicker surface here to show her in a much better light.

runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mr N Farrell
runners.comment: Placed in good mares' maiden on hurdle debut; soft ground the excuse last time
runners.name: Crystal Days
runners.owner: Mrs S Lee And E Lee
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who was placed in what has turned out to be a good mares' maiden hurdle at Uttoxeter (2m, good) in October; well beaten on soft ground since but can fare much better now back on a quicker surface.

runners.comment: Improved form when placed at Huntingdon this month; can progress again; shortlisted
runners.name: Eastern Shores
runners.spotlight: Displayed significant improvement and belied 40-1 odds at Huntingdon (2m, soft; first-time hood) three weeks ago, keeping on from the rear to take third; open to further progress here and goes on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Raced too freely and was soundly beaten in soft-ground Wetherby bumper last month
runners.name: Flight To Bresil
runners.spotlight: Raced too freely and was soundly beaten when 25-1 for soft-ground Wetherby bumper on last month's rules debut.

runners.comment: Came second in two Irish points in March; market may guide before this rules debut
runners.name: Klassy Pearl
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two French jumps winners; dam French Flat/hurdle/chase winner; came second in two Irish points in March; market may guide before this rules debut.

runners.comment: Useful at her best on the Flat; sold for 10,000gns after two poor run; stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Roarin Success
runners.owner: Hale Racing, Lyle Farming Company & Ptnr

quotes.race: Village Hotels Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Roarin' Success had a little niggle at the beginning of the year so we've taken out time with her. I thought she'd need that on that ground, so I'm nicely surprised with that performance. We'll stick to a mile and find another handicap - Harry Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat at up to 1m2f for Harry Charlton but looked out of sorts on her last two outings and was sold for 10,000gns in the autumn; has a point to prove on stable/hurdle debut.

14:38.race_name: Sky Bet Club Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Winning pointer; sound efforts hunter chasing in the spring; chance on h'cap/stable debut
runners.name: Slaney Opera
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer who ran two sound races in hunter chases in the spring; hasn't run since good third at Stratford in May (3m3f, good); on a competitive mark on stable/handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has won 6 chases; best run for present yard when 2nd over C&D; chance but lacks recent run
runners.name: Rostello

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D L Whateley & Dr R D P Newland

runners.spotlight: Six-time chase winner; best run for current yard when runner-up over C&D in January (good to soft); could go well, but lacks a recent run.

runners.comment: Plenty of good runs last term but well beaten only completed start this season (November)
runners.name: Similar Story
runners.spotlight: Plenty of good runs over fences last season, including winning a novice handicap at Kelso (2m7f, good to soft); well beaten only completed start this term (November).

runners.comment: Off the mark for this yard over C&D last time; up 2lb; this looks a tougher race
runners.name: I See The Sea

quotes.race: Racing To School Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I See The Sea jumped well and travelled well throughout. He probably needed the run round Hexham last time and this track suited him better. - Jack Power, Jockey

runners.spotlight: Gained second chase win when beating Sputnik (2lb better off) by 2l over C&D last time (good; Stonegate tailed off); up 2lb but this looks tougher.

stable_tour.quote: He was a good second in an Irish point but was fifth of only six runners at Chepstow on his first start for us. He probably needs further over hurdles and is one that will improve a fair bit this season. 23-11-23

runners.breeder: Mrs A L Merry & Mr Brett Merry
runners.comment: Chepstow winner in March; placed on last two starts; each-way chance if going remains good
runners.name: Redbridge Rambler

quotes.race: Glidevale Protect Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: To carry that weight was a really good performance. It was almost like a summer's day today and Redbridge Rambler loves having the sun on his back and good ground. He comes alive at this time of the season. James [Best] gave him a lovely ride ? he never got tempted in going for glory too early and timed it to perfection - Martin Keighley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Chepstow winner in March (2m7f, good); placed at Ludlow (2m4f, good to firm) and Hereford (3m1f, good) on his last two starts; each-way chance providing the rain stays away.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Hereford on his last run. He suffers from stomach ulcers, but we seem to have got on top of those now. He's put two good runs together now and, on the back of his third last time out, he should be winning again soon. When he goes and wins, he looks impressive, like at Ascot and Chepstow. It's just trying to get him back in that top form, but he seems to be getting there. 12-11-25

runners.comment: All three chase wins at Cartmel; these conditions fine but pulled up at Ayr last time
runners.name: Judicial Review
runners.spotlight: 3-9 over fences, all wins coming at Cartmel (one over 3m1f and one on soft ground); pulled up at Ayr last time so has a few questions to answer now.

runners.comment: Yet to win over fences, but placed all 3 starts since cheekpieces tried; each-way chance
runners.name: King Of Cong

quotes.race: Locke Burger Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: \BKing Of Cong\P did it easy enough and really handled the conditions and the extra three furlongs. Terence's assistant Michael Browne said to jump him out in the first four and, if he was good enough, to take your chance. We didn't go too fast so it paid to be handy - Darragh Allen, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Yet to win over fences, but placed on all three starts since cheekpieces went on; conditions fine; has an each-way chance.

runners.comment: Yet to win under rules but has a chance on his second at Uttoxeter in October (3m, good)
runners.name: Scottish King
runners.spotlight: Yet to win under rules, but good second at Uttoxeter in October (3m, good; third won next time); has a chance on that form.

runners.comment: In good form this season with two wins over 3m at Hexham; fair 4th off 2lb higher latest
runners.name: Ballydangan
runners.spotlight: Has been in fine form this season, winning twice over 3m on good ground at Hexham and last time finishing a fair fourth off a 2lb higher mark there; could go well again.

runners.comment: Stable in fine form but all wins at shorter and well beaten last time he wore headgear
runners.name: Valence Daumont
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old and all his wins have been over 2m4f or shorter; stable has been in fine form and won over 2m3f here in January (soft); well beaten over C&D the last time cheekpieces were tried; overall has a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Hurdles winner; fair form over fences; conditions suit; one with a chance off good mark
runners.name: Mersey Street
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Fakenham in January (2m7f, good); some fair form over fences in the summer, and with conditions to suit and his stable going well now, he is one in with a chance having been dropped 5lb since last run (July).

runners.comment: Two wins on good to soft in March; some fair runs since; on a fair mark; one to consider
runners.name: Halfway House Lad
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 3m on good to soft at Newcastle in March; several good runs since; back on a fair mark and is one to consider.

runners.comment: 4lb lower than sole chase win (2m4f); well beaten last time; quite interesting up in trip
runners.name: Derracrin

quotes.race: Joseph's Amazing Camels At Northumberland County Show. Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Derracrin got away with it early. He still thought he was jumping hurdles. He was a bit low but as the race went on he got better and he got more confidence in himself - Lorcan Murtagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: 4lb lower than when winning at Hexham in May 2023 (2m4f, good); some fair runs since, but well beaten after a break last time; first run at this trip.

runners.comment: Good second to I Sea the See over C&D two runs back but pulled up last time; bit to prove.
runners.name: Sputnik
runners.spotlight: Second to I See The Sea (2lb worse off) over C&D two runs back but reportedly was never travelling when pulled up last time; bit to prove now.

runners.comment: 0-13; well behind I See The Sea and Sputnik over C&D two runs back; 10lb out the h'cap
runners.name: Stonegate
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who was a long way behind I See The Sea and Sputnik over C&D two runs back and has a stiff task from 10lb out of the handicap.

15:13.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: On last winning mark but needs to up his game after some below-par efforts this autumn
runners.name: Belvedere Blast

quotes.race: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Belvedere Blast likes it here, but the trip was a bit of an unknown. We've tried everything with him - headgear, trips and ground - but the slower pace helped him and he started to like it late on. This is his level - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Seven hurdle wins, the latest off today's mark at Market Rasen (2m7f, good) in August; should be okay over today's shorter trip but needs to up his game after some below-par efforts this autumn.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand horse to have around. When his mark is down to 100, he'll win his two or three races, but when he gets up to around 115, the handicapper has caught up with him. He's won over all sorts of distances and when he's on a going day, he has a good go at it. 07-08-25

runners.comment: Won three-runner maiden in October and may have some improvement to come in handicaps
runners.name: Tree Top Tyson
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo who did not need to improve to win three-runner Sedgefield maiden (2m1f, good) in October; just a respectable fourth of seven in Wetherby novice (2m, good) last month but may have more to offer over longer trips in handicaps.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice horse. He was second in a point-to-point in Ireland for Cormac Doyle, who I buy a lot of horses off as they do a great job with them. He's a typical four-year-old who'd had a run and needed a bit of time. He might go down the bumper route in the new year as he's that type. We think a lot of him. 11-12-24

runners.comment: Runs this track well and is well handicapped but would appeal more on slower ground
runners.name: Hajey
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, including this race in 2023 (soft ground); returns here after very respectable fourth at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft) last month and remains well handicapped on old form but would appeal more on a slower surface.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a grand servant. He's won four times but missed out last season as he likes bottomless ground and never got it. He won't be out in the summer but will be back in the winter. 21-05-25

runners.comment: Placed on both hurdling starts and ought to be suited by this move up in trip
runners.name: Escortkheops
runners.spotlight: Placed on both hurdling starts, more recently when third of 14 in Southwell maiden (2m, good to soft) this month; not obviously well treated for this handicap debut but the move up in trip ought to suit.

runners.comment: Absent since last spring but returns on a workable mark and with trip/ground suitable
runners.name: Soldierofthestorm

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Proudly Supporting British Racing Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Soldierofthestorm is a lovely horse. The Bond family own him and he's a homebred, which makes this special, and we've had him since he was a foal - Jonjo O'Neill jr, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: 2-11 over hurdles; absent since midfield finish in competitive series final at Punchestown festival in April but returns on a workable mark and with trip/ground suitable.

runners.comment: Left Olly Murphy after disappointing chase run in November; back hurdling for stable debut
runners.name: Gardener
runners.spotlight: Has some useful chasing form on his CV but left Olly Murphy after a disappointing run in November and switches back to hurdling for new stable with some questions to answer.

stable_tour.quote: He won two handicap chases last season and is at the top end of the handicap but he'll win again off a realistic mark. 24-10-24

runners.comment: Didn't fire last time but has claims if judged on Newton Abbot second in September
runners.name: Book Of Secrets
runners.spotlight: Didn't fire on latest outing in November but looked as good as ever when close/clear second at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good) in September and has possibilities if judged on that performance; hood refitted.

runners.comment: Returned to hurdling with creditable second at Wetherby in October; high on the list
runners.name: Camarrate
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on both Flat starts this year but returned to hurdling with creditable second to Singapore Trip at Wetherby (2m3f, good) in October and, still on a good mark, is a contender if in similar form here.

runners.comment: Placed on both starts since Wetherby win in October; likely contender again
runners.name: Singapore Trip
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form when beating Camarrate to score at Wetherby (2m3f, good) in October, after a break, and was placed on both subsequent appearances; no surprise if he's on the premises again here.

runners.comment: Found 3m on soft ground too taxing last time; might fare better here
runners.name: The Clonmel Kid
runners.spotlight: Seemed to find 3m on soft ground too taxing at Aintree three weeks ago and is now 0-6 over hurdles but drops back in trip here and has been given a chance by the handicapper; not ruled out.

runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles but in the mix if recent seasonal debut brought him on
runners.name: Caramelo Rapido
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but made quite encouraging seasonal debut a fortnight ago (2m4f) and is now 1lb lower than when going close at Carlisle (2m1f, good) in the spring; in the mix if that recent outing brought him on.

runners.comment: Unseated rider in a chase last time but won stylishly over hurdles two starts ago
runners.name: Wasthatok
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider in early stages of a chase here in November but looked in excellent nick when winning stylishly over hurdles at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) two starts ago and remains well handicapped on older form.

runners.comment: Won three times in first half of year but has very mixed record since
runners.name: Evenwood Sonofagun
runners.owner: Mrs D Chapman & Mrs E Quinlan

prev_owners.owner: Frank J Lynch & Michael Hartnett & W Obrien & A M Ryan

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Evenwood Sonofagun has been super consistent and ran a mighty race at Catterick where he jumped the last in front but ended up sixth. He's such an honest little horse and is the type who could benefit from a confidence boost like that - Lizzie Quinlan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Three wins this year, the latest two over 2m6f at Cartmel (good/good to soft) in May; back down to a good mark now but has become inconsistent and is not easy to predict.

runners.comment: Respectable fourth in recent Sedgefield maiden; open to improvement in handicaps
runners.name: Born Like Me
runners.spotlight: Very unexposed 4yo who kept on steadily for respectable fourth in Sedgefield maiden (2m1f, soft) this month; moves up in trip for this handicap debut and could have significant potential.

runners.comment: Unexposed handicap debutant with very similar profile to stablemate Born Like Me
runners.name: Scairp Dubh
runners.spotlight: Just behind stablemate Born Like Me when fifth in recent Sedgefield maiden (2m1f, soft) but has very similar profile to him, being unexposed after only three hurdle runs and open to improvement in handicaps.

quotes.race: Howden Neom Turf Cup (Group 2) (4yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Shin Emperor was definitely the best horse in the field. As long as he jumped well, the plan was to take the lead to avoid any disadvantages or interference. We'll go to the Dubai Sheema Classic next, but as for future plans we'll have to discuss with the owner. In my mind, I'd like to go to Ascot and York - Yoshito Yahagi, trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Danon Decile is a very, very good horse. He was excited before the race but he settled when he got into the stall. He ran a great race, travelled really well on the bridle. I expected him to run a similar race to the Tokyo Yushun [Japanese Derby] and he did it. I knew the field was very strong but I thought he was competitive. I am delighted we proved his ability here in Dubai - Keita Tosaki, jockey.

23:59.race_name: American Oaks presented by Cygames (Grade 1) (3yo Fillies) (Hillside Course) (Turf)

runners.name: Slick
runners.owner: Little Red Feather Racing, Sterling Stables & Marsha Naify

runners.name: Take A Breath
runners.owner: Chivalry Tbred Racing & Rancho Temescal Tbred Partners

quotes.race: Weatherbys Global Stallions App Coconut Cup Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Take A Breath really didn't handle the track and I was in the wrong place, but I was able to get first run on the horse on the inside. She was very tough and we'll see improvement when she steps up in trip at a more conventional track - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

runners.name: Resolve
runners.owner: California Racing Partners, Ciaglia Racing & Kevin Odonnell

prev_owners.owner: California Racing Partners & Ciaglia Racing Llc

runners.name: Atsila
runners.owner: Barry Fowler, Medallion Racing & Parkland Thoroughbreds

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Auguste Rodin Irish EBF Athasi Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: She got into that Bellewstown race because of the auction prices and missed the kick, something you shouldn't be able to do there, come from so far back. We threw Atsila in the deep end here but she's obviously a smart filly. I was half thinking of running her in a handicap but Barry (Fowler - owner) said no lets throw her into the Athasi and see where she stands. It looked a good field, fast ground and they went a good gallop so there's no fluke about it. She's quite lazy at home so hard to judge. I think she's deserved a crack at a big one - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

runners.breeder: Fred W Hertrich Lll & Robert L Tribbett
runners.name: Military Order

prev_owners.owner: Rashid Al Shehhi, Tawfiq Mohammed, Saeed Mohammed Al Shehhi
Hrh Prince Sultan Bin Mishal Al Saud

quotes.race: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Arabian Angel is still learning. Drifting in front was a sign he was lonely and green, when the other horse came to him he ran on strongly. He's always been held in high regard. He ran well first time then probably bumped into a good one at Haydock. He's a work in progress and will be even nicer next year, when we could be looking at Pattern races for him -   James Callow, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Hopefully Yes
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Abdul Aziz Bin Humaid Al Nuaimi

runners.name: Subtle Truth
runners.owner: Khalifa Matar Mohammed Matar Al Neyadi
